loans.name: Bunthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Bunthy C., 40, and her husband, Mr. Kong Roeun, 49, were married in 1987. They have three children – two sons and one daughter – all of whom are in school. The family live along National Road Number Six about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Bunthy has been selling desserts for ten years. Her husband is a farmer, but he hopes to create another business by driving a motorcyle taxi when he is free. Through this new business he will be able to generate additional income to support his family. Bunthy is applying for her first loan of $500 USD to purchase a motorbike for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike taxi for her husband

loans.name: Ebeneza Group

texts.en:
Mkunde is a member of the Ebeneza borrower group in Sakina, Arusha, she is 46 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 29,27,25 and 23 years old.

Mkunde has owned a Grocery business for 8 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 250,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Mkunde second loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 500,000 Tsh in order to buy more drinks for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Mkunde hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Lea, Naishiye are also the  member of the same borrower group, they also requested the amount of 450,000 to each one in order to expand their business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora A. is 41 year-old rice grower and a mother of five children from Trento, Agusan del Sur. Her eldest is 17 years old and all her children are attending classes in barangay public school. When she was young, she dreamed to become a teacher, but because of poverty she was not able to attend a college education.

Now that she is having her own family and children, she wanted to grow her business to send them to college and pursue a degree that they like. However, she needs a loan to be able to sustain her livelihood. She would like to request a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to pay for the rent of the farm equipments and pay the workers as well who helped prepare the land ready for planting. 

He chose CEVI because many of his friends are CEVI clients. They said about insurance coverage, low interest rate and friendly staff.  Now that he needs a loan for his business he is excited about cluster meetings and other learning activities.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Andua

texts.en:
Andua M. is 30 years old and married. Her husband is a mechanic, and they have four children, all in school. Andua runs a shop stocked with a variety of items. She is requesting a loan to purchase more stock for her shop. With the extra profits stemming from her loan, Andua hopes to expand her business by investing in yet more goods to sell.

About BRAC:

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, targeted towards war refugees returning to their native homeland, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase and stock more goods to sell in her shop

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
S. Ganbaatar is 49 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. His wife works as a storekeeper, his oldest son has finished school and works for a construction company in the capital city, and his two youngest daughters are university students.

Ganbaatar currently operates a mobile dairy product business in his town. He started this business in 2005 with capital of 100,000 MNT. Since then, he has grown his business and found much success. He attributes this success to his hardworking attitude and good communication skills. Today, his working capital exceeds 600,000 MNT. Ganbaatar has used the profits from his business to provide his children with a good education and improve his family's quality of life. For the future, he says, ”I wish to have my own store.” He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase new products to sell through his dairy trade business.

loans.use: To purchase new dairy products

loans.name: Dely

texts.en: Dely is 45 years old, married to Wilfredo, and has children. Her husband works as a farmer in their village of Palao, Solana, Cagayan, while Dely is a banana dealer. She buys bananas from her co-villagers or from banana farmers then brings the bananas to market to sell. Dely wants her business to grow and is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP through Kiva that she will use as additional capital for her fruit vending business. She hopes that her business will expand and that by persevering she will become a productive entrepreneur.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Jeaneth

texts.en:
Jeaneth H. is a rice grower and mother of four children, the eldest of whom is 14 years old. All she wishes for her children is that they will grow up to be responsible people and be able to pursue their studies in order to have a brighter future.

Jeaneth is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP from Kiva partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to finance her farm. The money will be an immense help in meeting expenses such as paying laborers and renting the farm equipment used during land preparation.

CEVI helps Jeaneth keep up a good harvest. The income helps her provide for all her family's needs and meet the daily expenses in her home.

loans.use: To finance her farm, e.g. pay laborers and rent farm equipment

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Mrs. Phal P., age 35, and her husband, Mr. Sat So, age 37, have five children – two sons and three daughters. One of their children is married and lives in a separate house, two of the children attend school and the other is still young. The family live in a small village off National Road Number Two, about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh City.

Phal's husband has been driving a motor taxi in Phnom Penh for ten years. Phal has been selling chickens for six months. She buys chickens from her village for resale in Takhmao market. She is requesting her first loan of $700 USD to purchase more chickens to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens to sell

loans.name: Juwa

texts.en:
Juwa is 25 years old, married, and has one child.  Her child does not go to school.  

Juwa E. is currently in the business of selling beans and maize flour.  She is requesting a loan to purchase eggs to sell.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house and rent it out.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to purchase eggs to sell

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en:
P. is a 46 year old open-minded and hardworking single mother. She lives with her four children in Arkhangai province in Central Mongolia. Her youngest daughter attends high school. Her older children have already finished school and have started working. 

She started her boot making and shoe repair business in 2002 with an investment of 14 USD. She makes Mongolian traditional boots and her children support her in producing and selling the products. After years of saving her profits, she now has nearly 270 USD in working capital.  Besides her shoe and boot production business, P. also grows vegetables in her yard in order to support her family's household needs. In the future, she not only wants to improve her business, but she is also thinking about expanding her business by opening a second location. P. is requesting a loan of 600,000 tugrugs (~415 USD) to purchase more raw materials to produce boots.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials to produce boots

loans.name: Aimshigguibaatar

texts.en:
Aimshigguibaatar S. is a 41 year old single father.  He lives with his two year old son, Bulganhangai, in Arkhangai province in Central Mongolia. He has lived at the same home for the past 17 years. His son currently attends a local kindergarten.  

Aimshigguibaatar operates a small iron production business in his town where he makes iron products such as water tank trailers and stoves. He manages the business and produces all of the products himself.  Aimshigguibaatar started his iron production business in 2007 with 80,000 tugrugs in capital. Thanks to his hardworking and open-minded attitude, he has developed a successful business and has used the profits to provide a better life for his family. Today, his business capital exceeds 700,000 tugrugs.  He is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (~1,035 USD) loan to purchase welding machine parts for his iron production business. 

Aimshigguibaatar hopes to continue to grow his business so that he can further provide a quality life and opportunities for his son. He says, “I dream that my son will become an educated and intelligent person.”

loans.use: to purchase welding machine parts for his iron production business

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en:
Oyun is 36 years old and lives with her husband and four children in the Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. Her youngest two daughters currently attend secondary school and one of her sons is a university student. Oyun currently operates a mobile grocery business in her town with the help of her husband, who also is a taxi driver. The couple own their own car and use it to operate the business. 

Oyun started her mobile grocery business in 1995 and has grown it into a successful operation. In 2002, the profits from the business enabled her to open her own grocery store, and her working capital now exceeds 1,200,000 tugrugs (about $830). Oyun says, “The success of my business improves my quality of life, and enables me to provide my children with a good education.”

She hopes to one day open a larger grocery store in a better location in her town. She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more supplies for her store.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for her store

loans.name: Chetra

texts.en:
Mr. Chetra C., 22, is single, lives with his parents along national road number one approximately 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Chetra has been a tailor for 2 months. He learned tailoring skill from Phnom Penh. He is asking for his first loan of $300 to purchase additional clothes and other materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes and other materials for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Mwandeti Group

texts.en:
Nanyori is a member of the Mwandeti borrower group in Ngaramtoni, Arusha. She is 35 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 22,18,15,10 years  old.She also cares for  other 4 dependents.

Nanyori has owned a maize business  for 15 years. She works 16 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Nanyori first`s loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Nanyori hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Ngoonamelo is another member of the same borrower group, she also requested the loan amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to expand  her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize for sale

loans.name: Hean

texts.en:
Mr. Hean L., 30, is pictured here with his wife, Mrs. Phalla Sorn, 41. They have been marred since 1999 and have two sons who are still young and attend school. The family lives aL. the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

For over three years, Hean has had full-time employment driving. His wife is a garment factory worker. He is requesting a loan of $600 in order to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Punsal

texts.en:
A. Punsal is 58 years-old and lives with her husband and two children in Uvurkhangai province in central Mongolia. Her husband is retired and her two children are in college. Her family moved to Uvurkhangai seven years ago and they live together in a one room apartment.

Punsal operates a ger (a monogolian nomadic felt tent) camp in the yard of her apartment building. Her business serves the many tourists and travelers that pass through her province. In 2004, Punsal started her business by building a ger and fencing in the yard around her apartment building. Her business found success and she expanded by building five more gers. She stays very busy during the summer tourist season, but her business dies down in the winter and she stores three of her gers. Punsal hopes to expand her business in the future. Her oldest daughter is currently finishing her final course to become a tourism specialist. Punsal said, “my daughter is graduating as a tourism specialist, I think we will expand our business.” In the meantime, however, Punsal must renovate and replace the covers of her aging gers. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 tugrug (approx. $870 USD) to renovate her gers.

loans.use: To renovate gers

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Mrs. Dina K., 27, and her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Sann, 35, live along national road number one about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2001 and have two children: one son and one daughter. The eldest son is in primary school and the youngest one is still young. 

Dina has been selling roasted fish for 10 years. Her husband has been a construction constructor for almost 12 years. He has his own motorbike and hopes to supplement his existing business by driving Tuk Tuk taxi. Through this new business he will be able to generate extra income to support his family. Dina is applying for her first loan of $500 to purchase a trailer to attach with the motorbike for her husband to drive Tuk Tuk taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to attach with a motorbike for her husband to drive Tuk Tuk taxi.

loans.name: Oyunbat

texts.en:
Oyunbat T. is 20 years-old and lives with her husband and two year old son in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. She has lived with her husband for the past four years in a comfortable ger (a Mongolian traditional felt tent) on a small tract of land they own. Her son attends a local kindergarten.

Oyun operates a cafe out of a rented room of an office building in the provincial capital city. She has much competition in the city, but feels that her hard-working nature and graceful character give her an advantage. Oyun started her cafe in 2008 with capital of 150,000 tugrugs (~105 USD). Through hard work she has established a strong customer base and stable operations. Today, her working capital exceeds 350,000 tugrugs (~246 USD). For the future, Oyun hopes to expand her business to better compete with other cafes in the city. Her and her husband are always working hard to attract customers to the cafe, and their dream is to one day build a house on their land. She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrugs (~703 USD) loan to buy more supplies for her cafe.

loans.use: To buy cafe supplies

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita or Warly as she was popularly known in their rural village in Salamague, Lamut, Ifugao. She is already a widow and have four children.  Despite of this, she works hard to earn a living and be able to survive poverty. Through her income from her general store, she was able to support the financial needs of her children. Warlita patiently maintains her store to be able to increase her daily income.  

To further maintain her business, she is now asking for a loan of Moreover, she is proposing to borrow additional capital from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP8, 000 that will be utilized in her store. With the help of the loan, not only that she can provide the needs of her family but she can also provide the needs of her customers through her store by having additional merchandise.  She hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her request.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Madukani Group

texts.en:
Sophia is a member of the Madukani borrower group in Ngaramtoni, Arusha. She is 40 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 23,20,14 and 10 years old.

Sophia has owned a cafe business selling food for 15 years. She works 14 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 50,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Sophia`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 TSh in order to buy more rice, cooking oil for her business,

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Sophia hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Joyce is another member of the same borrower group, she also requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: T buy more commodities

loans.name: Bellaflor

texts.en:
Bellaflor, or Angie as she is called, is living in Barangay Salamague, Lamut, Ifugao with her family.  Because of financial problems, she only finished elementary school. Despite that, Angie is determined to uplift her economic status through patience and hard work. She and her husband finance the education of their six children and hope to overcome the difficulties of life.  

Bellaflor and her husband own and manage a vulcanizing shop situated in Poblacion West, Lamut, Ifugao. They are also engaged in buying and selling wheel interiors which they acquire from Santiago City. The couple is able to earn at least PHP 4,000 a month.  They hope to develop their business so that they can meet the needs of their children.  She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders as business capital for their business.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Ankhtuya

texts.en: Ankhtuya is 35 years-old and lives with her husband and 13 year-old daughter in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. Her daughter currently attends a local secondary school and her husband works as a driver. Ankhtuya has a small dairy product trading business that she operates out of a rented stall at the local market in her town. She obtains her products by traveling to the countryside and buying from local herders. Ankhtuya started her dairy product trading business in 1996 with an investment of 50,000 tugrugs (~34 USD). Due to her hard work, friendly nature and good customer service, the business has been growing steadily and she has established a good reputation in her community. Today, her working capital exceeds 300,000 tugrugs (~200 USD). Ankhtuya hopes to use future profits from the business to save for her daughter's education. She is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~340 USD) loan to purchase more supplies for her dairy trade business

loans.use: to purchase more supplies for her dairy trade business

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en: Bolormaa is a 34 year-old friendly and hard-working businesswoman. She lives with her husband and two children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. Her oldest son is a university student and her youngest attends a local secondary school. Bolormaa currently operates a butcher shop in her town with the help of her husband. Her husband also supports the family by driving a taxi. Bolormaa started her butcher shop in 1998 with an investment of 50,000 tugrugs (~34 USD) and has grown it into a successful operation. Today, her working capital exceeds 600,000 tugrugs (~408 USD). Bolormaa has used the profits from her business to build a nice house for her family, and her dream is for her children to become educated and important people. She is requesting a 600,000 tugrug (~408 USD) loan to purchase more supplies for her butcher shop.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita K. is from the village of Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 39 years old. Tita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Tita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a sari-sari or general store. She sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste etc., in the local community. Tita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Tita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Tita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items for the sari-sari store. Tita is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to invest in expanding her business. This will be the third loan taken out by Tita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
“In everything you do, put God first and He will direct your path,” shared Lorna as she believes in this saying. She is a God-fearing resident of Salamague, Lamut, Ifugao. She is now a widow and has four children. Two of her children have already finished a vocational course and the other two are still studying in high school. She wants all of them to finish their studies so that they will get a good and decent job someday.

Lorna is a woman of strong faith and determination. She manages a vending stall in their place. Aside from this, she also roams around their village selling snacks in order to generate additional income.

Wanting the business to become progressive, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders as additional business capital. With this amount, she will be able to increase her merchandise like vegetables and kilos of fish.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Dolgormaa

texts.en:
B. Dolgormaa is 64 years old and lives with her grandson in Bayankhongor Province in central Mongolia. Her grandson is 16 years old and currently attends a local secondary school.

Dolgormaa operates a small meal service business out of her home. She prepares meals at her home and delivers them to her customers throughout her community. She started her meal service business in 2005 after retiring from a local school, where she taught for thirty-four years. Since then, her meal service has become popular in her community and she has many regular customers. She attributes her success to her good communication skills and honest, hardworking nature.

For Dolgormaa, family always comes first. She started her meal service business in order to support her grandson and hopes that he one day will attend university. She has also supported her two sons and a daughter-in-law with their student fees.

In the future, Dolgormaa wants to purchase an electric stove to help her increase the quality of her meals and the number of customers she can serve. She is requesting a 500,000 tugrug loan to purchase food supplies, and an electric oven for her meal service business.

loans.use: To purchase food supplies and an electric oven

loans.name: Veut

texts.en: Veut T. is an older woman, 49 years-old, and a married mother of six children. Four of the children are married and live in separate homes.  Veut T. lives in a small family home with her husband and the remaining two children. In order to earn a living, she has a piece of farmland on which she plants a rice crop.  Her husband, Kdong Mith, age 50, sells firewood that he cuts from the forest for a profit.  Veut T. is looking for a loan in order to buy a water buffalo which she will use to help with the hard physical labor of the farm work.

loans.use: To buy a water buffalo

loans.name: Elsita

texts.en:
"When there is unity, there can be progress," said Elsita. She and her family are living in the village of Salamague, Lamut, Ifugao. She has three children who are presently studying in the secondary and elementary levels of education. Elsita and her husband are both working hard to support the needs of their children, especially when it comes to education. They wish the best for their children and want them to become successful in the future.

Elsita’s primary source of income is through farming where she and her husband cultivate their farm lot twice a year. Furthermore, her husband also works as a construction worker whenever he is not working on their farm.

Elsita, on the other hand, is engaged in vegetable vending and her stall is located near their house. She wants to borrow PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders that will be utilized as additional capital for her vending business. She believes that, with her loan, her business will become profitable.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Ankhtuya

texts.en:
D. Ankhtuya is 39 years old and lives with her husband and three daughters in Arhangai Province in central Mongolia. All of her daughters currently attend a local secondary school.

Ankhtuya operates a sewing business in her town with the help of her family. The family also owns livestock which are maintained by her husband, who works as a herder.

Ankhtuya started her family sewing business in 2005 with an investment of 40,000 tugrugs (approx. $27 USD). She has found success in her trade and the business has been growing steadily. She attributes her success to her family's hard-working attitude and good customer service practices. Today, her working capital exceeds 500,000 tugrugs (approx. $345 USD). For the future, Ankhtuya says, “My dream is to expand my business, increase the number of livestock for my husband, and provide a good education for my children.”

Ankhtuya is requesting a 1,200,000 tugrug loan to purchase more materials for her sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics for her sewing business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Managing a general store is the business operated by Erlinda. She requests a loan amounting to PHP4,000 from Kiva lenders to further improve her small store. She hopes that her business will become productive and earn a higher income to support the daily allowance of her children and provide for the needs of their family. 

Erlinda is married to Edelberto. He helps her whenever she needs assistance in managing her store. Expanding her store is Erlinda’s goal to sustain the needs of her family, especially for the education of their seven children. One of their children is still studying while the other six are already married.

loans.use: Business improvement

loans.name: Ayush

texts.en:
D. Ayush is 31 years old and lives with his wife in the Bayankhongor province in central Mongolia. He currently operates a wood-handicraft business out of his home with the help of his wife. He makes many wood products but is best known for his furniture. He made all of the furniture for his home, and his primary customers are married couples buying furniture for their new homes and apartments.

Ayush started his wood-handicraft business in 2007 after moving from Ulaanbatar, Mongolia's capital city. It was at his previous job in the city that he became an experienced wood craftsman. He has found much success in Bayankhongor and recently purchased 150 animals as an investment after selling many carpentry items to people living in the countryside. 

Ayush is still young and has many aspirations for his business. For the future, he plans to build a  workshop in the province center near the market and wants to train 2-3 other craftsmen to work with him. Ayush is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrugs loan to purchase more wood for his handicraft business.

loans.use: To purchase more wood for his handicraft business

loans.name: Mirjavad

texts.en:
Mirjavad A. is 44 years old. He is married with two sons and helps his parents with the family expenses.

Mirjavad has been the owner of a small general store for more than 13 years. He sells foodstuffs for everyday use such as flour, sugar, macaroni, soft drinks, sweets (candies), etc. His motivation for requesting a loan is to be able to purchase more merchandise to stock his business. A larger selection of goods will attract more clients and generate a good monthly income to help his family.

Support this hardworking man of much strength and courage to keep working.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Enkhbaigalmaa

texts.en:
Enkhbaigalmaa D. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. Her oldest son is a university student and her younger daughters currently attend a local secondary school. Her husband, Chuluunbaatar, works in their town as an electrician.

Enkhbaigalmaa currently operates a small sewing business in the town. Her husband always helps out in his free time, and her oldest daughter helps her mother by sewing clothes. Her entire family has become very motivated to make the business successful. 

Enkhbaigalmaa started her sewing business in 2007 and has found success in her trade. She is known throughout her community as a humble and graceful person. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and one day own her own workplace. Her dream is to one day be able to build a new house for her family. She is requesting a 600,000 tugrug loan to purchase new fabric and thread for her sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase new fabric and thread for her sewing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Peanut butter making and vending is the business chosen by Cristina.  She lives in Calao East, Santiago City with her children.  She is 43 years old and married to Ronald.  The couple wanted to double their income from their peanut butter business thus they aim to borrow loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP4, 000 as additional business capital.

Cristina hopes to give her family a prosperous living thus she is really doing her best to become productive in her manufacturing business. She hopes to give her children a better future by managing well her business and through her patient and hard working. She also hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her with financial request.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Menjani Group

texts.en:
Rael is a member of the Menjani borrower group in Ngaramtoni, Arusha. She is 48 years old woman, she is married and a mother of 6 children. Her children are 25,23,20,13, and 11 years old.

Rael has  owned a maize business for 15 years. She works 10 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Rael`s first loan from BRAC-Tanzania, she requested the amount  of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Rael hopes to save money and expand her business.

Naitoboak is another member of the same borrower group, she requested the loan amount 200,000 In order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize for sale

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn P. was born in the village of Palao Solana, Cagayan. She lived at the village together with her husband Enrique who is also a native of Cagayan. They have three children: Joylito – 21 years old; Jessalyn – 19 years old and Richard – 17 years old. At the moment, only their youngest child is still studying. 

At present Rosalyn manages a hog raising business. The business is of big help in providing the needs of their family and their youngest child who is currently studying in college. She wanted to borrow a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP10, 000 in order to buy enough supply of feeds for her hog raising business. 

Rosalyn aims to become a successful hog raiser to uplift the living condition of her family. She enjoys doing her business and it really makes her happy seeing the daily development of her hogs.  She just hopes that lenders grant her loan request.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four cattle

loans.name: Rosevilla

texts.en:
Rosevilla is 40 years old and lives in the rural village of Annayatan, Enrile, Cagayan with her family. She is married to Romeo who works as a passenger tricycle driver and also maintains their farm. They are blessed with a happy family and she hopes to provide the important needs of their two children through her business and also improve their living conditions.

Rosevilla is hoping to borrow Php 5,000 from lenders in order to buy more stock of retailed goods to sell in her store. She hopes that someday her children will be successful in their chosen fields.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a native of Cagayan. She is already 42 years old and married to Dante who is a farmer in their village in Palao, Solana, Cagayan. They are blessed with five children with ages ranging from 15 to 23 years old. They live in an agriculture-based community where farming is the main source of income. Rice and corn are the main crops which they produce twice a year.

Wanting to help her husband in supporting the needs of their family, Elsa decided to engage in a direct-selling business. Through this, she has been able to provide the school allowances of their children.

Elsa is hoping that she will be able to obtain a loan of PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders that will be utilized as additional capital for her direct-selling business. She sells Avon and Natasha cosmetics products in their town. She purchases the products in the town proper of Solana and earns an income on a commission basis.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a businessman from Novomoskovsk where he sells women’s clothing, yarn and sewing supplies in the central marketplace. He has been in this business for 2 years. Presently, Alexander has about 6,000 Grivnyas in gross income. 

Alexander is seeking a loan of 10,200 Grivnyas to increase his working capital and to increase his trade as a result. His type of merchandise is unique at the market and always stays in demand among his loyal customers. Alexander is very energetic and he is determined to develop his small venture in the future. He believes lending assistance will be instrumental in achievement of this goal.

loans.use: To increase his turnover capital.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda T. is from the village of Talairon, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old. Erlinda is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a business selling dried fish to local community members. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Erlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP so that she can purchase additional dried fish to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Erlinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.  It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Hoda

texts.en:
Hoda is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon, with her husband and their four children. Hoda has owned a women’s clothing shop for ten years. Hoda has requested a loan of 2000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase clothes for her shop for the winter collection. She has been a microcredit client for nine years now and has always paid on time. 

Her previous loan helped her improve her shop by diversifying her sales. Hoda is special in her work because she has competitive prices. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and tourists. When Hoda first started her business, she had to face the competition. Hoda planned her business because she wanted to improve her financial situation. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for her shop for the winter collection.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
“Have faith in God and you will be successful in carrying out your plan”, says Perlita S. of Barangay Salamague, Lamut, Ifugao. She is married to Roberto  and they have seven children.  Despite of the hardships of life, Perlita is still determined to become successful in life by patiently maintaining her snack vending business and provide their children with better education.  

In this regard, Perlita is hoping to borrow loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5, 000.  This amount will be of great help for the improvement of her business. And aside from that, she also plan to use some of her loan to buy feeds supply for her hog raising business.  With the help of her husband, she was able to overcome their problems.  She is thankful to her family who are very supportive in everything she does. She hopes that her business will become more productive.

loans.use: business improvement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her restaurant.

loans.name: Josef

texts.en:
Josef is a 36 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their two children. Josef has been working as a taxi van driver since 1996. He also works as a school bus driver. Josef requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his van before schools starts. This is the first time that Josef has requested a loan.

Josef is special in his work because he knows how to take care of his clients. His clients can be anybody from his region, as well as students. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent work as well as he is known for his good reputation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by having a bigger bus.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his van.

loans.name: Mhamad

texts.en:
Mhamad is a 54 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their five children. Mhamad has owned a café for two years. In his café, you can find computers, billiards, baby foot and lots more. Mhamad requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his cafe. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time. 
Mhamad is special in his work because he knows how to take care of his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent work as well as improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his cafe.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 21 year old man who lives in the Bekaa. Husein has been selling used shoes since 2007. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase more used shoes to sell. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 

Husein is special in his work because he has competitive prices and sells good quality used shoes. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business he didn’t face difficulties. Husein decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving this business.

loans.use: To purchase used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, 40 years old, is married to Bonifacio who works as a farmer in their village. They have been blessed with eight children: Bryan Jhon, April Gay, Christian Mae, Jay-Jay, Jobelle, Ebony Dhaine, and Jhon Jerico. All of their children are enrolled in public school. Some are in college and high school while some are in the elementary level. The family lives peacefully in Barangay Annayatan, Enrile, Cagayan. 

Jocelyn aims to send all her children to college but she is worried because of financial difficulties that they are experiencing. However, she believes that by patience and hard work, she can achieve her dreams and to be able to provide for the needs of their children. She wants the children to be able to finish their studies.  

They manage both a furniture business and a hog-raising business. Their income in the business is of big help thus, she wants to maintain and somehow become sustainable for the progress of their family. She also wanted to request for a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 5,000 for further improvement of their small businesses.

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Lenjani Group

texts.en:
Jackline is a member of the Lenjani borrower group in Ngaramtoni, Arusha. She is 29 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 1 child. Her child is 10  years  old.She also cares for other 2 dependents. 

Jackline has owned a  maize business for 2 years, she works 10 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Jackline`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more  maize  for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Jackline hopes to save money and expand her business.

Sindeiyan is another member of the same borrower group, she also requested the amount of 200,000Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize for sale

loans.name: Khoder

texts.en:
Khoder is a 50 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their two children. Khoder has been selling fruits and vegetables since 1994. Khoder requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his work. This is the first time that Khoder has requested a loan. 
Khoder is special in his work because he likes his work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. He first started his business due to financial issues. He decided on doing his business because of his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his work.

loans.name: April Joy

texts.en:
April Joy is 20 years old and already married to Jayson who is a farmer in their village.  They are living a simple life in Annayatan, Enrile, Cagayan. The is an agricultural community where farming is the main source of income of most residents. April is an electronic load retailer in their village.  She sells cell phone loads.  In this way, she was able to assist her husband in providing their basic needs.  

At present, she would like to borrow a loan of PHP5, 000 from the KIVa lenders that she can use as additional capital for her reloading business.  She wanted to strengthen the business in order to increase her income and be progressive.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Matim Group

texts.en:
Ndubulai is a member of the Matim borrower group in Ngaramtoni, Arusha. She is 45 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 18,13 and 10 years old.


Ndubulai has owned a crops business selling maize and beans for 10 years. She works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Ndubulai`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more crops for sale.

With the additional profit she gains fom the use of this loan Ndubulai hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Napili is another member of the same borrower group, she also requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more crops

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is engaged in the hog raising business. She lives in Tammuco Sto. Nino, Cagayan with her family.  She is married to Jeffrey, a simple farmer and they have four children: Joeden-14 years old; Rica Mae-10 years old; Shaina Carla-5 years old and Michaela-4 years old. They are all enrolled in public school near their home. Eden is hoping that she and her husband can afford to send their children to college.  

Eden wants to request financial assistance from KIVA lenders in the amount of PHP10,000 for the maintenance of her business. Eden is lucky because her husband helps her in managing the business. This loan will be utilized to buy piglets and feed supply. She believes that maintaining the business will greatly help her in supporting their family and so with the education of their children.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Mrs. N. Ruth is a promissory woman of forty years old who owns a drug shop located in Lyantonde Trading Centre, along Kooki Road. She has worked in the area for ten years. She is using this loan to purchase more drugs for her drug store business so that she can meet the growing demands of her customers. She is married with one child and hopes to provide the best for her child. She is a happy businesswoman and hopes to be self-sufficient with her business. More so, her future plan is to obtain rental houses so that she can attain more income to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs for her drug store.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to two sons and three daughters, all of whom attend school. Joyce is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Konongo, a town in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She runs a grocery store by the street in her community. Joyce buys her goods from Kumasi, a nearby city. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy all kinds of provisions in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy provisios for her store.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is forty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to six sons who all attend school. Florence is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is a trader who deals in ladies’ underwear. She hawks her goods in the community market and also sells goods in other towns. Florence procures her goods from Kumasi, a nearby city. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy textiles in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ladies’ underwear

loans.name: Gervase

texts.en: Mr. T. Gervase is a promissory business man of thirty-two years old, married to one wife and blessed with one child. His shop business is located in Lyantonde trading centre along Market Street of which he has operated the business for over three years. He is using the loan to purchase more whole sale items such as smearing jelly, sauce pans, flasks, dishes, steel wire, stoves, cups, plates, cooking oil, rice, among others for sale. He is a hardworking business man whose dream is to obtain cow farm so that he can be getting milk for sale to get more profits.

loans.use: To purchase more whole sale items such as smearing jelly, sauce pans, flasks, dishes, steel wire, stoves, cups, plates, cooking oil, rice, among others for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cover the costs of labor and buying manure

loans.name: Matim Group

texts.en:
Dorisi is a member of the Matim borrower group in Ngaramtoni, Arusha. She is 21 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 1 child. Her child is 2  years old. She also cares for other 1 dependent.

Dorisi has owned a clothing business for 6  years. She works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit  approximately 30,000  Tanzanian  shillings.

This is Dorisi`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Dorisi hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Namyori  is another  member of the same borrower group, she also  requested the loan amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothines  for sale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is thirty-nine years old. She is divorced and has given birth to one child, a son who currently attends school. Agnes is a hardworking woman who lives with her son in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Agnes runs a snack bar in her community. She sells all kinds of soft drinks and pastries in a shop by the roadside in her community. She procures her goods from Kumasi, a nearby city. Agnes has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy minerals and pastries in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy minerals and pastries

loans.name: Enock

texts.en: Mr. T. Enock is a promising thirty-two-year-old man. He has owned a workshop selling timber in the Lyantonde trading center for over two years. He wishes to use this loan to invest in his business by purchasing quality timber. Enock targets carpenters and builders as his daily customers. He is a married man who wants to give the best possible to his two children. His plan for the future is to work very hard, gain more profits, obtain livestock, and be able to adequately support his family.

loans.use: To invest more in his timber business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up on palm nuts

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua is thirty years old. She is divorced and has given birth to one son and one daughter, both of whom currently attend school. Akosua works hard to provide for her family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. 

Akosua trades in printed textiles—fancy, java and wax prints. She sells them in the community market and treks to other towns to hawk her goods as well. Akosua procures her goods from textile depots in Kumasi, a nearby city. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy textiles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acheter des fertilisants et payer du labour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Baatarsuren

texts.en: Baatarsuren is a 46-year-old carpenter who lives with his wife and two college-student children in Uvurkhangai province in central Mongolia. He started a carpentry business in 1996 along with his wife. In their business, he does the carpentry work while she paints the products. They produce wooden parts of ger (nomadic housing tent) and its furniture. Since the business is his main source of income, his biggest priority is providing high quality products.  They live in their own house that he inherited from his parents. His ultimate goal is to make sure their children receive a good education and become good people. Baatarsuren requests a loan of 600,000 Tugrugs to purchase more timber to make more durable and high quality products.

loans.use: To purchase more timber

loans.name: Byambadorj

texts.en: Byambadorj is 32 years old and lives with his wife and 5-year-old daughter in Uvurkhangai province in central Mongolia. He currently operates a flour and rice trade business out of a shipping container at the local food market in his town. Byambadorj purchases goods for his business in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. Byambadorj started his flour and rice business in 2008 with the help of his wife. Since then, his business has grown steadily, and today his working capital exceeds 2,500,000 Tugrugs. He attributes his success to his good selling and communication skills. Since his work place is not very comfortable, Byambadorj hopes to one day have his own store. He works hard everyday to achieve this goal. He requests a loan of 3,000,000 Tugrugs to purchase more supplies for his flour and rice trade business.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies

loans.name: Ruhayima

texts.en: Ruhayima is 30 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, a son and three daughters who are all in school. She is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells porridge in the mornings by the roadside in her community. She procures her raw materials from nearby towns. Ruhayima has been in business for over 20 years and wants a loan to buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure and other inputs

loans.name: Ayi

texts.en: Ayi is thirty – three years old. She is widowed and has two sons who are in school. She works hard to provide for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Ayi is a trader. She runs a provision store. She has her shop by the street in her community. She buys her goods from Kumasi. Ayi has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy all kinds of provision in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: David

texts.en: Mr. S. David is a promising man of thirty-four years who owns a textile shop located in Lyantonde trading centre where he has been working for four years. He is using the loan to purchase more clothing material and ready-made clothing to sell. He is a married man blessed with one child. He is a hardworking businessman whose dream is to prosper and be successful in life.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing material and ready-made clothes

loans.name: Fuseina

texts.en: Fuseina is thirty – eight years old. She is married and has given birth to one child, a daughter who is in school. She is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and daughter in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Fuseina is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice and stew in the mornings by the road side in her community. She procures her raw materials from Kumasi. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure and other supplies

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: a son and three daughters, who are all in school. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Rose is a trader. She trades in footwear. She procures her goods from Kumasi and sells in her community market. She treks to other towns to sell as well. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy footwear in bulk

loans.name: Chimed-Ochir

texts.en: Chimed-Ochir D. is a 43 year old who lives his wife and three grown children in Uvurkhangai province in central Mongolia. His two older children are college students and the youngest is a high school student. He currently operates a butcher business selling meat to local residents through a stall at the local market. He buys meat directly from herders in the countryside, while his wife sells meat at the stall. Chimed-Ochir started his business in 2001 with capital of 550,000 tugrugs ( ~1,305 USD) . Because of his and his wife's hard work and strong customer service skills, his business has been successful. He says, "I would like to give a good education to my children." Chimed-Ochir requests a 1,000,000 turgug (~704 USD) loan to purchase more meat. At the picture: Chimed-Ochir and his spouse.

loans.use: to purchase more meat

loans.name: Gordon

texts.en: Gordon is forty – eight years old. He is married and has given birth to six children, all in school. He works hard to be able to provide for the family. Gordon lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. He is a trader. He runs a provision store. He has his store by the street in his community. Gordon buys his goods from Kumasi. He has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy all kinds of provision in bulk to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy provision

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is forty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: a son and three daughters who are all in school. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Joyce lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Joyce is a trader. She trades in all kinds of soap – washing, toilet and powder soap. She hawks (goes door to door) to sell in her community market and treks to other towns to sell as well. Joyce procures her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cartons of soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: faire un stock de noix palmistes

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is thirty – six years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, two sons and one daughter who are all in school. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Joyce is a trader. She trades in foot wears. She sells in her community market and treks to other towns to sell as well. She procures her goods from Kumasi. Joyce has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy foot wears

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is twenty-five years old. She is single and has no child. She lives with her parents in a family house in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Beatrice is a trader. She trades in printed textiles – fancy, java and wax prints and lace materials. She hawks (goes door to door) to sell in her community and treks to other towns to sell as well. She procures her goods from textile depots in Kumasi.

Beatrice has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy textiles in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de l'huile rouge

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters who are all in school. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Vida is a baker. She bakes and supplies bread to retailers and beverage sellers in her community. Vida procures her goods – bags of flour, margarine and other ingredients from Kumasi. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy flour

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all girls and in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Dora is a trader. She trades in printed textiles – fancy, java and wax prints and jewels. She hawks (goes door to door) to sell in her community and treks to other towns to sell as well. She procures her goods from textile depots in Kumasi. She has been in business for over eighteen years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy textiles in bulk

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is 28 years old. She is married and lives with her two children. She was not available at the time, so her husband is shown in the photograph instead.

Dalal is a very hard worker and exerts herself as a cattle-raiser. Each day her livestock increases and her animals are highly valued at the markets.

Now, Dalal wants to increase the number of livestock she keeps. In order to do this she is requesting a loan of $1000. Be an important part of the growth of Dalal’s business!

loans.use: To purchase more sheep to expand her business

loans.name: Maaga Group

texts.en:
Ester is a member of the Maaga borower group in Mwanjelwa, Mbeya. She is 28 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 6 and 3 years old.

Ester started her own business selling rice for 5 years, she works 5 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Ester`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 100,000 Tsh in order to buy more rice for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Ester hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Yude is another member of the same borrower group, she also requested the loan amount of 100,000 in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice for sale

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita A. is a 46-year-old businesswoman who has multiple activities but manages to divide her time wisely.  She lives in Bagong Silang, Caloocan City.  Her husband Prudencio, 49, is an employee. They have two children, the eldest is in college and the other is in high school.

Anita is into direct selling of cosmetics.  Like most Filipina women entrepreneurs, she gets rebates from items that she gets from reputable cosmetics and apparel companies on consignment (Avon, Sarah Lee, Board Walk, Natasha, etc.) and sells them to customers on an installment basis.  She also makes rags from fabric trimmings and sells them to customers.  She also repacks and retails powder detergent.  She is also selling electronic load credits for mobile phones.  These combined activities give Anita a sure net income of at least P16,000.00 a month.

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2005.  She has learned from the cooperative the value of saving for the future.  She used her savings for the renovation of their house.  She wishes to see all her children finish their education.

Anita has applied for a new loan with the cooperative amounting to P50,000.00 as additional capital to keep her businesses going.  



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: As additional capital to keep her businesses going

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of red oil

loans.name: Fayzeh

texts.en:
Fayzeh is 28 years old and lives with her husband and three children. At home she tries to take care of her family in the best way possible. Because of her economic situation, she had to find some way to make money, and with her husband's support she was able to open a store near her house.
 
Fayzeh is very happy with the way her business has grown, and she is sure that it will continue to improve so that she can use her profit to expand her store. With the $1,500 that she is requesting, she will increase the amount of merchandise she offers and will make improvements to the store so that it is more attractive to the public.

 Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the husband of entrepreneur. In Palestine, it is culturally unacceptable to some people to post a picture of a woman to the Internet. However, the loan is to the female entrepreneur.

loans.use: Increase the amount of merchandise in her store

loans.name: Mafiat Group

texts.en:
Stella is a member of the Mafiat borrower group in Mwanjelwa, Mbeya. She is 24 year old woman, she is married.

Stella has owned a clothing business selling clothes  for 2 years, she works 10 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 250,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Stella`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Ester hopes to save money and expand her business.

Eliza is another member of the same borrower group, she also requested the loan amount 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her crops business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for  sale

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita T. is a 53-year-old general store owner who lives in Tala West, Caloocan City.  Her husband, Henry, is a school administrator.  

Amelita concentrates on selling books and school supplies.  Most of her clients are students from her husband’s school.  She also sells bottled water and other refreshments.  She makes more than P16,000.00 per month.  

She became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006.  Her profits are helpful in improving their way of living.  Amelita has just finished repaying her previous loans with the cooperative and has applied for a new loan in the amount of P14,000.00.  She will use the funds to purchase at least two computer units.  She wants to offer computer services to her clients soon.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase two computer units for her bookstore

loans.name: Janibichi Group

texts.en:
Roida is a member of the Janibichi borrower group in Mwanjelwa, Mbeya. She is 40 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 18,15 and 10 years old.

Roida has owned a vegetable business fro 4 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 170,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Roida`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to pay school fees, get more food for family and expand her business.

Anastanzia is another member of the same borrower group, she also requested the loan amount 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her fruits business.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetable

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For purchasing more sugar, soap, sodas, salt, etc for more stock in her retail shop.

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Agness is a member of the Makunguu borrower group in Mwanjelwa, Mbeya. She is 50 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 20,17,13 years old.

Agness has owned a charcoal business for 5 years, she works 10 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Agnes`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Agness hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: the repair of his car (taxi)

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Miss N. Ruth is a grocery shop owner in Bubaare cell, Mpiira Street. She is 35 years old. She wants to use the loan to purchase more sugar, soap, sodas, salt, etc for her retail shop. She aspires to own a large-scale grocery to sell a wide range of commodities in the same location to attract many customers. She has been running her business for over 10 years. She is a married woman whose husband is a headmaster at a certain primary school and they have two children between six and ten years in the primary level.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, soap, sodas, salt, etc for her retail shop.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 25 years old and married with two children. He lives in Hebron, Palestine.

Mohammed has a poultry business where he raises birds and sells both birds and eggs. He is requesting a loan of $2,100 to purchase more birds to sell. He says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more birds to sell

loans.name: Yinusa

texts.en:
Yinusa rents tables and chairs. She is 43 years old and married with four children. She has been in the business since 1998.

Yinusa hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more tables and chairs to rent. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tables and chairs to rent

loans.name: Abidemi

texts.en: Abidemi sells provision. She is 27years old and married with 2 children. She has been in the business for sometime now. She hopes for the loan amount of N40, 000 to purchase more provision to sells. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase provision to sell

loans.name: Yoramu

texts.en:
Dr. Y. Yoramu is a promising man, forty years old. He carries out laboratory services and he has been doing this for over twenty years. He is using the loan to obtain some more machines for his laboratory.

Dr. Y. Yoramu is married with three children schooling. His future hope is to increase his inventory and create employment for others. More so, his dreams are to increase his production of bananas since he has a plantation, and to construct more rentals for income generation.

loans.use: To obtain more machines for his laboratory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing and stocking condiments

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a 27-year-old single man who lives in Hebron, a city of Palestine.

Raed has been working as a car mechanic for four years. He also sells new and used spare parts. He requests a loan of $2,100 USD from Ryada in order to purchase merchandise for his garage.

Raed thanks all of you who kindly respond to his request.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for his garage

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy D. est une dame de 63 ans, marié et mère de 6 enfants. Elle fait du commerce de légumes et en même temps de l’embauche ovine et bovine. Elle souhaiterait avec ce prêt développer son activité afin d’assurer à sa famille de bonnes conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité.

loans.use: Faire du commerce de légumes et de l'embauche ovine, bovine

loans.name: Akinwade

texts.en:
Akinwade sells charcoal. She is 35 years old and married with three children. She has been in the business for a long time.

Akinwade has finished repaying her first loan and is grateful to all the lenders for the support they gave to her. She is requesting a new loan of N80,000 to purchase more charcoal to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Marie Andrée

texts.fr: Marie Andrée F. est une femme mariée de 47 ans, mère de 7 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce d’arachide et d’huile d’arachide qu’elle transforme elle-même. Son souhait est de renforcer son capital et ce prêt lui permettra aussi de subvenir aux besoins familiaux.

loans.use: Faire du commerce d'arachide et d'huile d'arachide

loans.name: Maria Sara

texts.en:
Mrs. B. Maria Sara owns a boutique selling clothes and it is located in Rwengiri trading centre. She wants to use the loan to purchase more clothes to increase the stock of her shop.

Mrs. B. Maria Sara is forty-five years old and is a hardworking business woman who has been running her business for over twenty years. She is a widow blessed with one daughter aged sixteen years who is in secondary school.

Mrs. B. Maria Sara employs two boys who help her to sell clothes in different markets on different days. Her good customer care is enabling her to attract many customers to her boutique.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
Rahima H. dedicates herself to the production and sale of potatoes, carrots and seasonal vegetables. Thanks to her work, she can offer her children and her family daily nutrition but, more than that, she feels active and useful supporting her family and helping her husband. Although this activity takes time and care, she does it with a lot of optimism, knowing that – thanks to this work – she can continue growing, not only economically, but also as a person.

Rahima has many desires in order to improve her plantation: for this, she hopes to acquire more land and different plants to better the variety of her delicious products. In so doing, she will increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: To purchase more land

loans.name: Jariya

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Jariya owns a salon in Rwengiri Trading Centre. She is 30 years old, married and blessed with four children between the ages of 6 months and 10 years old. Her husband is a herdsman of cattle and he sells produce. Two of the children are in school.

Mrs. K. Jariya wants to use this loan to purchase more hair relaxers, hair extensions, rollers, etc. for her salon. She aims to own a large scale salon for ladies so that she can attract an awesome number of customers from her community. So far, she has been running her business for over eight years.

loans.use: To  purchase more hair relaxers, hair extensions, rollers, etc.

loans.name: Amsat

texts.en: Amsat is into video recording.  He is 37 years old and married with two children. He has been in the business for the past 14 years. He hopes for a loan 40,000 nairas to purchase more materials to record. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more video recording material

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 35 ans et 2  enfants. Elles vivent avec leur mari et enfants  dans des familles élargies dans le quartier Banankabougou de la ville de Fana, Région  de  Koulikoro  République du Mali. 
Ces femmes font des activités diverses qui vont du commerce d’articles divers à la restauration. Elles ont fait la connaissance de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  à travers des liens d’amitiés. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles comptent acheter, des pagnes et tissus, des céréales, et une grosse quantité de condiments alimentaires sur le marché de Bamako et effectuer leurs ventes  sur le marché de Fana à une clientèle riche et variée. 
Elles comptent obtenir chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé dans l’activité, dans les frais de santé et d’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group are all married women. Their average age is 35 years old and they have, on average, two children. They live with each of their husbands, children and extended family in the Banankabougou neighbourhood of Fana, in the Koulikoro Region of Mali.
These women work in a variety of trades ranging from selling various items to running restaurants. They learned about the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso through friends.
They are on their fifth solidarity loan. Their previous loans were all fully and properly repaid.
They plan to buy lengths of cloth, cereals and a large quantity of condiments at the Bamako market to then sell to a rich and varied clientele at the Fana market.
They hope to each make a monthly profit of 20,000 XOF, which will go towards their businesses and children’s healthcare and schooling.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various items

loans.name: Benkelema Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkelema sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 40 ans et 2  enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des familles traditionnelles  dans le quartier Banankabougou de la ville de Fana, Région  de  Koulikoro  République du Mali. 
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers relations professionnelle et d’amitié. Elles font des activités diverses qui sont entre autre l’habillement, la nourriture etc, et sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement rembourses. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt elles veulent acheter des articles divers tels les pagnes, du savon,  des céréales et condiments alimentaires pour la restauration au niveau de Fana. Leur clientèle est diverse et variée.
Elles comptent obtenir 15.000FCFA de bénéfice mensuel chacune. Les bénéfices seront réutilisés dans l’activité et serviront à subvenir à quelques dépenses familiales.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Dembagnouma sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 41 ans et 4  enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des familles traditionnelles et résident dans la ville de Fana, quartier Banankabougou Région  de  Koulikoro République du Mali. Ces femmes sont unies par ses relations socio-professionnelles et ont fait la connaissance de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso à travers des liens d’amitiés. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles  comptent acheter avec ce prêt, du charbon de bois, du bois de chauffe et du lait auprès des paysans des villages environnants de Fana. Elles effectuent leurs ventes essentiellement au comptant et en gros  à Bamako (capitale du Mali) à une clientèle constituée  généralement de revendeurs.
