Elles comptent obtenir 20.000 FCFA de bénéfice chacune  par mois. 
Les bénéfices  seront non seulement  réutilisé dans l’activité mais aussi serviront à payer les frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
The members of Dembagnouma Group are married women who, on average, are 41 years old and have four children. They live with their husbands and children in traditional families in the neighborhood of Banankabougou in the city of Fana, region of Koulikoro in the Republic of Mali. These women are united by their socioprofessional relationship and their bonds of friendship let them know the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their fifth group loan with our institution and they have repaid their previous loans on schedule. They will use their loan to buy charcoal, firewood and milk from farmers in the villages near Fana. They sell their merchandise mostly cash and wholesale in Bamako, the capital city of Mali, to their clients who are usually retailers. They expect to make an average profit of 20,000 CFA francs (US$44) each per month. They will not only reinvest their profit in their businesses, but also use it to pay for their children's school fees.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various articles

loans.name: Allen

texts.en: Mrs. Allen M., a promising 29-year-old business lady, owns a shop selling used clothes. The shop is located in Kabwohe Trading Centre, where she has been running her business for five years, so far. She is a married woman blessed with two children. Although her husband is an accountant in the sub-county Bushenyi district, he helps her to run the business in his free time. She works hand in hand with him running the shop. She is using this loan to purchase more clothes to enable her to improve upon her business. Her hope is to expand her shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.name: Kotognongontala Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Kotognongontala sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 36 ans et 2  enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des familles traditionnelles et  résident dans la ville de Fana, quartier Banankabougou, Région  de  Koulikoro  République du Mali. 
Ces femmes se sont  connues par des liens de parenté, d’amitié et font le commerce d’articles divers et la restauration. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles veulent acheter du riz, des condiments alimentaires pour la restauration et  des tissus auprès des grossistes des différents marchés de Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali).
Elles font leurs ventes dans  le marché de Fana, surtout les jours de foires où elles réalisent beaucoup de ventes avec l’arrivée des forains et des routiers. 
Elles comptent obtenir chacune, mensuellement  10.000 FCFA de bénéfice qui sera réutilisé dans les activités et servira à s’occuper pour d’autres besoins.
texts.en:
The members of the group Kotognongontala are married women who average 36 years of age and 2 children. With their husband and children, they live in traditional families and reside in the city of Fana, Banankabougou district, Koulikoro region, in the Republic of Mali. These women know one another through ties of kinship and friendship, and they do commerce in various goods and in food service. They are on their fifth solidarity loan, and the preceding ones have all been properly repaid. They want to buy rice, some condiments for food catering, and some cloth from wholesale vendors at different markets of Bamako (capital of Mali). Sales are made at the Fana market, especially on fair days, when many sales are made with the arrival of fair vendors and truck drivers. The group members each plan on having a monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA that will be reused in business and will serve to take care of other needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Francisco Paulo

texts.pt:
Francisco nasceu na província nortenha de Niassa (a 3.200km de maputo) tem 43 anos de idade, casado, pai de quatro filhos, licenciado em educação física e gestão escolar e docente na escola pré-universitário de boane (escola secundaria Joaquim chissano). Seus filhos têm entre 3 e 13 anos de idade, os dois mais velhos a freqüentar escola no distrito de boane. Vive na casa própria com a família. A esposa também é funcionaria do estado afecta no Ministério de Plano e Finanças, como técnica de orçamento.

Cresceu na companhia dos seus progenitores e, no ano de 1985, saiu da província após conseguir bolsa para continuar com os estudos na cidade capital do pais (maputo). Terminou com os estudos em tempo regular e trabalha há mais de 20 anos com salário mensal de 11.500,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e Envia algum dinheiro para seus pais em Niassa.

Teve primeiro empréstimo no banco comercial (BIM) no valor não especificado, que se destinava ao inicio da construção da sua casa de alvenaria. 
Com a Hluvuku-Adsema este é o seu segundo empréstimo no valor de 25.000,00MT para compra de material de construção (louca de casa de banho). O credito fechado foi também de mesmo valor e finalidade.

Propõe se a reembolsar sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos. Sonha ver sua casa terminada e comprar uma quinta (um terreno maior para construção de mais casas de aluguer).
texts.en:
Francisco was born in the north province of Niassa (3,200 km from Maputo) he is 43 years old, he is married, father of 4 children, graduated on physical education and school management and is a teacher in the preparatory for university school of Boane (high school Joaquim Chissano). His children are between 3 and 13 years old, the oldest ones go to the school of Boane. He lives in his own house with his family. His wife works as an administrative at the Ministry of Plans and Finances, as budget technician. He was raised by his parents and in 1985 he left his province in order to get a spot to continue his studies in the capital of the country (Maputo). He finished his studies on time and worked for more than 20 years with a salary of 11,500MT which covers his family necessities and also sends money to his province in Niassa. His first loan was with the commercial bank (BIM), in order to start building his masonry house. This is his second loan with Hluvuku-Adsema for 25,000MT to buy construction material (ceramics for his bathroom). The previous one was for the same purpose and amount. He expects to pay without trouble in order to access more credit. He dreams to see his house finished and to buy a "quinta" (a larger space of land to build houses to rent).

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Dzigbodi Akuwa

texts.fr: D. Akuavi Dzigbodi est une femme âgée de 57 ans mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle habite à Franciscain un quartier de Lomé. Avec ce prêt, elle voudrait installer une cabine téléphonique dans sa boutique d'alimentation générale et acheter des cartes de recharge en vue de la revente afin d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires. Avec son chiffre d’affaires, elle voudrait achever sa construction.
texts.en:
D. Akuavi Dzigbodi is a 57-year-old married woman and the mother of 4 children. She lives in Franciscain, a district of Lomé. With this loan, she would like to install a phone booth and buy mobile phone recharge cards to resell in order to increase her sales. With her sales, she would like to have some construction completed.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a telephone booth

loans.name: Albazine

texts.pt:
Albasine Samissone Gumende nasceu no distrito de boane, tem 45 anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 3 e 22 anos. Os dois filhos mais velhos freqüentam escola (secundaria Joaquim Chissano). Não estudou para alem da 4 classe devido à falta de condições financeiras por parte dos seus progenitores.
Vive na casa própria somente com sua família e sem ninguém mais sob sua responsabilidade. A esposa faz trabalhos domésticos.

Nunca saiu de boane, mesmo a altura da guerra dos 16 anos, permaneceu vivendo de agricultura de subsistência e outros biscates. Ano de 2002 terminou com sucesso a formação de condução de automóveis, de ligeiros e pesados. Trabalho há mais de 3 anos na Fabrica de cimento de Boane (SURENA) como motorista e com salário mensal de 6.000,00MT. Iniciou com a construção da casa de alvenaria com o credito que recebeu em um Banco comercial (BCI). Após a conclusão, não preferiu continuar devido as modalidades de pagamento que não são flexíveis.

Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através de colegas tendo solicitado o primeiro empréstimo no valor de 15.000,00MT para dar continuidade com a construção da casa.
Este é o seu segundo credito no valor de 20.000,00MT para compra de material de construção (cimento, aros para janelas e outros) para a penúltima fase de construção.

Propõe se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos. Sonha ver a sua casa terminada para melhor confortar a sua família e posterior compra de mobília e outros bens de consumo.
texts.en:
Albasine Samissone Gumende was born in the district of Boane, he is 45 years old and is married and has 3 children who are between 3 and 22 years old. The two oldest go to school (high school Joaquim Chissano). He couldn't finished passed 4th grade because of his parents lack of financial resources. He lives in his own house with his family and doesn't have another responsibilities. His wife keeps their home in order. He has never left Boane, even during the war when he was 16 years old, he stayed working in agriculture and other odd-jobs. In 2002 he successfully finished his education on driving automobiles, light and trucks. He worked for more than 3 years at the Cement Plant of Boane (SURENA) as driver with a monthly salary of 6,000MT. He started the construction of his masonry house with a credit he received from a Commercial Bank (BCI). After finishing this loan, he preferred to stop because of the payment plan which wasn't flexible. He learned about Hluvuku-Adsema thru co-workers and requested the first loan for 15,000MT to keep on building his house. This is his second credit for 20,000MT in order to buy materials (cement, windows frames, among others) for the next phase of construction. He expects to pay the credit without any trouble and access to new credit. He dreams to see his house finished to support better his family and later on buy furniture and other items.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Mamou

texts.fr:
Madame Mamou D. est âgée  de 50 ans,  mariée et  mère de 8 enfants. Elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants au quartier Pelengana Nord  de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Secrétaire  de formation, elle embrassa les activités génératrices de revenus depuis qu’elle était  élève.  Après avoir mener plusieurs commerces (vente de parfums, chemises et robes pour jeunes), sans grande réussite, elle finit par apprendre le métier de  teinturière  auprès d’une amie. Après sa  phase d’initiation, elle exerce seule ce métier depuis 10 ans et jouit d’une grande réputation qui dépasse aujourd’hui le cadre de Ségou. Elle reçoit de la commande de l’intérieur du pays comme de l’extérieur principalement de la France où elle a sa fille mariée. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de son Gala (teinture) et surtout à la broderie des habits qui sont faits des mains des maîtres.
Pour faire de la teinture, elle dilue différents produits de teintures modernes et traditionnels dans de l’eau chaude ensuite elle trempe les tissus blancs  dans cette eau pour leur donner la couleur voulue. Les tissus teintés sont étalés sur une corde pour séchage et par la suite blanchis et soigneusement emballés.
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle grandissante elle a fait recours à   Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis  42 mois. Après 3 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels tous correctement bien remboursés, elle est à son 3eme  prêt individuel.
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 10 pièces de bazin moins, 10 kg de soude caustique et 8 kg de gomme arabique. Elle s’approvisionne  en  matières premières  sur place à Ségou. Madame  Mamou D. vend au comptant et  à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA qui lui  permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce et de prendre en charge certaines charges familiales. 
Son ambition est d’ouvrir un atelier de couture.

loans.use: Achat  de bazins et d’ingrédients pour la teinture.

loans.name: Liliana Yiovana

texts.es:
La señora LILIANA YIOVANA R. B., tiene 39 años, vive en el distrito de LA ESPERANZA , provincia de TRUJILLO, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EN ACCION.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, refiere que quiso estudiarla carrera de enfermería pero que sus padres no la apoyaron por falta de recurso económicos y por eso también tuvo que dedicarse al campo.
LILIANA es casada , tiene 1 hijos de 1 año de edad.
LILIANA se dedica a la venta de pollo, tiene  5 años viviendo en Trujillo, nos cuenta que ella vivía en Cajamarca y tenía una tienda de productos alimenticios al por  mayor pero cuando junto a su esposo realizó un viaje a Chepen a comprar arroz al por mayor le robaron toda su tienda, fue difícil para ella perder todo y por eso decidió venir junto con su esposo a Trujillo y empezar de  nuevo por ese motivo se encuentra vendiendo pollo en un mercado cerca a su casa.
El primer crédito de 200 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra  de pollos, una mesa y cuchillos.
Este crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar más pollos y criarlos, y también comprará pollos para vender.
LILIANA sueña con  tener un atienda de productos alimenticios como la que tuvo antes.
texts.en:
Liliana Yiovana Rodríguez B. is 39, and she lives in the La Esperanza district, Trujillo province, La Libertabd department, Perú. She belongs to the Mujeres en Accion Communal Bank. This business woman went to school until her fifth year of high school. She wanted to study for a career in nursing, but her parents did not support her because of lack of economic resources. Therefore, she had to work the land. Liliana is married and has a one year old child. Liliana sells chicken. She has lived in Trujillo for five years. She used to live in Cajamarca, and she had a wholesale food store there. When she and her husband traveled to Chepen to buy wholesale rice, her store was robbed. It was difficult for her to lose everything. She decided to come to Trujillo with her husband and start again. That is why you will find her selling chicken in the market near her house. She used her first loan for 200 PEN to buy chicken, a table, and knives. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she will buy more chickens to raise. She will also buy chickens to sell. Liliana dreams of having a food store like she had before.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens to raise

loans.name: Djénébou

texts.fr:
Madame Djénébou Thiero est âgée de 34 ans, mariée  et  mère  de 5   enfants. Elle  habite dans le 3ème  quartier  de la ville de Ségou,(quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali) avec son mari et  ses enfants dans une famille traditionnelle avec autres ménages.
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons familiales, elle commença très tôt le commerce auprès de ses 2 parents tous opérateurs économiques (le père tenait une boutique et la maman vendait des condiments alimentaires). Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage auprès de ces derniers, elle prendra son envol en choisissant de faire le commerce de boucles d’oreilles, de chaussures, d’habits et des  trousseaux de clés il y a de cela 13 ans, au marché  château de la ville de Ségou. Ses articles étalés sur une table se vendent  bien, cette vente nombreuse est due à son sens des affaires et de l’accueil mais également à la qualité de ses articles.
Dans le souci de mieux vendre à l’approche de la fête de ramadan et réaliser plus de bénéfices, elle fait recours à  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est en relation depuis maintenant 48 mois. Après 4 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels tous bien remboursés, elle est à 3ème prêt individuel qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 30 paquets de boucles d’oreilles et 125 paires de chaussures. Elle s’approvisionne   à partir du Burkina Faso et vend au marché en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle diverse et variée.
Avec ce prêt, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000 FCFA., qui lui permettra de se prendre en charge et de participer aux événements sociaux. 
Elle a comme ambition d’avoir une maison d’habitation.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel sells breads and fruits. She manages the business with her husband. She is 48 years old and married with 6 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more breads and fruits to sell. She thanks you fo4r the support.

loans.use: To purchase more breads sell

loans.name: Alfrezina

texts.pt:
Alfresina nasceu na província de Maputo, tem 44 anos de idade, divorciada e mãe de 3 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 7 e 24 anos, todos freqüentam escola. Estudou ate 9 classe e parou quando teve gravidez precoce.
Vive na casa cedida pelos pais, com a mãe e seus filhos. Separou se do marido logo depois do parto do ultimo filho de 3 anos.

Cresceu na companhia dos seus pais e só saiu quando teve que ir ao lar, na vila de boane, e antes de trabalhar fazia pequenos negócios.
Trabalha para uma organização humanitária no tema de HIV/SIDA denominada PFUCANE (que significa Despertai em língua local) como facilitadora comunitária. Recebe 4.500,00MT e trabalha ha mais de 3 anos.

Já teve empréstimo com o banco (Procredito) no valor não especificado que se destinava a compra de material de construção. Apos a conclusão, não preferiu continuar com o banco devido às modalidades de pagamento inflexíveis.
Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo com a Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 20.000,00MT para compra de material de construção de casa de alvenaria iniciada (cimento, blocos, areia, pregos e outros).

Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos com objectivo de concluir a sua casa. Sonha ver a casa terminada para poder confortar os seus filhos e posterior apetrecha mento.
texts.en:
Alfresina was born in the province of Maputo. She is 44 years old, divorced, and has three children between the ages of 7 and 24, who all attend school. She attended school until the 9th grade when she dropped out due to pregnancy. She lives in a home given to her by her parents, with her mother and children. She separated from her husband after the birth of of her youngest son, age 3. She grew up with both of her parents and only left when she had to go to her home in Boane. Before working she had small businesses. She works for a humanitarian organization focused on HIV/AIDS called PFUCANE (which means Wake Up in the local language) as a community facilitator. She earns 4.500,00MT and has been working there for more than 3 years. She had a loan with Procredito bank for an unspecified amount that was used for the purchase of construction materials. At the end of the loan, she decided not to continue with that bank due to inflexible payment options. This is her first loan with Hluvuku-Adsema, for 20.000,00MT to be used to purchase construction materials for a concrete house that has already been started (cement, blocks, sand, nails, etc.). She plans to pay the loan back without any problems so that she can have access to future loans with the goal of finishing her house. She dreams of seeing her home finished to provide comfort for her children and to later be able to equip/furnish it.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials ( cement, sand, blocks, etc.)

loans.name: Cedro Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Cedro, esta ubicado en la comunidad campesina Cedro, en el Distrito de Anco provincia de Churcampa, Huancavelica. Comunidad ubicada al margen derecho del río Mantaro y a una hora el distrito de Anco. Entre sus principales actividades económicas, destacan la ganadería y agricultura.

Lucila, es casada y tiene 04 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, negocio con el cual lleva varios años y el cual va creciendo poco a poco. Lucila, utilizará su préstamo para comprar más mercadería para surtir su negocio. Ella, tiene como meta, llegar a comprar una chacra, para poder cultivar café y cacao.

Claudia es casada y tiene 06 hijos. Claudia se dedica a la venta de ganado, los cuales lleva a las ferias para poder venderlos. Con el préstamo que solicita, comprará mas animales. Claudia tiene como meta inicial, hacer crecer su negocio y llegar a vender su ganado en provincia.
texts.en:
The Cedro Comunal Bank is located in the rural community of Cedro in the Anco district, Churcampa province, Huancavelica. The community is located on the right side of the Mantaro River and an hour from the Anco district. Among the primary economic activities are livestock and agriculture. Lucila is married and has four children. She sells groceries. She has been in this business for several years, and it is growing little by little. Lucila will use the loan to buy more merchandise to stock her business. Her goal is to buy a farm and be able to grow coffee and cocoa. Claudia is married and has six children. Claudia sells livestock. She takes the livestock to the fairs to be able to sell them. With the loan she is asking for she will buy more animals. Claudia’s initial goal is to make her business grow and to come to sell livestock in the province.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their businesses

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata H. est âgée de 39 ans, veuve et  mère de deux enfants. Elle vit dans le quartier Bougoufié de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région du Mali) chez son père avec   plusieurs autres ménages. 
Pour des raisons religieuses elle ne fréquenta l’école, que ses parents considéraient comme une voie de déperdition sociale. Dès son enfance elle fut orientée vers le commerce de couvertures et couvre-lits importés de la Mauritanie dont les parents sont originaires.  Devenue majeure, elle opta pour le commerce d’ atiéké (semoule à base de manioc), de  chaussures et d’habits depuis maintenant 21 ans au marché château de Ségou. Elle jouit d’une grande réputation et  d’une grande clientèle. Sa force de vente est due à sa propreté, son sens des affaires,  son  accueil  mais également à son prix abordable. 
Pour augmenter son volume de vente afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est en relation depuis 36 mois. Après 4 prêts solidaires et 1 prêt individuel tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel.
Elle compte utiliser  ce prêt pour acheter, 8 sacs d’atiéké, 15 complets de brodés et 10 paires de chaussures. Elle s’approvisionne à partir du Burkina Faso et  vend au comptant, en détail  et crédit  à une  clientèle  composée majoritairement de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de  60.000 FCFA qui permettra de subvenir à  ses besoins (achat de nourritures, habillements  pour elle et ses enfants car elle est veuve)
Son ambition est de construire une maison pour ses enfants qui ont perdu  leur père très tôt.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers.

loans.name: Rita Ana

texts.pt:
Ana Rita C. nasceu na província de Gaza, no distrito de chibuto (maior produtor de castanha de caju na zona sul do pais), tem 44 anos de idade, separada e mãe de três filhos com idades compreendidas entre 18 e 25 ano. O filho mais novo freqüenta ensino secundário. Ana Rita concluiu com sucesso o curso de Magistérios Primários no ano de 1982 e mais tarde fez o curso médio do mesmo ramo. Vive em boane na casa própria. Para alem dos filhos, sustenta uma sobrinha que vive com ela na mesma casa.

Saiu de chibuto juntamente com os seus pais quando tinha cerca de 10 anos de idade, para morar na vila de boane. Após a conclusão do primeiro curso,em 1983, trabalhou na escola primaria da Massaca e mais tarde casou se com o seu esposo. Está separada já há bastante tempo. Continua a trabalhar como professora numa das escolas de Boane e com salário mensal no valor de 7.600,00MT que aplica no sustento da família.

Já teve empréstimos em um banco comercial e, tendo fechado com sucesso, não preferiu continuar devido ao preço e modalidades de pagamento. Este é o terceiro empréstimo da Ana Rita com a Hluvuku-Adsema e segundo com KIVA no valor de 17.000,00MT para compra de material de construção (cimento, aros de janelas, barrotes e outros). O primeiro foi de 8.000,00MT e o segundo, que recebeu do KIVA, no valor de 10.000,00MT ambos para mesma finalidade.

Tal como os outros empréstimos, propõe se em reembolsar sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos com o intuito de finalizar a casa. Sonha ver a casa terminada para posterior apetrecha mento.
texts.en:
Ana Rita C. was born in the Gaza province, in the district of Chibuto (the largest producer of cashews in the southern part of the country). She is 44 years old, separated, and has three children between the ages of 18 and 25. Ana Rita successfully completed studies in Elementary Education in 1982 and later completed additional education in this same area. She lives in Boane in her own home. In addition to her children, she also supports a niece who lives with her as well. She left Chibuto with her parents when she was about 10 years old to live in Boane. After she completed her education, in 1983, she worked in the elementary school in Massaca and later was married. She has been separated for many years. She still works as a teacher in the schools in Boane and earns a monthly salary of 7.600,00MT which she uses to support her family. She has had loans with a commercial bank, and having paid them off successfully, decided not to continue with them due to the cost and payment options. This is her third loan with Hluvuku-Adsema and her second with Kiva. It is for 17.000,00 MT for the purchase of construction materials (cement, window bars, support beams, etc.). The firs loan was for 8,000,00 MT and the second, which she received through Kiva, was for 10.000,00 MT both for the same purpose. As with the other loans, she plans to repay this loan without problems in order to have access to future loans with the goal of finishing her house. She dreams of seeing her home finished and later equipped.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials ( cement, sand, sheet metal, etc.)

loans.name: Mariatou

texts.fr:
Madame  Mariatou  D.  est âgée de 39 ans et vit dans une famille monogame  avec son mari et ses 4 enfants au quartier Bougouni Lafiabougou de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas été à  l’école  par incapacité de ses parents de supporter ses charges scolaires, elle commença vite le commerce ambulant  auprès de sa  mère qui vendait des condiments alimentaires. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage couronné d’une expérience enrichissante, elle décida d’évoluer en solo en entamant  le commerce des condiments comme sa mère, au marché de Ségou depuis maintenant plus de 10 ans et jouit d’une notoriété. Ces marchandises mises dans de bons emballages  sont  bien disposées sur une étagère.
Dans l’optique de réaliser plus de bénéfice elle fait recours à   Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 39 mois. Après 3 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels tous correctement bien remboursés, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel.
Elle compte utiliser  ce prêt pour acheter, 4 cartons de cubes magies et  1 carton de concentrées de tomates. Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières à Bamako. Madame Mariatou D.  vend en détail, au comptant  et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte   réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA qui lui servira de se prendre en charge et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. 
Son ambition  est de construire une maison.

loans.use: Achat de condiments alimentaires.

loans.name: Manuela Beneilde

texts.pt:
Manuel Benilde L. nasceu na cidade de maputo, tem 45 anos de idade, casada e mãe de três filhos com idades compreendidas entre 11 e 21 anos. Todos os filhos freqüentam escola. Manuela fez a formação media de docência no Instituto de Magistério Primários da Matola no ano de 1996. Vive na casa própria com seu marido e filhos, mas também envia algum dinheiro para os seus pais que vivem noutro bairro do mesmo distrito.

Cresceu na companhia dos seus progenitores na cidade de maputo e mais tarde mudaram se para boane, deixando a casa de aluguer. O seu marido faz negocio de venda de madeira que adquire na província nortenha da Zambezia (a 2.500km de Maputo). Trabalha para o estado como Professora há mais de oito anos de experiência e com salário de 4.069,00MTmais uma parte dos 10.000,00MT de aluguer da casa da família deixada na cidade de Maputo.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos e com a hluvuku vai ser o primeiro credito no valor de 15.000,00MT para compra de material de construção (cimento, areia, blocos e outros) com objectivo de continuar com a construção da casa de alvenaria. Teve informações através de amigas e colegas de serviços que já beneficiaram de empréstimos com a instituição.
Propõe se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder a ceder a mais empréstimos com objectivo de terminar a obra. Sonha ver a casa concluída para posterior apetrecha mento.
texts.en:
Manuela Benilde L. was born in the city of Maputo. She is 45 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 11 and 21. All of her children attend school. Manuela completed studies in education in the Instituto de Magistério Primários (Institute of Elementary Education) in Matola in 1996. She lives in her own home with her husband and children. She also sends money to her parents who live in another neighborhood in the same district. She grew up with her parents in the city of Maputo and the family later the moved to Boane, renting out their house. Her husband sells wood that he acquires in the northern province of Zambezia (2,500 km from Maputo). She has been working as a teacher for the state for over 8 years and earns a salary of 4.069,000 MT plus a portion of the 10.000,00 MT from the rental of the family home in the city of Maputo. She has never had a loan with another bank. This will be her first loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 15.000,00MT for the purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, blocks, etc. ) with the goal of continuing work on the construction of her concrete block home. She learned about Hluvuku through friends and colleagues who had received loans through the organization. Manuela plans to pay the loan without any problems in order to have access to future loans to finish her home. She dreams of seeing her home finished and later equipped.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cmeent, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Amelia Esther

texts.en:
Previous loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=108857&_tpos=f&_tpg=h.  
Amelia is a member of The Orchids village bank. 
She is married, 45 years-old, and has three sons who are 24, 18 and 13 years old. For several years, Amelia has been selling breakfasts at the cafeteria of a company. She gets up at 4 am to prepare the breakfasts, sandwiches, and quinoa. On the weekends, she makes purchases with the help of her son and husband. 
Amelia needs a new loan of 1000 soles to buy sugar, boxes of milk, cheese, and eggs for making breakfasts. Her dream is that her business will grow and that her children will become professionals.

loans.use: buy sugar, boxes of milk, cheese, and eggs for making breakfasts

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Danaya sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne  40 ans et  4 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants, elles vivent  dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Balan, sous- préfecture de Fana Région de Koulikoro République du Mali.
Les femmes du groupe font le commerce d’articles divers tels, la cola, le pétrole, les biscuits, les pâtes alimentaires, les cigarettes, le thé, le sucre, le lipton,  des sachets de lait en poudre, de café, des boîtes de conserves etc. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens professionnel, de voisinage et parenté. 
Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles comptent acheter des articles divers (thé, sucre, bonbon, pétrole, produits alimentaires)  au niveau de Fana pour les revendre dans le village de Balan à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser approximativement 9.000 FCFA de bénéfice mensuel et par personne qui sera réutilisés dans l’activité et une partie sera utilisée pour les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The members of the group Danaya are married women who average 40 years of age and four children. With their husband and children, they live in traditional extended families in the village of Balan, sub-prefecture of Fana, region of Koulikoro, in the Republic of Mali. The women of the group do commerce in various goods, such as: kola nuts, kerosene, cookies, pasta, cigarettes, tea, sugar, Lipton teabags, coffee, canned foods, etc. The women know one another by ties of profession, community, and kinship. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers. They are now on their 11th solidarity loan. All the preceding ones have been properly repaid. They group members intend to buy various goods (tea, sugar, candy, kerosene, and foodstuff) in Fana, so as to resell them in the village of Balan to customers composed of women and men. The group members hope to realize about 9,000 francs CFA in profits each month and per person. The profits will be reused in the business, and a portion will be used for family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various store goods

loans.name: Juana Carmen

texts.en:
Juana, a 51-year-old separated woman, has one son who has finished university. She continues to sell lunch specials, but now to more clients, including a group of students that have come from different provinces in Peru to study at the University of San Marcos in Lima. She also sells lunches to the administrative personnel of the university. Juana needs a new loan of 1000 soles to buy an electric fryer and two rice pots. Juana wants to have her own tire shop. She is saving and is confident that she will succeed in fulfilling her dream. Juana is a member of The Orchids village bank.

Previous loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=108858

loans.use: To buy an electric fryer and two rice pots

loans.name: Rosa Ana

texts.en: Rosa is a member of The Orchids village bank. Rosa is 47 years-old. She is separated and has two children who work. Rosa makes lunch specials to sell at a company. She gets up very early to prepare the lunch specials because she distributes them before 1:00 p.m. Each day, she sells 45 lunches and people pay her at the end of each month. Rosa needs a new loan for 1,200 soles to buy supplies, such as bags of rice, sugar, potatoes, and meat. Her dream is to have a restaurant and she is working hard to fulfill her dream. This is Rosa's third loan. Click to read about Rosa's first loan and second loan.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as bags of rice, sugar, potatoes, and meat.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She sells drinks and provisions. Her husband is a civil servant. She hopes for the loan amount of N80000 to purchase more drinks. She thanks you

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Maria Lucila

texts.en: María is a member of the Las Orquídeas (The Orchids) Communal Bank. María is 65 years of age and married with three children, all of them adults and married. She works with her brother making bath sets. She is responsible of doing the decorations, like ribbon designs and embroidery. Maria has also decided to sell cosmetics from a catalog. Maria needs a new loan for 1,000 soles to buy toweling fabric, thread, and ribbon. Her dream is to become independent and she wants to start designing and making complete sets for bathrooms. This is Maria's third loan. Click for information about her first and second loans.

loans.use: To buy toweling fabric, thread, and ribbon

loans.name: Danaya De Saniya Yolla Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Danaya sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 48 ans et 2  enfants .Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Yolla, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parentés. Elles exercent  le petit commerce d’articles divers tels les céréales, les fruits et légumes, les condiments alimentaires etc. 
Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de mener à bien leurs activités génératrices de revenus. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt, une importante quantité de divers condiments alimentaires.
Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Fana auprès des grossistes pendant les jours de foires et les condiments sont revendus en détail, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit, sur place au marché à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser mensuellement chacune 15.000 FCFA de bénéfice. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of Danaya Group are married women who, on average, are 48 years old and have two children. They live with their husbands and children in traditional families in the village of Yolla in the sub-prefecture of Fana, region of Koulikoro in the Republic of Mali. They are neighbors or family members to each other. They have small businesses selling various products such as cereals, fruits and vegetables, food condiments etc. These women collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to successfully run their businesses and earn an income. This is their third group loan and they have repaid their previous loans on schedule. They will use their loan to buy a large quantity of various food condiments. They get their supplies at the market in Fana and sell them retail (cash and sometimes on credit) at the local market to a clientele made up mostly of women. They expect to make a profit of 15,000 CFA francs (US$33) each per month. They will use part of their profit to reinvest in their businesses and part of it to provide for their families.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food condiments

loans.name: Ivetti Nelly

texts.en: Ivetti is a member of The Orchids Village Bank. Ivetti is single and is the youngest of 8 siblings. She used to live with her parents and she studied sewing and design, which led her to a career at a workshop for many years. Ivetti has begun to sell her services in altering and repairing clothing. She is not now able to sew because she just suffered the loss of her father. He was 84 years-old when he died due to heart problems. It has been a very difficult time for her. Ivetti needs a new loan of 1,000 soles to purchase linen and threads for dressmaking, and other articles of clothing. Her dream is to have a dressmaking workshop. Click to read about Ivetti's first loan and second loan.

loans.use: To purchase linen and threads for dressmaking, and other articles of clothing

loans.name: Graciela Maria

texts.en: Graciela is a member of The Orchid Village Bank. She is 55 years-old and married. She had two children, but both died. However, she is happy to have two nieces who love her very much. Graciela sells breakfasts in the mornings with her husband. They have hired someone to help them. She has also begun another venture selling china sets. She sells them on Calle Pista Nueva in the district of San Juan. She works in the streets everyday until 5 in the afternoon. Graciela needs a loan of 1400 soles to buy glasses, cups, and pitchers. Her dream is to have a restaurant in another country. She would also like to visit her brother in Italy. Click to read about Graciela's first loan and second loan.

loans.use: To buy glasses, cups, and pitchers

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 37 years old and married with 4 children. She sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She has been in the business for long. She hopes for the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more foodstuffs, drinks and provisions to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Luz Y Esperanza Grupo 2 Group

texts.en:
Yanira S. V. is an associate of Esperanza International who has already successfully completed two loan cycles and is looking to start her third. She lives in a modest home with cement walls and a tin roof in Santiago, a city in the midwest of the Dominican Republic where running water and electricty are unreliable. She lives with her husband, mother, father, and her three children who are 9,14, and 17, all of whom attend the town's public school.
Yanira sells clothing, accessories, and jewelery to customers on street. Her business is the family's main source of income, which they depend on to buy food, clothing, educational supplies, and maintain the house. With a larger loan, she will buy more clothes and accessories to be able to gain more money and better support her family. She would like to thank you all for the support.

loans.use: Clothing, accessories, jewelery

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: La joven Luz Marina G. de 27 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, casada y con un hijo de 3 meses, su negocio es la venta de visituria en variedad, desde los 16 años esta en las ventas el cual inicio con ahorros, su esposo es comerciante y la apoya. Sus planes es poder terminar de hacer su casa. Con este préstamo  comprara materiales de construcción para hacer un cuarto y estar en mejores condiciones con su familia. A futuro es poder tener su propia tienda y no andar vendiendo ambulante ya que corre mucho peligro. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad del financiamiento ya que solo mediante el préstamo se puede salir adelante por que todo esta caro y los salarios no suben.
texts.en:
Luz Marina G. is 27. She lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She is married and has a three month old son. She sells a variety of jewelry. She has been selling since she was 16, which she started with savings. Her husband is a merchant, and he supports her. Her plan is to be able to finish making her house. She will buy construction materials with this loan. It is to make a room for the family to be in better conditions. The future plan is to be able to have her own store and not have to walk selling on the street because it is very dangerous. She thanks the institution for the opportunity of the loan. It is only through the loan that she is able to get ahead because everything is expensive and salaries do not rise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to make a room

loans.name: Dissiba Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Dissiba sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 4 enfants .Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Balan, sous-préfecture de Fana  Région  de Koulikoro, République du Mali.
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage, de mariages et exercent une même activité à savoir le commerce d’articles divers.  
C’est dans le souci de pérenniser leurs activités que ces femmes ont intégrés l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles veulent acheter,  une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires et divers autres articles (cola, huiles de fabrication moderne etc) sur le marché de Fana  pour aller les revendre au comptant, en détail et à crédit dans le village de Balan à une clientèle essentiellement féminine. 
Elles comptent obtenir 10.000 FCFA de bénéfice mensuel par personne, qui servira au réinvestissement  dans l’activité et à subvenir aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The members of Dissiba Group are married women who, on average, are 36 years old and have four children. They live with their husbands and children in extended traditional families in the village of Balan in the sub-prefecture of Fana, region of Koulikoro in the Republic of Mali. They are neighbors or family members to each other. They have all the same economic activity, namely selling sundries. These women joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to ensure the long-term success of their businesses. This is their eleventh group loan and they have repaid all their previous loans on schedule. They will use their loan to buy a large quantity of food condiments and other various articles (kola nuts, industrially produced oils etc.) at the market in Fana, travel back to Balan and sell their products retail (cash or credit) to a clientele made up mostly of women. They expect to make a profit of 10,000 CFA francs (US$22) each per month. They will use part of their profit to reinvest in their businesses and part of it to provide for their families.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various articles

loans.name: Patricia Erica

texts.es:
La señora  PATRICIA ERICA E. T., tiene 30 años, vive en el distrito de LA ESPERANZA , provincia de TRUJILLO, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal ESPERANZA UNIDA.
La empresaria presenta estudios técnicos superiores de cosmetología. Actualmente trabaja en el salón de belleza que tiene su tía, sólo los viernes y sábados.
PATRICIA es casada, tiene 2 hijos pequeños que dependen económicamente de ella.  Ella se dedica a la venta de artículos para regalos y productos de belleza, este negocio lo tiene instalado en su propia casa.
También deja sus productos en los puestos de sus amigas que tienen en el mercado cerca de su casa.
El primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió para comprar 2 vitrinas para exhibir sus productos.
Este crédito de 800 nuevos soles lo utilizará para  comprar productos e belleza al por mayor y poder luego venderlos a precio de catálogo y poder tener mayor ganancia.
También viajara a  Lima a comprar juguetes y regalos .
PATRICIA sueña con alquilar un puesto en el mercado, donde pueda vender sus juguetes, regalos y productos de belleza , pero prefiere por el momento esperar que su hija de 3 años cumpla 5 para que pueda trabajar con mayor tranquilidad.

loans.use: lo utilizara para  comprar productos de belleza al por mayor

loans.name: Khémesse

texts.fr: Khémesse G. a 52 ans, est mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle tient un commerce de mil, arachide, haricot et oseille. Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité et les revenus générés d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Khémesse G., aged 52, is married and the mother of eight children. She sells millet, peanuts, beans and sorrel in her store. Her loan will enable her to strengthen her business, increase her income and improve her children's living conditions.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To trade with millet, beans, peanuts

loans.name: Giovanna Melba

texts.en: Giovanna is a member of The Orchid Village Bank. She is married and 51 years-old. She has older children who work. Giovanna is dedicated to buying and selling dress clothes. She purchases her clothes on credit from a workshop. She sells the clothes at companies where her girlfriends and family members work. Giovanna needs a new loan of 1,800 soles to buy sweaters, light jackets, and elegant outfits for women. Her dream is to buy an apartment in another district. She is saving with her husband to fulfill her dream. Click to read about Giovanna's first loan and second loan.

loans.use: To buy sweaters, light jackets, and elegant outfits for women

loans.name: Ngwa

texts.en:
O. is the mother of two children. She attended school until the death of her father, who was the bread winner in the family, made her stop her education. With the frustration in her life, she became pregnant and was rejected from her family. She has been a very hard-working woman. With no husband, she was unable to cater for the children and had to relinquish her children to the care of her parents.

With her hard working spirit, she was introduced to GHAPE by one of her friends. She is gifted in planting and her very first loan was used to buy mesh for planting and seedlings for farming. She wants to use this loan to continue planting, and to buy seedlings and feed. With the profit from the loan, she plans to educate her children, buy a plot of land, and provide basics needs for the family.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings, piglets, poultry, feed, medication and mesh

loans.name: Aïssata

texts.fr: Aïssata S. est une jeune femme mariée de 34 ans, mère de 5 enfants. Elle fait de l’embauche bovine et aimerait renforcer son activité. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants.

loans.use: Faire de l'embauche ovine

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: La señora Marlene López de 36 años de edad, reside en el barrio la Primavera en la capital de Managua, su esposo se desempeña como conductor  y tiene dos hijos de 18 y 20 años de edad, los cuales estudian para lograr tener una buena educación, su negocio es la venta de ropa, zapatos, y otros productos, inicio con prestamos en banco comunales y dinero que su esposo dio, vende ambulante en las diferentes calle de la capital, pues su anhelo es poder tener un local fijo en la compra de un tramo. El cual le traerá solides a su negocio. Con este préstamo comprara mercadería variada como ropa, chapas de fantasía, y otros productos de demanda. Se siente contenta con la institución por que le ha permitido el financiamiento para lograr mejorar su negocio y su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Marlene López is 36 and lives in the La Primavera neighborhood in the capital of Managua. Her husband is a driver, and she has two children, 18 and 20, who are going to school to get a good education. She’s in business selling clothing, shoes, and other products. She started out with loans from village banks and money from her husband. She sells her products by traveling around the different streets of the capital, but longs to be able to bolster her business by buying a permanent space for it. Marlene plans to use her loan to buy a variety of merchandise like clothing, earrings, and other popular products. She’s pleased that the organization has allowed her to get the financing she needed to improve her business and her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various clothes, earrings, handicraft bracelets, and other products

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Djantoyerela sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 48 ans et 2  enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Yolla sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parentés et exercent le petit commerce comme activité économique. Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de mener à bien leurs activités génératrices de revenus. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ce prêt servira à acheter, une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires et de lait frais.
Les condiments sont achetés en gros à Bamako et sont revendus, en détail sur le marché de Fana à une clientèle essentiellement féminine, quant au lait, il est acheté auprès des éleveurs et revendu sur place aux femmes et hommes du village. 
Elles comptent réaliser mensuellement chacune 20.000FCFA de bénéfice. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.

loans.use: Achat de condiments alimentaires et lait.

loans.name: Emprendedores De Cantemoc 2A Group

texts.es:
El Sr. José del Carmen Rodríguez  García de 45 años, buen esposo, padre de 7 hijos, hombre trabajador de fuertes raíces, buenos principios y valores, es originario de la  pequeña comunidad pesquera de Cantemoc 2a (Cantemoc que en lengua chontal significa arbol de sombra) se encuentra ubicada en las orillas del municipio de Nacajuca en el estado de Tabasco.

Don José por mas de 20 años tenia en su tierra, cultivos de plátano, maíz, fríjol y un poco ganado, los cuales al venderlos eran el medio para obtener un recurso económico, pero debido a la inundación ocurrida hace ya dos años, la fertilidad de sus tierras se acabo y con ella la producción del campo, pero esto no mermo la fuerza de luchar por seguir sacando adelante a su familia, actualmente como actividades económicas sigue desarrollando la crianza de animales de traspatio (borregos y puercos) y junto con sus hijos mayores realiza trabajos de albañilería en comunidades aledañas. 

Como parte de esta labor que emprende día con día por mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, Don José y sus hijos se han acercado a FRAC para solicitar un crédito por $16,000.00 pesos, con la finalidad de seguir invirtiendo en la compra de ganado porcino mismo que será destinado para la crianza, engorde y posteriormente la venta de carne a granel.

Este será el primer crédito para el grupo denominado F.E. Emprendedores de Cantemoc 2ª, conformado por José del Carmen Rodríguez García, Sara Rodríguez M. (Maestra), Uber Rodríguez M. (Albañil) y Oscar Rodríguez M. (Albañil).

loans.use: Crianza y engorda de cerdos

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Djekafo sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 46 ans et 3 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Yolla, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parentés. Elles font comme activité le petit commerce d’articles divers tels l’achat vente de céréales. 
Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de mener à bien leurs activités génératrices de revenus. Elles sont à leur onzième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles comptent acheter, pour se constituer un stock de céréales de toutes sortes, haricot, sorgho, mil, maïs etc.
Les céréales sont achetées peu à peu dans les villages environnants auprès des producteurs et sont revendus à Fana à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, en détail au comptant et à crédit.  
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA par personne. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of Djekafo Group are married women who, on average, are 46 years old and have three children. They live with their husbands and children in large traditional families in the village of Yolla in the sub-prefecture of Fana, region of Koulikoro in the Republic of Mali. They are neighbors or family members to each other. They have small businesses trading with various products such as cereals. These women collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to successfully run their businesses and earn an income. This is their eleventh group loan and they have repaid all their previous loans on schedule. They will use their loan to stock up on all kinds of cereals, such as beans, sorghum, millet, corn etc. The cereals are bought little by little from producers and sold retail (cash and credit) in Fana to a diversified clientele of women and men. They expect to make a profit of 20,000 CFA francs (US$44) each per month. They will use part of their profit to reinvest in their businesses and part of it to provide for their families.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Estrella Group

texts.es:
La señora Ignacia M. S. ( blusa roja) ella cuenta con 44 años de edad fue a la escuela donde termino la carrera técnica en enfermería , ella renta su local donde vende sus productos, ella se dedica a esa actividad por que viene de familia, vive en unión libre con el señor Juan Miguel Martínez que también se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras  y juntos ven por sus 3 hijos las dos pequeñas estudian la primaria y el niño la secundaria. Ella vive en la avenida 4 lote 35 de la colonia moctezuma de la ciudad de Orizaba VeraC., en esa comunidad nos relata doña Ignacia que la gente es muy pacifica, tratable y la mayoría se dedica al comercio. Esa  es una de las colonias mas viejas de la ciudad de Orizaba y con mucha tradición por el gran ambiente que se vive en la comunidad; Doña Ignacia supo de FRAC por medio de amistades y fue así como se animo a organizar un grupo llamado Estrellaspues vio que era una gran oportunidad para que su negocio creciera ya que ella quiere meter abarrotes a sus ventas, ella va a utilizar el dinero del préstamo para comprar frutas (manzana, plátano, tunas, naranja ) verduras (jitomate, chile, cebolla, papa, tomate, zanahoria, lechuga) abarrotes ( aceite, arroz, papel, jabón, mayonesa).

El grupo Estrella esta conformado por 10 señoras que llevan una amistad desde hace mucho tiempo, el fin de reunirse y solicitar su préstamo es el  de mejorar su calidad de vida de ellas y de sus familiares. En su mayoría ellas se dedican a la venta de catalogo, pero también hay quienes venden ropa, antojitos yogurt natural.

Doña Ignacia esta muy contenta ya que al recibir su crédito va a poder tener variedad de frutas, verduras y abarrotes y así sus clientes van a tener mucho mas surtido para escoger además de que podrá obtener mejores ganancias y así podrá pagar el préstamo y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.

El sueño de doña Ignacia además del bienestar de sus hijos es que ellos terminen sus estudios y el de tener su propio local para que así sus ganancias sean mayores y pueda aumentar a su actividad la venta de pollo.
Ella agradece a Kiva que ayuda a la gente humilde a pesar de no conocerlas y en especial la ayuda que ofrecen a las señoras que tienen una actividad económica para mejorar la calidad de vida de la Familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Ignacia M. S. (in the red blouse) is 44 years old and returned to school where she finished her training as a technical nurse. She also has a vending stall where she sells products grown by her family. Doña Ignacia is in a common law marriage with Sr. Juan Miguel Martínez, who also sells fruits and vegetables. They have 3 children, two in elementary school and the other in high school. She lives at Avenue 4 Lot 35 in the Moctezuma settlement of the city of Orizaba VeraC.. Doña Ignacia tells us that her community is peaceful and well managed, and that most of the residents have their own businesses. It is one of the oldest settlements in the city of Orizaba and has a rich tradition as well as a great atmosphere that prevails throughout the community.

Doña Ignacia learned about Fundación Realidad through friends and was encouraged to organize a group, which was named “Estrella” (Star). She saw this was a great opportunity to grow her business because she wanted to add groceries to the products she offers. She will use her loan to buy fruit (apples, bananas, pears, and oranges), vegetables (tomatoes, peppers, onions, potatoes, carrots, and lettuce), and groceries (oil, rice, paper, soap, and mayonnaise).

The “Estrella” Group is composed of 10 women who have been friends for a long time and meet on the weekends. They are requesting a loan so that they can improve the quality of life for themselves and their families. Most of them sell products by catalog, but others sell clothing, snacks, and natural yogurt.

Doña Ignacia is very pleased with her loan because she will be able to offer a variety of fruits, vegetables and groceries and give her customers more choices. She will be able to get better returns which will enable her to repay her loan and improve the quality of life for her children.

The dream of Doña Ignacia is to provide for her children so that they can finish their studies. She hopes to have her own vending location so that she can increase her earnings and expand her business by selling chickens. She is grateful to Kiva for helping ordinary people who are complete strangers. The assistance provided to these women help them have their own businesses and improve the quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits, vegetables, and groceries to offer a variety of products

loans.name: Constantina

texts.es:
Constantina tiene 59 años, vive con su hermana en su casa propia. Ella es docente de profesión, su amplia experiencia de 30 años en esta actividad le ha permitido  adquirir habilidades en la enseñanza. Hace 3 años se jubiló, pero su vocación sigue vigente, por tal motivo decidió dictar clases particulares y sus alumnos actuales son los hijos de sus amistades y vecinos, quienes conocen de su trayectoria y esmerada labor en la educación. Adicionalmente, comparte con su hermana una tienda de abarrotes, negocio que implementaron en su casa. Constantina menciona que mientras tenga fuerzas para hacerlo, seguirá enseñando, pues ama su profesión. Por otro lado, según aumenten sus ventas, irá surtiendo su tienda de comestibles con más y variados productos.
Esta es la tercera oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP y está muy dispuesta a seguir trabajando con mucha responsabilidad en su banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de libros para actualizar sus conocimientos. También incrementará los productos de su tienda y adquirirá sacos de abono, pues empezará a sembrar legumbres en algunos terrenos de cultivo que posee.

loans.use: Compra de libros e inversión en otros negocios

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up on grains and firewood

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 55 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijas en su casa propia. Desde muy pequeña se dedica a la siembra de los productos nativos de su zona, como la papa, el maíz y la oca. Actualmente lo hace con el apoyo de su esposo y sus hijas, con quienes se siente muy a gusto de trabajar. Elsa comercializa sus productos en el mercado principal de su localidad y en algunas ocasiones, también los lleva a otra ciudad aledaña a la suya. Ella prefiere vender directamente sus productos, pues así obtiene mejores ganancias que cuando vende a mayoristas desde su chacra. Su deseo a futuro es incrementar y mejorar la calidad de sus productos.
Esta es la cuarta oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal y una de las cosas que más valora de esta metodología, es el trabajo en equipo. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de semillas y sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Elsa is 55 years old and lives with her husband and her daughters in her own house. Since she was very little she has grown the native products of her region, such as potato, rice, and oca. Now she works with the support of her husband and daughters, with whom she is very pleased to work. Elsa sells her products in the main market in her town and on some occasions she also brings them to another city close to her own. She prefers to sell her products directly, since in that way she has better earnings than when she sells to wholesalers from her farmhouse. Her desire for the future is to increase and improve the quality of her products. This is the 4th opportunity in which she has had a loan from MFP. She is part of a community bank and one of the most valued things about this methodology is working in teams. The money that she is asking for will be invested in the purchase of seeds and sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sheila Estela

texts.es: La joven Sheila de 28 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de superación, se caso joven tiene un hijo de un año, su esposo es ingeniero industrial y sus mejores deseos de ambos es poder terminar de hacer su casa con mejores condiciones y seguridad , ella trabaja en servicios domésticos y tiene dos años de trabajar para poder lograr mejorar su casa, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, este trabajo es cansado pero no ha podido encontrar otro donde pueda ganar mejor, con este crédito comprara materiales de construcción para hacer un muro en la parte de atrás y poder tener mejor seguridad para su familia. Da las gracias a la institución por dar la oportunidad de hacer estas mejoras que a futuro espera lograr una vivienda completa de concreto y con mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
The 28 year old Sheila is a hard-working young lady with the desire to succeed. She married young and has a one year old son. Her husband is an industrial engineer and their dearest wish is to be able to finish building their house with better accommodations and security. She works in domestic services and has been working for two years in order to be able to make improvements to her home. She resides in the North Laureles neighborhood of the capital of Managua. This work is strenuous but she has not been able to find another where she could earn more. With this loan she will buy building materials in order to build a wall in the back area and have better security for her family. She thanks the organization for providing the opportunity to make these improvements with which in the future she hopes to attain a finished concrete home with better accommodations.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase building materials for building a back wall

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno, ovino y especialmente porcino. Estos animales los compra directamente a los ganaderos de las comunidades campesinas aledañas a su zona y los revende a mayor precio en la feria ganadera de su ciudad. Los animales que no llega a vender, los lleva a su casa para criarlos y cuando dan cría, tiene más animales y aumentan sus ganancias. Debido a la rentabilidad de su negocio Lucila está planeando implementar un establo, donde pueda albergar a una mayor cantidad de animales. 
Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella se siente muy contenta de ser parte de un banco comunal donde todos los integrantes trabajan uniendo esfuerzos para el progreso de su grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita será invertido en la compra de más ovejas y cerdos.
texts.en:
Lucila is 43 years old and lives with her husband and her children in her own house. For five years she has bought and sold cattle, sheep, and especially pigs. She buys these animals directly from the stockbreeders of the rural communities close to her region and she resells them at a higher price in the livestock market in her city. She brings the animals that she is not able to sell to her house to raise them and when she breeds them, she has more animals and increases her earnings. Due to the profitability of her business, Lucila is planning to implement a stable where she can house a larger quantity of animals. This is the third time she’s had a loan with MFP. She is very content to be a part of a community bank where all of the members work uniting their efforts for the progress of their group. The money that she is asking for now will be invested in the purchase of more sheep and pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheep and pigs

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
El señor Ismael G. tiene ya más de seis años  dedicándose a la venta material para construcción y accesorios para la vivienda, este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia, ya que tiene cuatro hijos de pequeña edad y que están estudiando.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para invertir y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio, es por eso que nos está solicitando un préstamo y así tener más inventario y ingresos para el negoció, con  las ventas de está inversión planea pagar el crédito. Don Ismael ya ha tendió un crédito con FVP el cual pago puntual mente.
texts.en:
Ismael G. has been selling construction material and housing accessories for more than six years. This business is the source of income for his family, since he has four small children that are studying. In his business he is lacking variety of merchandise but right now he does not have the necessary money to invest and he doesn’t want to decrease his capital. It’s for this reason that he is asking us for a loan in order to have more inventory and income for the business. With the sales of this investment he plans to pay back the loan. Mr. Ismael has already had a loan with FVP in which he repaid punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora  MARIA ISABEL Q. R., tiene 50 años, vive en el distrito de LA ESPERANZA , provincia de TRUJILLO, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal ESPERANZA UNIDA.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria  no pudo continuar estudiando porque a la edad de 17 años quedó embarazada.
MARIA ISABEL está casada , tiene 3 hijos y todos dependen económicamente de ella porque se encuentran en el colegio.
MARIA ISABEL se dedica a la atención del locutorio que tiene en su casa, junto con la ayuda de su hijo mayor.
El primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la fabricación de su segunda cabina de locutorio.
Este crédito de 500 nuevos soles lo utilizará para  comprar una fotocopiadora y poder también dar ese servicio.
MARIA ISABEL sueña con ampliar su negocio de locutorio con servicio de Internet , fotocopia , tipeos y anillados.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel Q. R. is 50 years old and lives in the district of La Esperanza in the province of Trujillo and the department of La Libertad, Peru. She belongs to the community bank Esperanza Unida (United Hope). This businesswoman completed schooling until the 5th year of secondary school when she couldn’t continue studying because at age 17 she got pregnant. Maria Isabel is married, has 3 children and they all depend on her economically because they are in high school. Maria Isabel tends to the telephone booth she has in her house, together with the help of her oldest son. The first loan she received (300 nuevos soles) she invested in building her second telephone stall. She will use this loan of 500 nuevos soles to purchase a photocopier and be able to give this service. Maria Isabel dreams of increasing her telephone booth business with internet, photocopier, typing, and binding services.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a photocopier

loans.name: Fonjong

texts.en:
E. was married and has five children. He was very supportive of his wife, but she abandoned him due to poverty. As a very hard working man, he has faced many challenges in life, such as poverty and sickness. These problems made life very difficult for him. It was a great hardship for him to sponsor his five children in school until the year 2000 when he saw GHAPE as a source of relief and became a member.

He is convinced that his business will succeed because of his business experience. He is well known in the community. He is going to provide the community with palm oil and pork.	

He plans to use the profit from this loan and previous loans to pay for his children's school fees, and to feed and clothe his family. With these benefits, he will enjoy a better and more comfortable life. He prefers a loan from GHAPE because it includes training before the loan is disbursed and proper follow-up to ensure proper use of the loan. Also, the method of repayment is convenient and comfortable.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase piglets, sticks, feed and medicines, and to repair his pig sty

loans.name: Maria Azucena

texts.es: La señora Maria Azucena C. de 42 años de edad, casada, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, casada, y con tres hijos que estudian,, su esposo es mensajero ,sus planes es mejorar su vivienda ella es ama de casa y su esposo aporta para que sea posible la remodelación de su pequeña casa, pues desea poner cerámica y mejorar una ventana de su casa, y que su hijo pueda gozar de una vivienda segura y digna. Lo cual yo no la tuve debido a los recursos económicos que mis padres tenían, hoy en día es difícil poder construir su vivienda solo mediante con el financiamiento se puede lograr, este es su sexto ciclo en Afodenic y da las gracias por el apoyo para sobresalir adelante con su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria Azucena is 42 years old, married, and resides in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of the capital, Managua. She has 3 children who are still students. Her husband is a messenger.

Maria, a housewife, plans to make improvements on her house. Her husband will contribute to make the remodeling of their little house possible. They want to install tile and improve a window in their house, so their children can enjoy a home that is safe and worthy, something she didn't have due to the limited financial resources of her parents. Today, it is difficult to construct a house by means of the limited available financing.

This will be Maria's 6th loan cycle with AFODENIC, and she wishes to thank them for helping her forge ahead with her housing.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY TILE AND WOOD TO REPAIR A WINDOW

loans.name: Rosa Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora ROSA EUGENIA B. P., tiene 37 años, vive en el distrito de LA ESPERANZA , provincia de TRUJILLO, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EN ACCION.
La empresaria presenta estudios técnicos de cosmetología, trabajó de cosmetóloga en un salón de belleza de su tía.
Pero aproximadamente a los 2 años de estar trabajando con su tía logró abrir una peluquería propia en la casa de su mamá. Y actualmente sigue trabajando ahí.
ROSA es madre soltera , tiene 3 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella porque  se encuentran en el colegio.
Tiene que trabajar para mantener a sus hijos ya que  no cuenta con el apoyo económico del padre de ellos.
ROSA se dedica a la atención en su peluquería, realiza cortes de cabello, peinados, tintes, manicure, pedicure, etc
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de líquidos y tintes.
Este crédito de 1,500 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar un juego de tijeras, una secadora, tintes, líquidos de ondulación, espejos, etc
ROSA sueña con abrir otra peluquería en el centro de Trujillo.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa Eugenia B. P. is 37 years old and lives in the La Esperanza district, province of Trujillo, in the state of La Libertad – Peru. She is a member of the “Mujeres en Accion” (Women in Action) communal bank. This entrepreneur has had technical studies in cosmetology and worked as a cosmetologist in her aunt’s beauty salon. After approximately 2 years of working with her aunt she was able to open her own hair salon in her mother’s house, and is currently working there. Rosa is a single mother and has 3 children who are her financial dependants because they are in school. She must work in order to support her children since she lacks the economic support of their father. Rosa works servicing clients in her hair salon performing hair cuts, styling, dyeing, manicures, pedicures, etc. Her first loan for 300 nuevos soles was invested in the purchase of salon products and dyes. This loan for 1,500 nuevos soles will be used to buy a set of scissors, a dryer, dyes, curling product, mirrors, etc. Rosa dreams of opening another hair salon in downtown Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: she will use it to buy a set of scissors, a dryer, dyes, curling product, mirrors, etc.

loans.name: Garanti Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Garanti sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne  42 ans et 3 enfants .Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Balan, sous-préfecture de Fana Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage, de mariages et excellent dans l’achat vente du charbon de bois, du bois de chauffe et d’articles divers de consommation courante.  
Ces femmes ont intégrés  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
