Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace   4 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/300.00 nuevos soles monto que le sirvió para adquirir mercadería para realizar productos de bordado en bayeta y crianza de chanchos.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional S/ 500.00 nuevos soles con el préstamo ella podrá adquirir mas mercadería como bayeta, lanas, así producir mas productos de bordados en bayeta, también comprara chanchos  lo cual lo venderá en la plaza de ganados de Juli.

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean mejores que ella y que su esposo deje el vicio de beber y que su relación familiar mejore.

De las reuniones del B.C.  Le gusta los ahorros, sus ganancias, los temas educativos y compartir experiencias con las otras socias
texts.en:
Sra. Andrea is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Rosa de Lima”, which is located in the District of Juli, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 51 years old, married, and has 9 children. Four of her children still live with her. Sra. Andrea was not able to attend school because she lacked the financial resources.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 4 years. Her first loan in the amount of 300 soles was used to purchase supplies for making embroidered products and breeding pigs.

Sra. Andrea is currently requesting another loan of 500 soles to purchase more supplies such as flannel and wool so that she can produce more embroidered fabrics. She will also buy pigs that she will sell at the livestock market in Juli.

Her dream is for her children to have a better life than hers and that her husband quits drinking so that her family’s relationships improve. She enjoys her savings, earnings, educational seminars, and sharing her experiences with other members.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool & flannel

loans.name: Clara Elena

texts.es:
Clara tiene 53 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos en el pueblo joven José Olaya, en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años tiene un negocio de alquiler de servicio de Internet (Internet café) funcionando en una habitación de su casa, además dentro de este establecimiento tiene  un Play Station que también alquila por horas y una pequeña bodega – tienda de golosinas que eventualmente vende a las personas que vienen a usar su servicio.

La idea de este negocio nació de la necesidad que tienen los estudiantes de su barrio del servicio de Internet para realizar sus trabajos escolares, la situación económica de las familias de la zona les impide contar con este servicio en su domicilio por lo que acuden con regularidad a su establecimiento.

Ella desea comprar una anilladora de papel, darle mantenimiento a sus computadoras y también poner un mobiliario especialmente diseñado para este tipo de negocio ya que el que tiene no es el adecuado, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar para el logro de su objetivo.

Su más grande anhelo es ampliar su negocio con la compra de una fotocopiadora para así seguir apoyando a la economía de su hogar y, a futuro, brindarle a sus hijos una educación de calidad.

Es la segunda vez que Clara trabaja con nosotros y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos por lo que es considerada como una buena cliente.
texts.en:
Clara is 53 years old, is married and lives with her husband and 3 children in the town José Olaya, in the city of Chiclayo.

For two years she has had an internet cafe in a room in her house, as well as a PlayStation that she also rents and a small grocery store— she sells candy to the people who use her services.

The idea of this business came from the needs of the students in the neighborhood as they need to use the internet to do their schoolwork. Since the economic condition of the families in the area does not allow them to have this service in their homes, many students visit her cafe frequently.

She wants to buy a paper ring binding machine, give maintenance to her computers and to buy some new furniture designed for the internet cafe since what she has is not suitable. This is the reason for her loan request for 1500 soles.

Her greatest wish is to expand her business by buying a photocopier to continue supporting her home and in the future, to provide her children with a quality education.

This is the second time that Clara has received a loan from Kiva’s field partner and has shown to be punctual and responsible in her payments, thus, she is regarded as a good customer.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy furniture and maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Aguedo Candelario

texts.es:
Candelario tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en el pueblo joven Carlos Stein, distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, ubicado a cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El y su esposa son propietarios de un negocio de reparación y venta de anteojos, tienen un pequeño puesto en los exteriores del Mercado Modelo de Chiclayo (el principal mercado de la ciudad), donde venden sus productos todos los días, también los vende los fines de semana en la ciudad de Ferreñafe, ellos compran su mercancía en la ciudad de Lima y en Guayaquil (Ecuador).

El año anterior dejaron temporalmente su negocio para dedicarse a la agricultura en la ciudad de Tumbes, pero no les fue bien, por lo que este año regresaron a continuar con su actividad habitual, actualmente desea invertir en la compra de más anteojos para mantener su negocio por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Su anhelo más grande es crear a futuro una óptica en un local más amplio y con lo que perciba de este negocio terminar de construir su casa y brindarle una mejor educación a sus menores hijos.

Candelario es muy estimado por sus vecinos que lo consideran un padre de familia carismático, luchador y que siempre está dispuesto a ayudar en el momento que se le necesita.
texts.en:
Candelario is 40 years old, lives with his wife and two children in the town of Carlos Stein, district of José Leonardo Ortiz, located 5 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He and his wife are owners of an eyeglass sale and repair shop. They have a little place in the outer part of the Mercado Modelo de Chiclayo (the main market in the city) where they sell their products everyday; he also sells them in the weekends in the city of Ferreñafe. They buy their merchandise from the cities of Lima and Guayaquil (Ecuador).

Last year, they temporarily left the business to farm in the city of Tumbes, but things did not go well, so they came back to their eyeglass business. They want to buy more glasses to keep their business, which is why for the first time they are requesting a loan of 1500 soles.

His greatest wish for the future is to have a bigger place for their optical business and whatever profit they get, they hope to finish building their home and provide a better education to their young children.

Candelario is very well respected by his neighbors who consider him a very charismatic father, a fighter who is always ready to help in a moments notice.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy eyeglasses to expand his business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
When Helen’s husband, a tenured U.S. Army veteran, passed away in 2003, she was left wondering how to make ends meet. Through her volunteer work with the genealogy library in Oakland, California, Helen discovered that a large number of people had an interest in exploring their ancestry. Given this demand, as well as her own personal interest in genealogy, Helen founded “My Genealogy” in order to provide family history research services. The business provides her with the supplement to her social security income that she needs.

Helen needs a $2,000 loan to purchase an all-in-one printer, copier, scanner and fax; a used computer; subscriptions to online databases for genealogists; and a desk for her part-time employee. Without the loan for the equipment and Opportunity Fund’s business advisory services, she doesn’t think her business could survive. 

Helen dreams of one day moving her business from her home to a small storefront and adding three employees to accommodate the demand she sees for genealogy services. Learn more at  www.mygenealogyonline.net.

loans.use: To buy equipment and subscriptions to online databases

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica came to the U.S. from El Salvador and worked for a house-cleaning company for three years before realizing that she had the skills and knowledge to start her own business. Using her savings, she purchased the small amount of equipment she needed and has been hard at work on her own for four years.

Veronica needs a $1,000 loan to purchase a computer that will allow her to do more online advertising, keep track of her finances, and allow her to spend more time with her two year old daughter. In the future, Veronica hopes to expand her business by adding employees so that she can dedicate more time to completing her high school education.

Veronica’s ultimate goal is to go to college and become an engineer. She feels that receiving this small loan from Opportunity Fund is the first step on her path to success.

loans.use: To buy a computer for her business

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila tiene 34 años, está separada de su pareja y tiene 2 hijos; uno de ellos cursa estudios primarios y el otro es un bebé de 9 meses. Ella tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes (arroz, leche, huevo, azúcar, etc.), golosinas, bebidas y productos de primeros auxilios como alcohol, algodón, vendas, gasas, entre otros. Esta tienda la implementó hace 5 años en un espacio de su propia casa, a raíz de su separación conyugal, lo cual no impidió su progreso. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es aprender sobre técnicas de venta, además que con esta actividad puede solventar las necesidades familiares. Afortunadamente, su tienda se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona por donde transitan muchas personas, por lo que tiene varios clientes que le dejan considerables ganancias diarias.
Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal y lo más le gusta es que se lleva muy bien con sus compañeros, hay comunicación y todos son responsables en sus pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más productos para incrementar el stock de su negocio.
texts.en:
Domitila is 34 years old, is separated from her partner, and has two children: one of those is in primary school, and the other is a baby of 9 months. She has a store where she sells groceries (rice, milk, eggs, sugar, etc), candy, drinks and first aid products such as alcohol, cotton wool, bandages, gauze, among others. She opened this store 5 years ago in a space in her own home. Her separation has not impeded her progress. What she would most like for her business is to learn about sales techniques. In addition, with this activity she could address the family's needs. Fortunately, her store is located in a good zone where many people pass by, and because of this she has many customers who spend considerable sums daily. This is her 3rd loan with MFP. She is part of a communal bank and what she likes the most is that she gets along very well with the other members, there is good communication and everyone is responsible in their payments. With the money she is requesting, she will purchase more products in order to increase the stock of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto came to the United States from Jalisco, Mexico 13 years ago.  After working at an auto repair business for 7 years, he decided to branch out on his own.  Roberto needs a $10,000 loan to purchase a lift and equipment for his new auto repair shop, Aztek Enterprises. 

Although he has been in business for just four months, he has already secured a contract with a large company to service and maintain trucks for their regional office. Roberto is thankful that his family and friends are spreading the word about his business to help bring him success.  Roberto’s wife helps out in the shop when she can and when she is not busy studying English and caring for their two children.

Roberto hopes to expand his shop in the future so that he can serve more clients and help the community by hiring more employees.  Roberto recently heard about Kiva and signed on to the site as a lender so that he could find and help his acquaintances in Mexico with their businesses. While searching through the site, he found Opportunity Fund and was very excited to learn about loans and business advising available to him in the U.S.  Roberto feels strongly that more services should be available to small business owners like himself who may not be considered bankable, and he is grateful to Kiva and Opportunity Fund for giving him this opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase shop equipment, office remodeling, and an office computer

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita C., a 61-year-old widow with five adult-aged children, is from the village of Malaubang, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Conchita sells fish. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3000 PHP.

In 2008, Conchita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC, she is now requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Conchita's second from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Dương's Group

texts.en:
T. Dương Thị (20213040007), 57 and living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh, is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by SEDA. While both members of the group receive an individual loan, they each are responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Cầu Giữa 03 (3).

T., a married mother of two school-aged children, operates a specialized retail store whose main source of income comes from selling confectionery products in the local community. Engaged in this business for over 10 years, she earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month.

In 2009, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 2.242.000 VND from SEDA that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan of 2.950.000 VND which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be her second loan from SEDA, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About the Other Borrower in the Group: Nguyễn Thị X. (20213040013) is a 36-year-old female requesting a 3.186.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. T. Dương Thị (20213040007) là 57 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 2 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Cầu Giữa 03 (3). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm bánh kẹo trong cộng đồng địa phương. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND. Vào 2009, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2.242.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 2.950.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị X. (20213040013) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.186.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita T. is from the village of Lower Tiparak, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old, is married, and has nine school-aged children. Teresita owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-eight years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Roen Ry

texts.en: Mrs. Roen RY S. is a villager in Andoung village in Kandal province. She is a pig breeder. Since her breeding pigs business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing two more pigs for breeding. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Thorn Thuok, is a hard working man. Mrs. Roen RY S. is 27 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy two more pigs for breeding.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal “La Ilaveñita”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 36 años de edad, estado civil soltera y madre de una niña Juliana estudio educación superior técnica Administración, vive en Ilave.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió compra venta de ropa. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ropa de abrigo, todo por pedido y entrega inmediata, Juliana comparte con su mama otros negocios ellas se turnan y tienen una tienda de venta de abarrotes.

Su sueño es poner una tienda grande de venta de ropa en Tacna.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos y los ahorros

loans.use: Para la compra de ropa de abrigo casacas.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La señora Faustina pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Juan D. Tahuaco”  que esta ubicado en la comunidad D. San Juan D. Tahuaco del distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 57 años D. edad, estado civil casada y es madre D. 09 hijos y No tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, vive en la comunidad D. san Juan D. Tahuaco.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años es una D. las socias fundadoras,  con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra D. ganado menor. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, con este préstamo la señora va a comprar ganado mayor para engorD., también trabajo con su criadero D. truchas con la ayuda D. su esposo.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las facilidades den los préstamos.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado mayor para engorde.

loans.name: Sok Leng

texts.en: Mrs. Sok Leng P., a 37-year-old single woman living in Andoung village in Kandal Province, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land upon which she cultivates rice to earn a living. In addition to working this plantation, she is a pig-breeder. Since the latter business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing two more piglets for breeding.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy two more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Lualhati

texts.en:
Lualhati is 35 years old and married to Santiago.  The couple were blessed to have thee children: April, 9  years old, elementary student; Tristan and Jamie are still very young and not yet studying. The family lives in Barangay Calao East, Santiago City, Isabela.

Her husband is expert in repairing different kinds of appliances. With this they were able to put up a small repair shop in their village where she also helps her husband manage their business.  Aiming to improve their poor living condition, she wanted to borrow an additional business capital from KIVA lenders an amount of PHP 4,000.00 to develop their repair shop. She also hopes that with their shop, they can continue to support the education of their children.

loans.use: additional business capital

loans.name: Jesus Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Juan D. Tahuaco”  que esta ubicado en la comunidad D. San Juan D. Tahuaco del distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 59 años D. edad, estado civil casada y es madre D. 04 hijos y estudio primaria completa, vive en la comunidad D. San Juan D. Tahuaco.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años, se retiro un ciclo es una D. las socias fundadoras,  con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra D. ganado menor. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, con este préstamo la señora va a comprar ganado mayor para engorD..

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado vacuno.

loans.name: Annielyn

texts.en:
Annielyn R., a 24-year-old married mother of two school-aged children, is from the village of Dalapang, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, where she raises and sells cassava, a business she has been engaged in for two years. She earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for this activity.

In 2009, Annielyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC, she is now requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers. This loan will be her second from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for the tuition fees of her children and the family's daily needs.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Juan D. Tahuaco”  que esta ubicado en la comunidad D. San Juan D. Tahuaco del distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 44 años D. edad, estado civil casada y es madre D. 05 hijos y estudio primaria incompleta (2do grado), vive en la comunidad D. San Juan D. Tahuaco.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años,  es una D. las socias fundadoras,  con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra D. ganado menor. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, con este préstamo la señora va a comprar ganado  vacuno y ovino para engorD. la señora Juana también se ayuda con las chacras.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando para ayudar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado vacuno para engorde.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La señora Josefa pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Juan de Tahuaco”  que esta ubicado en la comunidad de San Juan de Tahuaco del distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 51 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 06 hijos y no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, vive en la comunidad de San Juan de Tahuaco.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, con este préstamo la señora va a comprar ganado ovino para engorde.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando pero en comercialización de carnes para enviar a Tacna.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado ovino.

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.en: Bernarda A. is from the village of Panduma Sr., Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 56 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Bernarda owns and operates a business selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Bernarda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
La señora Reyna es socia del Banco Comunal “Lucero del Amanecer”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juliaca, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 32 años de edad, estado civil conviviente y es madre de 02 hijos, estudio educación secundaria completa, vive en el Barrio Las Mercedes Jr. San Juan de Dios 620.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. hace 5 años, con préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para invertirlo en su negocio de artesanías. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 2100.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ropa americana y también la compra de lanas de diferentes colores para la elaboración de ropa de abrigo como chompas, pantalones, etc.

Su sueño es comprar un terreno en Juliaca y educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los pagos y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Sra. Reyna is a member of the Communal Bank “Lucero del Amanecer” (Morning Star), which is located in the District of Juliaca, San Román Province, Department of Puno. She is 32 years old, in a common law marriage, and the mother of 2 children. She completed her high school education and lives in the neighborhood of Las Mercedes Jr. San Juan de Dios 620.

She has been working with Manuela R. for 5 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was invested into her business of making handicrafts.

At the moment, Sra. Reyna is requesting a loan of 2100 soles to buy American clothing. She will also purchase wool in different colors for making outerwear such as sweaters, pants, etc. Her dreams include buying a plot of land in Juliaca and providing her children with an education. She enjoys the convenience of her loan payments and her savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase American clothing & wool in different colors

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La señora Celia es socia del Banco Comunal “Lucero del Amanecer”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juliaca, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 36 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 03 hijos, estudio educación primaria completa, vive en el Barrio Las Mercedes Av. El Sol 745.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para invertirlo en su negocio de venta de abarrotes. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, fideos, galletas, gaseosas, etc. para venderlo en su tienda.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando y darles una educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan las charlas ya que son de mucha importancia y aprenden mucho.

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, fideos, galletas, gaseosas, etc

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
La señora Marleni es socia del Banco Comunal “Lucero del Amanecer”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juliaca, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 23 años de edad, estado civil conviviente y espera un bebe, estudio educación secundaria completa, vive en el Barrio Santa Maria Av. Circunvalación 2872.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 5 meses, con un préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para invertirlo en su negocio de elaboración de artesanías. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de lana para la elaboración de chompas en tejido a palito y además accesorios por pedido.

Su deseo es tener una empresa de ventar y exportación de artesanías.

A ella le gusta la forma de trabajo.
texts.en:
Sra. Marleni is a member of the Communal Bank “Lucero del Amanecer” (Morning Star), which is located in the District of Juliaca, San Román Province, Department of Puno. She is 23 years old, in a common law marriage, and hopes to have a baby. She has a high school education and lives in the neighborhood of Santa Maria Av. Circunvalación 2872.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for the past 5 months. Her first loan of 300 soles was invested into her business of making handicrafts.

Sra. Marleni is currently requesting another loan of 300 soles to buy wool for manufacturing woven sweaters as well as accessories upon request. She hopes to have a business selling and exporting her handicrafts. She enjoys her line of work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool in different colors

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
La señora Nicolasa es socia del Banco Comunal “Lucero del Amanecer”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juliaca, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 60 años de edad, estado civil soltera y es madre de 5 hijos, estudio educación primaria incompleta (2do de primaria), vive en el Barrio Alto Rinconada Av. Tupac Amaru s/n.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para invertirlo en su negocio de compra venta de golosinas. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de chocolates, caramelos, yogures, galletas, gaseosas, etc. Para venderlo en su puesto.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gusta la facilidad en los prestamos así puede con facilidad aumentar en su capital para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Nicolasa is a member of the Morning Star Community Bank which is in the Juliaca district, the San Román Province, in the Puno Department. She is 60 years old and a single mother of 5 children. She studied through the 2nd grade of primary school and lives in the Alto Rinconada neighborhood on the street of Tupac Amaru. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for many years, and her first loan was for the amount of 300 New Soles, for investment in candles for her business. Currently she is seeking a loan of $525, for the purchase of chocolate, caramel, yogurt, crackers, soda, and other items to sell in her stand. Her wish is to continue to work. She likes the ease of the loans so that she can easily increase her capital to be able to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of chocolate, caramel, yogurt, crackers, soda, and other items

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mr. Phalla S. lives in Chrouy Dang Village in Kandal Province. He is 20 years old and is single. He is a construction worker.

Aside from this work, Mr. Phalla S. is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which he cultivates rice. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy rice seed and fertilizer to support the field to make the crop more productive. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Hydee

texts.en:
Hydee is a hog raiser. She is 36 years old, married to Romeo Jr., and lives in Calao East, Santiago City.

Hydee dreams of uplifting their family from poor living conditions through her business. This is the reason why she wants to request a loan of PHP 4,000 from Kiva lenders to buy a stock of feed so she can sustain the needs of her hogs. She is also hoping to have a bigger piggery business someday. 

The couple is blessed with three children: the twins - 18-year-old high school graduates and Jamiaca - a 12-year-old high school student.

loans.use: To buy a stock of pig feed

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Amigas de Santa Bárbara”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juliaca, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 41 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 04 hijos, la señora Sonia no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, vive en el Barrio Santa Adriana 2da etapa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años es una de las socias fundadoras, con un préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió para la compra de lanas de diferentes colores.

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de lana acrílica y lana de alpaca de todos los colores, para la elaboración de prendas de vestir y accesorios, además ella tiene su negocio de renovación y compostura de calzados y de ves en cuando le ayuda su esposo ya que el trabaja independiente.

Su deseo es ampliar su negocio.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Sra. Sonia is a member of the Friends of Santa Barbara Community Bank, which is in the Juliaca district, in the San Román Province, in the Puno Department. She is 41 years old, married and mother of 4 children. Sonia did not have the opportunity to study formally, but she lives in the Santa Adriana neighborhood. Sonia has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for many years, and was one of the founding members with an initial loan of 300 Nuw Soles, money which she invested in the purchase of different colored wools. Currently she is requesting a loan of $175, for the purchase of acrilic wool and alpaca wool of many colors, to grow her stock of clothing and accessory items. Furthermore, she is redesigning her business and shoe repair and she sometimes helps her husband now that he works independently. She likes get-togethers, and her wish is to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase  of acrilic and alpaca wool

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Amigas D. Santa Bárbara”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Juliaca, Provincia D. San Román, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 50 años D. edad, estado civil casada y es madre D. 03 hijos (todos ya independientes), la señora Juana estudio secundaria incompleta (3er grado), vive en el Barrio Santa Catalina.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 5 años, con un préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. carpintería.

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo D. S/. 700.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. chocolates, caramelos, gaseosas, yogures, chisitos, galletas, etc. para venderlos en su tienda escolar.

Su deseo es aprender diseños en tejido a palito.

A ella le gusta la puntualidad y las charlas
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the "Las Amigas D. Santa Bárbara" communal bank, that is located in the district of Juliaca, San Román Province, Puno state. She is 50 years old, married and a mother of 3 children that are independent. Juana studied until the 3rd year of secondary school and lives in the Santa Catalina neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for 5 years, with an initial loan of 300 Nuevos Soles which she invested in her carpentry business. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 700 Nuevos Soles, for the purchase of chocolates, caramel candies, sodas, yogurts, "chisitos" (puffed cheese snacks),cookies, etc. to sell in her school store. Her wish is to learn designs in weaving. She likes punctuality and chats

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chocolates, caramel candies, sodas, yogurts, "chisitos" (puffed cheese snacks),cookies, etc.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 43 years old and married to Micalsin. She is engaged in direct selling of Avon products. She is really thankful because her chosen business is really a big help to her family. She purchases her products in Santiago City where an Avon branch is located.

Wanting to make her business progressive, she is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 from Kiva lenders that will serve as additional capital to further increase her credit line with Avon. In this way, she can get more orders to meet the demands of her customers. Cynthia is hoping that her loan will be granted to enable her business to grow and become sustainable.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
La señora Epifania pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Salvador Luminoso”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 41 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 06 hijos y no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, vive en Ccotos.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace muchos años es socia fundadora,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles para compra venta de pescado. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 1200.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de redes para la pesca artesanal, también comprara pescado que lo vende en el mercado de Capachica.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando para poder educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las facilidades de pago.
texts.en:
Epifania belongs to the San Salvador Luminoso Comunal Bank, which is located in the Capachica district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 41, married, and has six children. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She lives in Ccotos. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for many years. She is a founding member. With her initial loan for 300 PEN she bought fish. She is now asking for a loan for 1,200 PEN to buy fishing nets. She will also buy fish to sell in the Capachica market. Her biggest wish is to keep working in order to pay for her children’s education. She likes the savings and the simplicity of the payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy nets and fish, etc.

loans.name: Catalina Pastora

texts.es:
La señora Catalina es socia del Banco Comunal “San Salvador Luminoso”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 43 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 02 hijos y estudio educación primaria incompleta (3er grado), vive en Capana.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles para compra de productos de la región. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de papa, chuño, quinua, ocas, etc. Para la venta en la feria semanal.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando para poder educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Catalina is a member of the “San Salvador Luminoso” communal bank that is located in the Capachica district, Puno province, in the state of Puno. She is 43 years old, married and a mother of 2 children. She studied until the 3rd year of primary school and lives in Capana. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for 3 years. Her initial loan of 300 Nuevos Soles was used for the purchase of products of the region. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 600 Nuevos Soles, which she will invest in the purchase of potatoes, chuño (freeze dried potatoes), quinoa, oca, etc. to sell in the weekly market. Her biggest desire is to continue working to be able to educate her children. She likes to save and punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of potatoes, chuño (freeze dried potatoes), quinoa, oca, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal “San Salvador Luminoso”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 61 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 03 hijos y no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, vive en el Sector Ilata.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles para compra de insumos para la elaboración de helados. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de azúcar, colorantes, barquillos, etc para la elaboración de helados.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando para salir adelante.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la puntualidad.

loans.use: Para la compra de azúcar, colorantes, barquillos, etc

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal “San Salvador Luminoso”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 39 años de edad, estado civil conviviente y es madre de 03 hijos y estudio educación secundaria completa, vive en el Jr. Lima s/n en Capachica.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 7 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles para compra de abarrotes. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de azúcar, arroz, gaseosas, galletas, aceite, detergentes, etc.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos y agradece a Manuela Ramos por darles la oportunidad de sacar su negocio adelante.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the community bank "San Salvador Luminoso" which is located in the district of Capachica, province of Puno, department of Puno. She is 39 years old, in a civil union marriage, and is mother of 3 children. She has a secondary school education and lives in Jr. Lima s/n in Capachica. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 7 years and her first loan was for 300 soles to buy groceries. Now she is asking for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles. She will invest this money for the purchase of sugar, rice, soda pop, cookies, detergents, etc. Her biggest desire is to continue working. She appreciates the loan conditions and thanks Manuela Ramos for giving the opportunity to further develop her business.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of sugar, rice, soda pop, cookies, oil, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Ngaet

texts.en: Mrs. Ngaet S. was born in 1972 and lives in Rokar village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who earns a living by cultivating rice on a piece of land she owns.  Her husband, Mr. Chhay Bunna, is a fisherman.  Mrs. Ngaet S. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, hire laborers to work on the field, and to purchase nets for her husband’s fishing business. She has four children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school and two others who are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, hire laborers to work on the field, and to purchase nets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
La señora Narcisa es socia del Banco Comunal “San Salvador Luminoso”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Capachica, Provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 60 años D. edad, estado civil casada y es madre D. 09 hijos y no pudo estudiar es iletrada, vive en la comunidad D. Copana.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace muchos años es socia fundadora,  su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles para aumentar a su capital  para la compra D. productos D. la región. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra D. azúcar, arroz, leche, aceite, detergentes, etc., la Sra. Narcisa también se dedica a la pesca artesanal.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando para ayudar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de azúcar, arroz, leche, aceite, detergentes, etc.,

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
La señora Máxima es socia del Banco Comunal “San Salvador Luminoso”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 48 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 04 hijos y estudio educación primaria incompleta (1er grado), vive en la comunidad de Chifron.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace muchos años es socia fundadora,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles para aumentar a su capital  para la compra de productos de la región. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de papa. Chuño, quinua, cebada, etc. Ella lo vende  en las ferias semanales.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando para ayudar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros.
texts.en:
Máxima is a member of the community bank "San Salvador Luminoso" that is located in the district of Capachica, province of Puno, department of Puno. She is 48 years old, in a civil marriage, and is the mother of 4 children. She has an incomplete primary school education and lives in the community of Chifron. Máxima has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for many years and is a founding member. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles to increase her capital for the purchase of regional products. She is currently asking for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles. She will use this money to purchase potatoes, potato flour, quinoa, barley, etc. She will sell it at the weekly market. Her biggest desire is to keep working so she can continue to help her children.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of potatoes, potato flour, quinoa, barley, etc

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
La señora Modesta es socia del Banco Comunal “San Salvador Luminoso”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Capachica, Provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 67 años D. edad, estado civil casada y es madre D. 10 hijos y estudio educación primaria incompleta (4to grado), vive en la comunidad D. Copana.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 meses,  su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, para aumentar a su capital y comprar redes para pesca artesanal. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, este dinero lo invertirá en su negocio D. pesca artesanal ella dice que aumentara algunas redes para realizar su trabajo D. pesca artesanal, Modesta también se ayuda con la venta D. comida en los días D. feria.

Su mayor deseo hacer crecer su negocio.

A ella le gustan los ahorros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Modesta is a member of the Communal Bank "San Salvador Luminoso" which is located in the district of Capachica, Province of Puno, Department of Puno. She is 67 years old, is married, has 10 children and an incomplete elementary school education (4th graD.). She lives in the community of Copana.

Mrs. Modesta started working with the Program Manuela Ramos 4 months ago. Her initial loan was for S/.500.00(Peruvian Nuevo Sol) to increase her capital and purchase nets for artisan fishing.

Now she is asking for a S/.500.00 which she will use to invest in her artisan fishing business by buying nets. Modesta also supports herself by selling food during fairs.

Her greatest wish is to make her business grow. Modesta likes to save.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase nets for artisan fishing

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
La señora Emiliana es socia del Banco Comunal “San Salvador Luminoso”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Capachica, Provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 45 años D. edad, estado civil casada y es madre D. 02 hijos y no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, vive en la comunidad D. Yapura.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, hace 3 años,  su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles para aumentar su negocio D. venta D. comida. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo D. S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra D. pescado. Papas, aceite, gas, etc., para la preparación D. comida los domingos en las ferias.

Su mayor deseo es que su negocio crezca más.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las charlas.

loans.use: Para la compra de pescado. Papas, aceite, gas, etc.,

loans.name: Leat

texts.en:
Mrs. Leat M. lives in Kandal Kraom Village in Kandal Province. She is a sugar-juice seller.

Since her business is doing well, Mrs. Leat M. wants to expand it by purchasing a sugarcane juice box and to buy various drinks to add to her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s standard of living.

Mrs. Leat M. is 36 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom helps her mother with her business, while the other is attending the local school. Mrs. Leat M.’s husband, Mr. Srey Sareth, is employed by a company.

loans.use: To buy a sugarcane juice box and various drinks for her business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Mrs. Erlinda B. of Purok Pasil, Barangay Zone 1, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental, is 58 years old and married and with nine children, seven of whom are adults and two are still of school age. Raising nine children is a challenging job, and Erlinda knows that she needs to strive hard in helping her husband earn enough to cover the family expenses and to save for their children's future. With this clear objective, Erlinda knew that the only way was to have her own business. But she needed capital to start, and this is the reason why she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002. After getting her first loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she started a food-vending business and a coffee shop adjacent to her house. The tasty meals she offered soon became popular in the community and her business continues to flourish. This nets a profit of PHP 5,000 per month, which has helped a lot in covering the family's daily expenses. Erlinda just repaid the last installment on her 17th loan of PHP 18,000 and now she is applying to borrow PHP 20,000 to invest back into her business. Thus, she will have revolving capital to buy more ingredients for the food she cooks every day so that she can offer a wider variety to her neighbors. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.es:
La señora Martha es socia del Banco Comunal “San Salvador Luminoso”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 48 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 03 hijos y estudio educación secundaria completa, vive en la comunidad de Capana.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace muchos años es socia fundadora,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles para aumentar a su capital en su negocio de pesca artesanal. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 2300.00 Nuevos soles, el cual invertirá en la compra de redes para su negocio de pesca artesanal, y lo vende en Puno y Juliaca en las ferias de la semana, su esposo hace servicio de taxi.

Su mayor deseo es darles una educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones en las cuales comparte con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the San Salvador Luminoso Community Bank, located in Capachica District, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 48 years old, married with 3 children, and she completed secondary school. Martha lives in the community of Capana.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for many years and was a founding member. Her first loan was for 300 New Sols to augment her fishing business.

At present, she requests a loan of 2,300 New Sols to invest in nets for her fishing enterprise. She sells fish in the weekly fairs of Puno and Juliaca. Her husband is a taxi driver.

Martha's greatest desire is to provide an education for her children. She enjoys saving and the meetings she shares with her fellow members.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY NETS FOR HER FISHING BUSINESS

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Mrs. Noeun Phim lives in Andoung village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns 1.2-hectar field of land for rice cultivating. Aside from this plantation, she is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Toem Nhork, owns recycle business. Now Mrs. Noeun Phim is applying a loan to buy fertilizer, pig, pig food, and to add her saving to buy more recycle supplies for her husband’s business. She is 30 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pig and pig food.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal “San Salvador Luminoso”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 38 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 06 hijos y estudio educación primaria completa, vive en la comunidad de Ccotos.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace muchos años es socia fundadora,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles para aumentar a su capital en su negocio de pesca artesanal. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual invertirá en su negocio de venta de carne de avino en el mercado, también se dedica a la pesca artesanal, ella trabaja por pedidos  para las Islas de Taquile para  los restaurantes.

Su mayor deseo es darles una educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the “San Salvador Luminoso” Village Bank, which is located in the Capachica district, Puno province and department. She is a 38-year-old married mother of six children, who have all completed primary school and live in the Ccotos community.

For many years she has worked as a founding member of the Manuela Ramos movement. Her first loan was 300 soles to increase the capital of her handicraft fish business.

She requests a loan of 3000 soles, which she will invest in her business selling sheep meat in the market, handmade fish, and her work for the Islas de Taquile restaurants.

Her greatest wish is to give an education to her children.

She likes the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of sheep meat

loans.name: Sheba

texts.en:
Sheba manages a general store in their village in Calao East, Santiago City. Her goal is to expand her business and have a progressive life. She says her income from her store is not enough to meet their needs. This is the reason why she is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders of 4,000 Philippine pesos. Sheba believes that business success can be achieved through hard work and patience.

Sheba is 36 years old and married to Noel. They have two children: Jacelle - 15 years old, and Noel Jr., 12 years old. Both are in high school.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “San Salvador Luminoso”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 46 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 06 hijos y estudio educación primaria incompleta (3er grado), vive en la comunidad de MiraF. Yapura.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 5 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles para aumentar a su capital en su negocio de artesanías en tejido. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual invertirá en la compra de lana de ovino y alpaca para la elaboración de frazadas, hijillas, ponchos, etc, y los vende en las ferias semanales.

Su mayor deseo que su negocio crezca mucho.

A ella le gustan las reuniones ya que se divierten mucho.
texts.en:
Ms. Juana L. is a member of the “San Salvador Luminoso” Microfinance Institute, located in the Capachica district of the Puno province, department of Puno. She is a 46-year-old married mother with 6 children. She was unable to complete elementary school; she went up to the third grade. She lives in the MiraF. Yapura community.

Ms. L. has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 5 years. She used her initial 300.00 PEN loan to increase her working capital for her hand-woven goods business.

At this time, she is requesting a 1,000.00 PEN loan, which she will invest in purchasing wool (sheep and alpaca) to make blankets, shawls, ponchos, etc. that she will then sell at the weekly street markets.

Her biggest wish is to make her business grow.

She likes the meetings offered at her microfinance institute because she has a good time.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool (sheep and alpaca)

loans.name: Toem

texts.en: H. is 31 years old, married with two school-aged children and lives in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia's capital, that has many good locations for making money. H. currently makes a living selling fresh fish caught by her husband or bought from wholesalers. She and her husband are also farmers. The growing season is approaching, and they need farming supplies. She is applying for a loan for $300 to buy rice seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Alice E

texts.en:
Alice E. T. lives in the village of Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 44 years old, married and has four school-aged children. She makes a living as a farmer, growing mostly rice. Alice has been engaged in this business for more than 22 years, and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from her work.

Last year, Alice joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and business. Alice has successfully repaid four previous loans from GDMPC which she has used to buy seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Alice has applied for a new loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is made up mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Catalina es socia del Banco Comunal “San Salvador Luminoso”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Capachica, Provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 52 años D. edad, estado civil casada y es madre D. 05 hijos todos ya independientes y no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, vive en el jr. Lima s/n en Capachica.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 1 año,  su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles para aumentar a su capital en su negocio D. venta D. verduras. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo D. S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, el cual invertirá en la compra D. productos D. la región y en las ferias semanales realiza el sistema del trueque y si le quedan productos los venD..

Su mayor deseo que su negocio crezca mucho.

A ella le gustan los préstamos y las reuniones ya que se divierten mucho
texts.en:
Ms. Catalina C. is a member of the “San Salvador Luminoso” Microfinance Institute, located in the Capachica district of the Puno province, department of Puno. She is a 52-year-old married mother with 5 independent children. She was never given the opportunity to study, and she lives on Lima Street in Capachica.

Ms. C. has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 1 year. She used her initial loan of 300.00 PEN to increase her working capital for her vegetable business.

At this time, she is requesting a 300.00 PEN loan, which she will invest in purchasing local produce. She barters at the weekly street markets, and sells whatever produce is left over.

Her biggest wish is for her business to grow significantly.

She likes the loans and the fun meetings offered by her microfinance institute.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase local produce: potatoes, freeze-dried potato products, quinoa, etc.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal “San Salvador Luminoso”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 45 años de edad, estado civil conviviente y es madre de 06 hijos y estudio educación primaria incompleta (3er grado), vive en la comunidad de Ilata.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 7 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, el cual invertirá en la compra de ovinos para engorde, lo vende en las ferias unas veces vivo y otro en carne dependiendo de la temporada, mercedes también realiza la actividad del trueque con productos de la región.

Su mayor deseo es continuar su trabajo y poder educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las charlas.

loans.use: Para la compra de ovinos.

loans.name: Larina

texts.en:
Larina own and manage a her village store in Annayatan, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 39 years old and married to Danilo who is a farmer. Their children are: Dandy - 16 years old, taking an automotive course;Dindy, 15 years old, third year high school and Lorina, 13 years old, a first year high school student. 

She hopes that her business will become progressive so that someday, her children will not experience the difficulties of life that they have been through. She also wanted them to become successful in the future.  The couple is working hard to support their studies and send them until college.

Larina is now requesting to borrow a loan of PHP5,000  from KIVA lenders that she can use for the expansion of her store. She hopes to purchase stocks of merchandise to retail that will somehow increase her daily income.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La señora Dominga es socia del Banco Comunal “San Salvador Luminoso”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 41 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 05 hijos y estudio educación primaria completa, vive en la comunidad de Ccotos.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 1 año,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, para la compra de pescado. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual invertirá en la compra de redes y corcho para su negocio de pesca artesanal, en este momento ella esta delicada de salud y su esposo la ayuda.

Su mayor deseo es continuar su trabajo.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Dominga is a member of the San Salvador Luminosos Comunal Bank, which is located in the Capachica district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 41, married, and has five children. She has an elementary school education. She lives in the Ccotos community. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for one year. She used her initial loan for 500 PEN to buy fish. She is now asking for a loan for 500 PEN to buy nets and floats for her fishing business. At this time she is in delicate health, and her husband helps her. Her biggest wish is to continue working. She likes the savings and the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fishing nets and floats

loans.name: Mrs. Thoeun Duch Village Bank Group

texts.en: A village bank loan which consists of twenty four people is located in Khsom village in Kandal province and all the members will use the loan in different purposes. Mrs. Thoeun D. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Keo Ra, is a fisherman. In his fishing business, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough nets for fishing which it is affect to his income. Thus, Mrs. Thoeun D. decided to ask for a loan to buy more nets for fishing business. She is 38 years old and the mother of four members, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more nets for fishing business.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy makes a living raising livestock and poultry. In order to continue to do this, she has applied for a loan from Kiva to buy feed for her chickens. She will also use a portion of the funds to provide for the needs of her family. 

At age 53, Amy is still very energetic and determined to grow her business because work keeps her going and gives her energy. She and her family live in Barangay Calao East, Santiago City. She hopes that growing her business will allow her to take better care of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for her chickens

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal “San Salvador Luminoso”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 25 años de edad, estado civil soltera y es madre de 01 hijos y estudio educación primaria completa, vive en la comunidad de Lago Azul  Yapura.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 5 meses,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, para la compra de lana de diferentes colores. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual invertirá en la compra de lanas de colores, agujas de tejer, hilos, etc. Lidia elabora todo tipo de manualidades y los vende  a los turistas que visitan Capachica.

Su mayor deseo es continuar su trabajo.

A ella le gustan los ahorros, las reuniones y las charlas.

loans.use: Para la compra de lanas de colores, agujas de tejer, hilos, etc

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann C. is 38 years old and has four school-aged children with her husand Elwin C., who makes a living as a fieldhand. The money he earns is not enough to support their family. That is why Mary Ann is looking for new ways to earn extra money by raising more pigs. She started her business with a loan from Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI). This business, which has done well, brings in extra income, so she would like to expand it. She will use a portion of this loan to buy more pigs and feed for them to eat. 

In addition to raising livestock, Mary Ann runs a variety store, which she stocks with funds earned from her livestock business. She plans to use some of the funds from this loan to buy more items to sell in her store, including soft drinks, wine, cooking oil, soy sauce and different kinds of groceries. She will also use some money from the loan to help run a small farm that she operates. 

Mary Ann's goal is to have enough money to provide for the education of her children, because she wants them to finish their studies, go to college and get good, stable jobs in the future. She is determined that they never experience the hardships she has gone through.

loans.use: To help expand several small businesses

loans.name: Alejandrina Claudia

texts.es:
La señora Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal “San Salvador Luminoso”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 34 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 4 hijos y estudio educación primaria completa, vive en Capachica.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 8 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para la compra de productos de la región. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 200.00 Nuevos soles, el cual invertirá en la compra de abarrotes, también vende productos de la región.

Su mayor deseo es continuar su trabajo.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the San Salvador Luminosos Comunal Bank, which is located in the Capachica district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 34, married, and has four children. She has an elementary school education. She lives in Capachica. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for almost eight years. With her initial loan for 300 PEN she bought products from her region. She is now asking for a loan for 200 PEN to buy groceries. She also sells regional products. Her biggest wish is to continue working. She likes the savings and the punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries

loans.name: Mrs. Reoung Sun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-four people who live in Khsom Village in Kandal Province make up the Village Bank loan group. The members have selected Mrs. Reoung S. to be the Village Bank President. All the members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. S. owns a wedding hall which she rents out to villagers. She faces an obstacle in her business because her wedding hall is S. old that it affects her incoM.. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to repair her wedding hall. She hopes to increase her incoM. and improve her business. Her husband, Mr. Seak Rith, is a taxi driver. This couple has six children, one of whom is a grocer while another helps with the father’s work; three are attending the local school and the remaining one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To repair her wedding hall.

loans.name: Mena Group

texts.en:
Anesa wants to take out a loan for her bakery business. Zabeda wants to take out a loan for her husband, who has a public bad. Mena wants to take out a loan for her embroidery business. Leda wants to take out a loan for her tailoring shop.

Mena is the leader of the Mena Group. There are four members in this group and each of them has requested a loan to expand their business. They are requesting a group loan of 42,000 afghani. They are very thankful to AFS and Kiva lenders who are able to support poor people.

loans.use: For business progress

loans.name: Dong

texts.en: Dong D., 48, is married and earns a living as a taxi driver. He has been in this business since 2000, and makes about $5 a day. He also buys fish in bulk for his wife to sell in the local market. His wife is facing a problem, because she does not have a place from which to sell. To help make this possible, they are applying for a loan of $800 to buy their own kiosk. We see Dong D. and his wife in this photograph.

loans.use: To buy a kiosk to use in the local market

loans.name: Asllam Madine Group

texts.en:
A. M. wants to take out a loan for his general store in order to purchase more goods; thus, significantly expanding his offerings. Jalel Jan would like to obtain a loan for his bakery: he wants to take on a new shop. Nazam M. wishes to use his loan for his general store. He hopes to attract more clients. Qahera would like a loan to use for her medical materials.

A. M. is the leader of the A. M. Group. There are four members in this group, all of whom hope to expand their businesses. The group wants to take out a loan of 40,000 afghani. They are happy to have the opportunity to access this kind of lending process, that can support entrepreneurs.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally E. is from the village of Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 33 years old. Sally is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Sally owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Sally has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Sally joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sally has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Sally is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Sally from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna F. is already 55 years old. She is married to Pedro, and they are living in the village of Calao East, Santiago City. She is engaged in a dressmaking business, and she also does clothing repairs. Some of the things she makes are school uniforms, sport uniforms, women's dresses, and pants for men. She wants to improve the quality of her finished product. And for this she needs to replace her old sewing machine. For this reason, Myrna is requesting to borrow a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to 4,000 PHP, to use as additional capital for the maintenance of her dressmaking business. 

Myrna is already getting old, and hopes to retire from dressmaking; however, life is becoming difficult, and thus she continues running the business no matter how tiring it is. She is thankful that her husband is always on her side supporting her every time she needs help. According to her, they must maintain the business for the welfare of their children.
