Her eldest child, Arlene, is already 23 years old, and Anthony, who is a college student, is 19 years old.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn V. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 42 years old. Evelyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a sari-sari, or general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Evelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Zaya Wadine Group

texts.en:
Zaya WaD. wants to take out a loan for his general store. He wants to enlarge his shop. Najma D. also requests a loan for his general store. He is a beginner in this business, and he wants to improve his business. Farshta and Rabya want to take out loans for their tailoring businesses.

Zaya WaD. is the leader of the Zaya WaD. Group. All of the members would like to receive money to expand and progress their businesses. There are four members in this group. They have requested a group loan of 56,000 afghani. They are very happy with Kiva lenders and AFS in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To improve their businesses

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en:
Diosa manages a general store business while her husband works as a driver for a bank in Bayombong. With only a small amount of capital, Diosa was able to purchase different grocery items that she sells in her store. However, with a desire to make her business grow, she is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders that will serve as additional capital for her store. She knows that her income will increase through her requested loan.

Diosa and her husband's greatest dream is to send their children to school. They want their children to have a stable job some day so they are working hard to provide for their education.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Ushirikiano Group

texts.en:
Christina is a member of the Ushirikiano borrower group in Mwanjelwa, Mbeya. She is 45 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 1 child. Her child is 22 years old.

Christina has owned a crops business for 4 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Christina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize and beans.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Christina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Sophia is another member of the same borrower group, she also requested the loan amount 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her shop business.

loans.use: To buy more maize and beans for sale

loans.name: Ilems Group

texts.en:
Kesila is a member of the Ilems borrower group in Mwanjelwa, Mbeya. She is 35 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 10,7, and 4 years old.

Kasila has owned a charcoal business for 7 years. She works 10 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzanian shillings. 


This is Kesila`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Kasila hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Rhodah is another member of the same borrower group, she also requested the loan amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more  charcoal for sale

loans.name: Raqema Group

texts.en:
Ramzeya wants to take out a loan for her tailoring business. Raqema wants to take out a loan for her quilting business. Qande Gull wants to take out a loan for her husband's business driving a taxi. Maryna wants to take out a loan for her husband's general store. 

Raqema is the leader of the Raqema Group. There are four members in this group and together they have requested a loan of 40000 afghani for the progress of their businesses. They are very happy with this loan process that is available to all people.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Ilem Group

texts.en:
Rozalia is a member of the Ilems borrower group in Mwanjelwa, Mbeya. She is 40 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 19,16,14, and 8 years old.

Rozalia has owned a charcoal business for 6 years. She works 10 hours a day  and she earns a monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Rozalia`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the a,mount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal for her business. 

With the additional profit she gains from the use  of this loan, Rozalia hopes to save more money, pay school fess, and expand her business.

Atuganile,Neema  are another member of the a same borrower group. They also requested the loan amount of 200,000 each one in order to expand their business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal fro her business

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 55 years old and married to Reynaldo, a carpenter and also a farmer in their village. Anita operates a small store in the village. Her desire to improve her store motivated her to request a loan of 9,000 PHP from Kiva lenders. She will use the loan to purchase different grocery items for her store.

Anita is hoping to improve her store to assist her husband in sending their children to school. They have four children: Rey Ann, Allan, Michael, and Daniel.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her store

loans.name: Ilem Group

texts.en:
Janeth is a member of the Ilem borrower group Mwanjelwa, Mbeya. She is 32 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 10,7, and 5 years old.

Janeth has owned a clothing business selling clothes for 6 years. She works10 hours day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Janeth first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Janeth hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Oliva is another member of the same borrower group, she also requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth or Ely as she was fondly called by her friends is residing in San Nicolas, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is now 54 years old and married to Armando, a farmer.  The couple were gifted with seven children. Some of them finished a course in college while her youngest child is still studying

Ely is operating her simple store in the village.  She sells different commodities such as soft drinks and vegetables. She used to purchase her products in the public market of Bayombong and sell in retail price in her store.  For the continuous improvement of her business, she is now asking to borrow a loan of PHP5,000 from KIVA lenders.  She hopes that her business will grow more and become a good source of income to meet the immediate needs of their family.

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Ngô's Group

texts.en:
"H. Ngô Thị (20209040018) is a 40 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Nguyệt Cầu 04 (4).


H. is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To making a living, H. operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.704.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.048.000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Ngô Thị K. (20209040019) is a 42 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Ngô Thị C. (20209040020) is a 35 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  Nguyễn Thị G. (20209040022) is a 34 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20209040023) is a 54 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Ngô Thị (20209040018) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Nguyệt Cầu 04 (4).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.704.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.048.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Ngô Thị K. (20209040019) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Ngô Thị C. (20209040020) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Nguyễn Thị G. (20209040022) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20209040023) là 54 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 27 years old and happily married to Reynaldo. The couple live in San Nicolas, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya, and have an 11-month-old baby called Angel. They have great ambitions for their child and their future children. They want them to become successful by providing them with the best education they can afford.

Despite the economic crisis, Catherine tries her best to maintain and expand her business so that her income increases. Her husband also strives very hard to earn a living and meet their daily needs. He works as a security guard in the Municipality of Bayombong while Catherine manages her sari-sari store (community-based store) in their village.

Catherine wants her business to become profitable and this is why she requested a loan of 5,000 PHP as additional capital. She hopes that Kiva lenders will grant her request as the loan will be a big help in improving her general store.

loans.use: As additional business capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Juhudi Group

texts.en:
Joyce is a member of the Juhudi borrower group in Mwanjelwa, Mbeya,. She is 39  years old, she  is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 16, 13, and 10 years old.

Joyce has owned a clothing business selling clothes for 7 years. She works 10 hours a day and she ears a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings. 

This is Joyce`s  first loan from BRAC_Tanzanian, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.


With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,  Joyce hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Annah is another member of the same borrower group, she also requested the amount of 100,000 Tsh in order to expand her food business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Danelda

texts.en:
Danelda B. has been a member of Kiva partner, ASHI, for a year. When she became a member, she accessed a loan that she used to finance a food vending business she manages herself, and a rice farming business managed by her farm laborer husband. After paying off the first loan from ASHI in six months, Danelda is now requesting a much larger loan that she will use to finance her husband’s fishing business. She wants to purchase a fishing boat for her husband and start up a hog-fattening (pig-raising) business.

Aside from rice farming and food vending, Danelda’s husband’s fishing business has been a large source of the family’s daily income and has enabled Danelda to save for her weekly payment to ASHI. Nevertheless, a hog-fattening business could also enrich their income since this business can yield as much as double the amount of its capital in profit once the hog is sold live, or slaughtered and sold per kilo, after every four months of fattening.

Danelda has to have many sources of income because she has seven children to nurture and support. These children range in age from 7 to 23 years old. Five of her eldest children have stopped studying because of the family's very poor financial situation. With loans from ASHI, Danelda wants to grow sources of income to meet the needs of her children and enable them to go back to school.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat, and finance a pig raising business

loans.name: Maleha Group

texts.en:
Maleha wants to take out a loan for her husband's general store. Ghallam Nabe wants to take out a loan for his general store. Qayes wants to take out a loan for his gas station.

Maleha is the leader of the Maleha Group. There are three members in this group. Each of them wants to take out a loan for business development. They are requesting a group loan 42,000 afghani. They are very happy to have this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To develop their businesses

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 52 years old and married to Virgilio. They have two children who are both married and living with their own families. Despite her age, Emelita is still very determined to continue in business and save money for times of emergency. 

Emelita runs a crochet business. She also sells native cakes and different snacks in their village in Calao East, Santiago City. Her crochet products include cell phone cases, refrigerator and television top dresses, curtains, and women's clothing. She is requesting a loan of PHP4,000 from Kiva lenders to further develop her business. She will use the loan to purchase the materials she needs for crochet making.

loans.use: To purchase crochet materials

loans.name: Ma. Aida

texts.en:
Along with her 23-year-old son, 52-year-old Ma. Aida S. lives with her 27-year-old daughter’s family. Early this year, she joined ASHI to get access to credit for financing a business for her son so he could have his own source of income.  Ma. Aida knew that his employment and income opportunities would be limited because of his limited education.  By providing him with a business to run for himself, she knew that he would be able to earn income everyday.  Ma. Aida is less worried about her daughter since she has a husband to support her.

Ma. Aida’s first loan in ASHI was used as a down payment (initial payment) for the motorcycle she bought for her son to use for a taxi hire business (which is commonly called “habal-habal” in the province dialect).  Everyday, Ma. Aida’s son can earn a minimum of Php100 profit, which he gave to Ma. Aida to pay for monthly amortization on the motorcycle.  Ma. Aida has her own income being a village faith healer. 

Over six months, Ma. Aida was able to repay her first loan and now she requests for a much larger loan to be used in paying her motorcycle’s amortization in advance, so she can be less worried each month.

loans.use: To make payments on the motorcycle used for a taxi business.

loans.name: Dorina

texts.en:
Dorina M. is from the village of Carmen Annex in Ozamiz City, which is in the Phillipines province of Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old and married with 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Dorina prepares and sells food, and she has been doing so for over 5 years, earning approximately 4000 PHP a month.

Dorina joined GDMPC in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dorina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC and is now requesting her 4th GDMPC loan, for 6000 PHP, to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale.

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
A man with strong determination.  This is the phrase that best describes Arnel B. of Barangay San Nicolas, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya.  He is now 30 years old, single and a graduate of a vocational course. He works as a vendor and aims to improve his business in order to help his parents and uplift their living condition.  

To fulfill his dream for his parents, he would like to borrow a loan of 5,000 PHP from KIVA lenders.  This amount will be of great help in maintaining his street food vending.  Some of his product includes pork, chicken legs, chicken intestines and frozen chicken blood. He is hoping that the Kiva lenders will support his business because he really wants to improve it and become profitable.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for street food vending.

loans.name: Hameda Group

texts.en: Hameda is the group leader of Hameda group. There are two members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan to progress their business and make it larger. Hameda wants to take a loan for the business of bag weaving. Sharefa wants to take a loan for the business of carpet weaving. They requested a group of loan 10000 Afghani and they are very happy for AFS and Kiva lenders who can support all poor people.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Juhudi Group

texts.en:
Waina is a member of the Juhudi borrower group in Mwanjelwa, Mbeya. She is  42  year old woman, she is married and a mother of 6 children. Her children are 24,20,16,13,10 and 7 years old.

Waina has owned a charcoal business for 10  years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Waina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 100,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal for her business.

with the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Waina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Tumwambilile is another member of the same borrower group, she  also requested the loan amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal  for her business

loans.name: Lê's Group

texts.en:
Huệ Lê Thị is a 31-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Huệ is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Cụm Đoài 2 (5).

Huệ is married and has 2 infants.  To making a living, she provides specialty tailoring services to members of the community.  Huệ has been in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3.500.000 VND a month.

Huệ joined SEDA in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Huệ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.808.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials.  She is now requesting a 3rd SEDA loan for the same puporse, this time in the amount of 6.048.000 VND.


About the Other Borrowers in Cụm Đoài 2 (5) Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị T. is a 58 year-old female requesting a 3.808.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.

2.  Nguyễn Thị B. is a 43 year-old female requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.

3.  Dương Thị B. is a 34 year-old female requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.

4.  Nguyễn Thị T. is a 35 year-old female requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.


About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is already 60 years old.  She and her husband separated in 1977.  She is a mother of five adult children: Anoy, Roberto, Marissa, Elizabeth and Ferdinand. They are all married and live separately from her. She is now living alone in her house located in San Luis, Cauayan, Isabela. Mercedita is still strong and very determined to manage her business despite her age.  

She manages a grocery store which is open from 4:00 in the morning and closes at 9:00 in the evening. She is requesting a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to 20,000 PHP that she will use to improve her store. Mercedita hopes to fulfill all her goals in the business for the benefit of her grandchildren.

loans.use: To improve her grocery store.

loans.name: Ma. Leonora

texts.en:
28-year-old Ma. Leonora E. is a mother of two children who range in age from one to five years. Her husband is a farmer while she runs her own business which she started up when she joined ASHI and has able to get a loan. Over six months of paying the loan she first had, fish selling business was her main source of income. Out of her profits on this business, she was able to pay back the whole amount she loaned on time and for the second time, Ma. Leonor is requesting for a larger amount of loan she will be using to start up a cattle (cow) fattening and hog (pig) fattening business in addition to her previous business. Once cattle and hog she raised have grown over the period of time, price when sold is as much double as its capital.
Ma. Leonora wished that through the loans she can access through ASHI, she will be able to grow the business she had put up to be able to augment her husband’s income and to be able to send all her children to college until graduation.

loans.use: Will be used to purchase a cattle and hog for a fattening business.

loans.name: Juhudi Group

texts.en:
Merry is a member of the Juhudi borrower group in  Mwanjelwa, Mbeya. She is 40  year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 20,17,15, and 10 years old.

Merry has owned a cafe business for 8 years. She works 10 hours day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzanian shillings.


This is merry first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more rice,  cooking oil  for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of thins loan, Merry hopes to save more money and expand  her business.

Rehema is  member of the same borrower group, she also requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more ricr, cooking oil for her busienss

loans.name: Nazera Group

texts.en:
Nazera is the group leader of this group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their business. Their expanding and progressing for their business. Their requested a group loan of 40000 Afghani. 
Nazera take loan for her husband’s business. And Anesa want to take loan for her son’s business of shows selling shop. And he want addition client for his shop. Also Zakya wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of general store. Tameam wants to take a loan for his business. They want to expanding and progressing for their business.

loans.use: their expand and progress for their business

loans.name: Jama Khan Group

texts.en: Jama Khan is the group leader of Jama Khan group. There are four members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan to expand the business and make it larger. So they are requesting a group loan of 56000 Afghani. Jama Khan wants to take a loan for his car parts shop. Amana wants to take a loan for her husband who has a general store. Abdul Hamed and Fatama want to take a loan for their carpet weaving business. They are very thankful for Kiva lenders who can support all entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn L., 30 years old, has a very supportive and responsible husband, 32-year-old Jodie L.. They have four children: nine-year-old Jodielyn, seven-year-old Shanely Ann Jane, Anthony Mark Louise and Ashley Rhell Jade.

One part of the family’s income comes from Jodie’s farming. They run a variety store selling daily necessities as well. Sometimes, however, Jodie works as a fisherman, but this pursuit is not very profitable. Not owning any fishing gear, he must borrow the equipment, which comes at a price: even though he may work hard out on the ocean, the one who owns the borrowed fishing gear demands a larger percentage than Jodie receives of the day’s take.

So Bebelyn is requesting a second loan from Kiva’s field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI). With this loan she will buy fishing gear, including a Robin boat motor, nylon rope and other things needed to start their own fishing business. Bebelyn will also help her husband sell their fish. This way Jodie and she will receive 100% in profits from the day’s catch.

Bebelyn would also like to use the loan to increase the items available at her variety store such as canned goods, cooking oil, refined sugar, detergent and other groceries. The variety store was Bebelyn’s idea so they could increase their income to meet everyday expenses and the cost of educating her four children.

loans.use: To be used for a new fishing business & to supplement her store's stock

loans.name: Phạm's Group

texts.en:
C. Phạm Thị (20209020006) is a 59 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. C. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Đoài 2 (1).

C. is married and has 1 adult child. To making a living, C. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale. C. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2.500.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, C. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. C. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.704.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.048.000 VND which will be used for the same purpose. The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Ngô Thị Hà (20209020007) is a 46 year-old female who is requesting a 6.408.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store. 2. Nguyễn Thị D. (20209020008) is a 53 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business. 3. Dương Thị Q. (20209020009) is a 23 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store. 4. Lê Thị Hoài (20209020010) is a 57 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her tailoring business.

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Original version:

C. Phạm Thị (20209020006) là 59 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở tH.nh phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. C. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các tH.nh viên. Mặc dù mỗi tH.nh viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các tH.nh viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đoài 2 (1). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. C. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, C. kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND. Vào 2008, C. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. C. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.704.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.048.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Ngô Thị Hà (20209020007) là 46 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.408.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 2. Nguyễn Thị D. (20209020008) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh sản xuất. 3. Dương Thị Q. (20209020009) là 23 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 4. Lê Thị Hoài (20209020010) là 57 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh may mặc.

Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Ilem Group

texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the Ilem borrower group in Mwanjelwa, Mbeya. She is 45 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 29,25,20 and 17 years old.

Lucia  has owned a Tailoring business  for 10 years. She works 11 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 80,000T Tanzanian shillings.

This is Lucia`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more materials for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Lucia hopes to save money and expand her business.

Nelly, Joyce are also the member of the same borrower group, they also requested the loan amount of 200,000 and 150,000 respectively in order to expand their business.

loans.use: To buy more materials

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia manages a small store situated in front of their house. She really wants her business to become profitable so she is now requesting to borrow a loan from KIVA lenders in the amount of PHP9,000.00 for the growth of her store. With the assistance of this loan she believes that her income will increase and she can support the educational needs of their children.
Ofelia is 47 years old. She is married to Oscar who works as a farmer. They are living in South Caronsi, Peńablanca, Cagayan with their five children: Rosalie - 25 years old; Maricel - 24 years old; Jonas - 20 years old; Eleneor - 18 years old, a college student and Shiela May - 12 years old, in grade school.

loans.use: additional capital for the growth of her store

loans.name: Chu's Group

texts.en:
G. Chu V. (20209040013) is a 25 year old male living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. G. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Nguyệt Cầu 1 (3).

G. is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To making a living, G. owns & operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing & selling aluminum products to local businesses and community members. G. has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, G. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. G. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.256.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. He is now requesting a new loan of 6.048.000 VND for the same purpose. The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. G. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Nguyễn Thị L. (20209040014) is a 52 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her livestock business. 2. Nguyễn Thị Lý (20209040015) is a 34 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her livestock business. 3. Nguyễn Thị C. (20209040016) is a 30 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her livestock business. 4. Nguyễn Thị Huề (20209040017) is a 63 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her livestock business.

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Lourinda

texts.en:
Lourinda is 51 years old and she is married to Piting and blessed with three children: Rhadzimir – 16 years old, a college student; Fatima – 13 years old, a high school student and the youngest is Shariffa Marian – 10 years old, who is currently enrolled in elementary school.
Lourinda and her husband started their junk shop business after they got married wherein they use their small savings as business capital. They are helping one another in maintaining their small business. She is now asking for a loan of PHP20,000 from the KIVA lenders that they will use for the growth of their junk shop in purchasing recyclable materials. They buy scrap materials like old newspapers, used boxes, empty cans, bottles, plastic bottles, and other materials that they can sell.
The business is too dirty for other people but Lourinda and her husband do not care about it because this is where they get their source of living.

loans.use: to purchase recyclable materials for their junk shop

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mr. Chanthy L., age 43 (shown in the picture with his wife), and his wife, Mrs. Sreymao Em, age 41, live along national road number one approximately 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1991 and have got five children: four daughters and one son. Two of them were married and live outside the family home and other three attend school. 

Chanthy has been driving remoque taxi for 15 years, while his wife has been growing vegetables for 10 years. A remoque is a motorbike attached with a trailer at the back. He carries goods and people from his village to Phnom Penh and back. He is able to earn 20,000.00 riel/day (about 5 USD).

Unluckily, Chanty’s remoque beaks down in some parts and it doesn’t work properly so he is applying for his first loan of $500 to repair it and he will use a part of the loan to repair a house where he lives as well.

loans.use: To repair his remoque and repair a house where he lives.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is married to Peter and they were gifted with four children: Petre - 23 years old; Mary Flor – 22 years old; Julius – 19 years old, a college student and Abigail - 18 years old. Their two eldest children are already married. Because of the hardships that she had in life during her younger years, Tessie has the determination to work hard to give her family a better way of living.
The couple is managing an eatery business along the high school building in their place. Her husband also works as a farmer where they can earn seasonal income. Aside from their eatery and farming business, they also maintain a piggery. Sometimes her husband also works as a part time carpenter where he can earn a salary of PHP280 a day.
Tessie wants her eatery or school canteen business to grow. And for this she needed additional capital to pursue her plan. She is now requesting financial assistance from KIVA lenders a loan of PHP20, 000. She is eager to see the progress in her business thus she is working hard and patiently waiting for it to become progressive.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria T.'s main source of income comes from making and selling snacks and delicacies in her community. She is 45 years old, married and has five school-age children.They are from the village of Baylag, Mambajao Camiguin. Victoria has been in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4000 PHP.

In 2009, Victoria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Victoria is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be Victoria's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thi's main source of income comes from operating a family member's business raising cattle. She is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong – Bắc Ninh. T. is married and has three school-age children. T. has been in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 2.500.000 VND a month.

T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. is requesting a first loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. T. plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

T. is the leader of a five member group accessing a loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tiên Trà 1 (8). No. 20211040039

About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Trần Thị K. is a 40 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. No. 20211040040

2. Nguyễn Sỹ K. is a 38 year-old man who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support his business raising livestock. No. 20211040041

3. Trần K. Q. is a 28 year-old man who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support his business making furniture. No. 20211040042

4. Nghiêm Thị Huệ is a 46 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. No. 20211040043

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

T. Nguyễn Thi (20211040039) là 33 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Tiên Trà 1 (8).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND. T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Trần Thị K. (20211040040) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2. Nguyễn Sỹ K. (20211040041) là 38 tuổi nam. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3. Trần K. Q. (20211040042) là 28 tuổi nam. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.

4. Nghiêm Thị Huệ (20211040043) là 46 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Mrs. Pov K. and her husband have been growing rice and vegetables since they were married. In addition, she produces palm leaves used for roofing. She sells them in her village. Pov, 52, and her husband, Mr. Koet Choun, 54, were married in 1979 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Three of the children are married and live in separate homes, and two unmarried children live with their parents. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Pov is requesting a loan of $350 to purchase a motorbike for her unmarried son to drive as a motor taxi. She is pictured with her son.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to drive as a motor taxi

loans.name: Wahed Group

texts.en:
Wahed is the group leader of Ahmad Wahed group. There are five members in this group and each of them is taking a loan to expand her or his business.
Wahed wants to take a loan to for his business of DVD shop.Nekena wants to take a loan for her husband, who has small electric materials.Nekena husband wants to purchase a new electric materials for his shop.K. Mohammad wants to take a loan for the photo shop business and he wants buy new camera for his shop because he has lots of problems and help with families. Faryba and Gullaly want to take a loan for the business of tailoring. Their want to buy new machine for their business. 
They requested a group loan of 70000 Afghani. They are very thankful to Kiva lenders that support the entrepreneurs in the progress of their business.

loans.use: their improve for their businee

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
S., age 22, is a young mother caring for one lovely baby. She married her husband in early 2007, and they live away from their parents' homes. S. raises some poultry to sell, while her young husband earns a living as a fisherman. In addition, S. and her husband also have a farming business. S. has known the basics of cultivating rice since she was single – a skill she learned from her grandparents.

It is the farming season and the time for S. to grow a rice crop, but she lacks some farm supplies. Therefore, she is applying for a loan to buy a water buffalo to plow her field, and for fertilizers and rice seed to grow.

loans.use: To buy a water buffalo, fertilizers and rice seed

loans.name: Precious

texts.en: Precious is 32 years old and married with three children. She sells foodstuffs like gari (couscous-like grain made from grated cassava) and other food items. She has been in the business for the past six years. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more bags of gari to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more gari  to sell

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is a tailor. He is 33 years old and married with a child. He is from Edo State, Nigeria. Andrew is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more sarongs to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia A. is from the village of Kabuhi, Pandan Camiguin. She is 45 years old. Antonia is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Antonia owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling smoked coco pulp. This is used for making edible oil; the local process is termed as 'copras'. Antonia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Antonia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Antonia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jema

texts.en:
Jema operates a fruit and vegetable vending business in their rural village of South Caronsi, Peñablanca, Cagayan. She roams around their village to sell her merchandise.  From the business, Jema is able to generate an income of PHP1, 000 a week which is very beneficial in providing the daily needs of her family and give the educational needs of her children.  For the continuous improvement of her enterprise, she would like to borrow a loan of PHP12,000 from the KIVA lenders.  She is hoping that her loan will be granted for it will really help to achieve her goals.  

Jema is 22 years old and she is already married to Jessie who assisted her in planting different kinds of vegetables in their farm that she sells after harvest. Her husband sometimes works as a carpenter in their village to earn additional income. The couple is blessed with two children: James - 5 years old and Jessie Jr. is one year old. Jema is willing to extend help to others because she always believes that “it is better to give than to receive”.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Rohbar

texts.ru: Рохбар Исмоилова проживает в районе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 44 года. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Рохбар более 8 лет занимается животноводством, т.е. откармливанием и продажей скота. Муж работает строителем в местной фирме. Кредит просит для закупа скота, откармливания и дальнейшей продажи.
texts.en:
Rohbar I. lives in the Qurgan-Tube district. She is 44 years old, married and has 2 children. Rohbar has been involved in animal husbandry, i.e. raising and selling livestock, for over 8 years. Her husband works as a construction worker at a local company. Rohbar is requesting a loan in order to purchase livestock, raise it and subsequently sell it.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara sells foodstuffs at Oba Markets. She is 45 years old and married with 7 children. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs such as okra, melons, peppers, etc. She thanks you for supporting  the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.en:
Raymundo is 58 years old. He is a resident of Barangay South Caronsi, Peñablanca, Cagayan. He is married to Ester, 47 years old.  They have five children: Reyna - 28, Emily - 23, Joyelon - 21, Remark – 19 and Norman – 16 years old. 

Raymundo is a local farmer and he manages a 1.5 hectares of corn field and at he is also engaged in the livestock business particularly goat raising. He used to wakes up early in the morning for his two businesses. 

He wanted to borrow loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP9, 000 for his goat raising business. The loan will be utilized in building goat house and some will be used to buy a piglet that he will also start to raise.  He is doing her best to earn good income for the benefit of her family.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn Q. is from the village of Lagundi, Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 38 years old. Marlyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marlyn owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Marlyn has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Marlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Radjabali

texts.ru: Раджабали Мирзоалиев проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 49 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Раджабали сам бизнесмен. Он более 10 лет занимается торговлей у себя в магазине. В основном торгует хозяйственными товарами. Его жена домохозяйка. Ему также помогают его дети. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Radjabali M. lives in the Khuroson district. He is 49 years old, married and has 5 children. Radjabali is a businessman. He has been involved in retail sales for over 10 years at his store. He mainly sells household goods. His wife is a homemaker. His children also help him. Radjabali is requesting a loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Anamarie

texts.en:
Anamarie is a fruit vendor in the village. She is 26 years old and married to Marlon who is working as a tricycle (local three-wheeled vehicle) driver. Her husband is a good provider; he focuses on the needs of their family especially the education of their children. They are blessed with two children: Mark Anthony, 8 years old, and Marian Angela, 6 years old. They are living peacefully at Barangay South Caronsi Peñablanca, Cagayan.

Anamarie is requesting a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 9,000. She plans to use the loan to buy more fruit that she will sell and hopes that she can develop her business so she can have a fruit stand in the public market. It is really her dream to make her business grow for the future of their children, thus she is praying for the support of KIVA lenders.

She is able to generate PHP 2,000 weekly gross income from her vending and according to her it is not enough, so she is trying her best to cope with the increasing price of commodities. She believes that her dreams of becoming a successful fruit vendor will be achieved through her patience and hard work.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Sotheary

texts.en:
Mrs. Sotheary C., age 31(shown in the photo with her mother), was married in 2006 and has two young daughters. She lives in a small village across Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her mother is farmer.

Both, Sotheary and her husband are teachers. Besides of teaching, she is a silk weaver as well. She sells her finish products to a middleman, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh market. Sotheary is applying for her first loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business and purchase a water pumping machine for her mother’s farming business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving businesses and purchase a water pumping machine for her mother’s farming business.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 22-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Mahmoud has owned a mobile phone shop for over a year. He has owned a mobile phone, accessories and mobile recharge cards and repairs mobile phones. He requested a loan of 2000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase used mobile phones, recharge cards and accessories for his work. This is the first time that Mahmoud has requested a loan.

Mahmoud is special in his work because of his good reputation and competitive prices. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Mahmoud first started his business, he had financial issues, but those ended 6 months after he opened his shop. He decided on doing his business because of his experience in IT and mobile phones. In the future, he plans on expanding by opening a second mobile phone shop.

loans.use: To purchase used mobile phones, recharge cards and accessories for his work

loans.name: Madonna

texts.en:
Madonna is engaged in vegetable production and sales. With the help of her husband, she plants and harvests her own vegetables that she sell at retail prices in her village. Sometimes they also sell their harvest in the market, where she can earn higher income. The business helps her family a lot, especially in sending her children to school.

Madonna is 46 years old. Her husband, Sesinado, works as a farmer. Their family resides in Barangay South Caronsi Peñablanca, Cagayan. They are blessed with six children: Richard, 24 years old, high school graduate; Kristina, 23 years old, high school graduate; Bryan, 18 years old, high school graduate; Karina, 16 years old, high school graduate; Carlo, 9 years old, in grade school; and Katrina, 5 years old, is in kindergarten.

Madonna wanted to apply for a loan of 13,000 PHP that will serve as additional capital for her vending business. She hopes to maintain the business and someday be able to develop it into a bigger one. She needs to strive hard and have faith to God in order to be successful.

loans.use: Additional capital for vegetable business

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina R. owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 36 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Kabuhi, Camiguin. Marina has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Marina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Marina is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be Marina's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nurmahmad

texts.ru: Нурмахмад Исоев проживает в районе Абдурахмони Чоми. Возраст 33 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Нурмахмад более 7 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Его основные покупатели это мясники. Жена смотрит за домом и детьми. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Nurmahmad I. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi district. He is 33 years old, married and has 4 children. Nurmahmad has been involved in animal husbandry for over 7 years. He raises and sells livestock. His primary customers are butchers. His wife looks after the house and children. Nurmahmad is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad has been working as a carpenter for nine years. He is a 44 year old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. Mohamad does good work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He didn’t face difficulties when he first started his business. Mohamad decided on this work to use his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding.

Mohamad requested a loan of $1000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is married to Ricky, a simple farmer. She is 35 years old, and she is a loving mother to their six children whose ages range from three to seventeen years old. She hopes that all her children will someday earn college degrees.

Lucia manages a snack vending business, and sometimes she also accepts catering jobs. Her ambition is to have a productive business, so she is requesting a loan of PHP 7000 to expand it. She also intends to use some of the loan to help her husband meet farming needs. She believes that somehow she will be able to overcome whatever challenges that come along in life through the help of KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To expand her snack vending business & for farming needs

loans.name: Duong

texts.en:
S. is a 24-year-old farmer who lives in Pursat Province and is married to 26-year-old Mr. Roeun. They work together farming. S.'s husband is also hired by nearby neighbors to cook food for their parties. The young couple has two young children who are already enrolled in school.

S. is taking out a loan to buy two sacks of fertilizer and rice seed to grow during this coming farming season.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth manages a general store in South Caronsi, a village in the municipality of Peńablanca, Cagayan Province. She is fifty years old and a widow. She has ten children: Jocelyn, Joey, Jeffrey, Jodelyn, Jonaly, Jovelyn, Jocelie, Joebert, Jose, and Jemuel. Even though nine of her children were not able to attend college due to financial difficulties, Elizabeth aspires to send her youngest child to college. She is thankful that her two eldest children are helping support the family in household expenses and in daily allowances for her youngest child.

Through Field Partner Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc. (ASKI), Elizabeth is requesting a loan from KIVA lenders of PHP 8000 in order to maintain the growth of her general store. She would like to buy additional items that she could sell at retail to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her store

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen sells food and snails. She purchases her goods from village markets and sells them the city. She has been in this business for 13 years. She is 42 years old and married, and she has 7 children. She is hoping for a loan of N50000 to purchase more food and snails to sell. She is grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food and snails to sell

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Mr. Chenda C., age 47, and his wife, Mrs. Kan Pov, age 48, have been married since 1981. They have three sons and six daughters. One of their children was married and lives outside the family home, one son is a soldier and other three children work in garment factory. The family lives approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Chenda has been driving motor taxi for 15 years. His wife stays at home and does housework. The couple is in the process of building new house to stay, but they lack money to finish it. So, Chenda is requesting his first loan of $500 to make the finishes.

loans.use: To finish his house’s building.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 28 years old. She is married to Jogie, a house carpenter who sometimes also works as a farm laborer. They are blessed with two children, Gregorio, age 9, and Janice, age 5. Both of the children are enrolled in a public school in their village. The family resides in Barangay South, Caronsi Peñablanca, Cagayan.

Jane sells cooked foods by going house-to-house around their village. To continue her business, she is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders of PHP 9,000 to use as additional capital to supply her customers with food snacks. She dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman for the future of her two children. She believes that her vending business will somehow pave the way to a progressive living.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан Исоев проживает в районе Абдурахмони Чоми. Возраст 42 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Хасан более 18 лет работает бухгалтером в фирме. Вот более 4 лет вместе со своей семьей занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Hasan I. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi district. He is 42 years old, married and has 4 children. Hasan has been working as an accountant at a company for over 18 years. Together with his family, he has also been involved in animal husbandry for over 4 years. He raises and sells livestock. Hasan is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 45 year old and married with 2 children. She sells sarongs, bags and shoes. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is hoping for a loan of N80000 to purchase more sarongs shoes and bags to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs, bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
Roy A. is 40 years old. He is married to Lorena, who is a simple housewife. The couple have three children, Sherwin, age 14; Ron Ron, age 10; and Roy Jr., age 6. The children study in a public school, so Roy works hard to provide them with a daily school allowance.  

In addition to tilling their small farm, Roy also raises native chickens. His simple businesses makes things great for his family, so he wants to maintain them. 

Roy was motivated to request financial assistance from Kiva lenders to support his poultry business. This loan of  PHP 5,000 has already been a big help because it is allowing him to build a chicken house and purchase feed. He is doing everything so that he can send his children to school until college.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Phakkdey

texts.en:
Mrs. Phakkdey U., age 45, is widow with a 19-year-old daughter. She lives along National Road Number One approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Phakkdey has been operating a grocery store for many years. She is also a tailor. Phakkdey is applying for a loan of $200 to purchase additional grocery items to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her grocery business

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger B. is from the village of North Poblacion. Guinsiliban, Camiguin. He is 48 years old. Roger is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Roger provides a local motorcycle transportation service to community members. Roger has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Roger joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roger has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and was used as working capital. Roger is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Roger from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
H. is a 50-year-old married woman and mother. She lives with other family members in her own small family home in Pursat Province. She owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandparents who died of senility many years ago. 

She grows different kinds of crop on her land, such as cabbage, cucumbers, and morning glories, that she sells to buyers every two or three months when the plants mature. Her husband has grown these crops with her. The couple is married and has five children, three of whom are married and two of whom are single and attend school. 

In the past, H. has hired her neighbor's buffalo to help her on the farm because she did not have her own buffalo. She will use this loan to buy a buffalo that she will use to eliminate the cost of renting.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo

loans.name: Husniddin

texts.ru: Хусниддин Иссомадинов проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 29 лет. Женат, имеет 2 несовершеннолетних детей. Хусниддин более 5 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Он в основном торгует национальными тканями. Кредит просит для закупа ткани осеннего сезона. На полученную прибыль хочет приобрести компьютер.
texts.en:
Husniddin I. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. He is 29 years old, married and has 2 young children. Husniddin has been involved in retail sales at a market for over 5 years. He mainly sells traditional fabrics. He is requesting a loan to purchase fabrics for the autumn season. He wants to use resulting profits to purchase a computer.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha B. is from the village of Alangilan in Sagay Camiguin. She is 33 years old. Editha is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Editha runs a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells food and daily use products in the local community. Editha has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Editha joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Editha is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Editha from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer in order to cultivate more crops.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 54 year old and married with 6 children. She sells drinks and has been in the business for the past 28years. She hopes for the loan amount of N150000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Шерали Расулов проживает в районе Бохтар. Возраст 43 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Шерали по специальности "водитель". По специальности он проработал более 15 лет. Вот более 5 лет занимается предоставлением услуги такси по городу. Кредит просит для ремонта своей автомашины, т.к. эта машина является единственным источником дохода.
texts.en:
Sherali R. lives in the Bohtar district. He is 43 years old, married and has 3 children. Sherali is a driver by trade. He worked in this field for over 15 years. He has also been providing taxi services around the city for over 5 years. Sherali is requesting a loan in order to repair his car because this car is his sole source of income.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repair

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda D. is from the village of North Poblacion in Camiguin. She is 55 years old. Erlinda is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda makes annd sells grilled bananas with butter and sugar to the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Erlinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase supplies for the harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs to use to make dishes to sell

loans.name: Mercy
