texts.en: Mercy owns a shop where she sells provisions and foodstuffs, She makes hairs for people and also operates a video club. She is 36 years old and married. She has been in the business for the past 3 years. She hopes the loan amount of N100000 to purchase refrigerator and invest the rest in foodstuffs to sells. She thanks you for the loan

loans.use: To purchase refrigerator for cooling drinks and sachet water and invest the rest in foodstuffs

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty sells sarongs and also sells meats in the market. This is one trade she has be able to combine for the past 10 years. She is 45 years old and married with 4 children. She is requesting for the loan of N80000 to purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida G. is from the village of Mambajao in Camiguin. She is 55 years old. Nida is widowed and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Nida owns and operates a store known in the Philippines as a "ukay-ukay," where she sells used clothing and food products to the local community. Nida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Nida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Nida is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
At the age of 69, Conchita O. is widowed, but continues her life. At her age, she never tires of doing things to make money for everyday living. Her four children, Ludy, Gemma, Joel and Roque, sometimes give her some money from their salaries because they are now employed. But Conchita does not stop working because she knows her children also need income for their own families. She wants to be the one who helps her children's families, especially for her grandchildren. That’s why she decided to join and borrow from Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva field partner, to get the capital that she needed to start her food preparation business and her restaurant. 

Now, her business is still running, but she needs another loan to expand her business and diversify her menu. She will use her second loan from ASHI to buy rice, pork, vegetables, and spices. This will make her business grow.

Conchita has a simple dream. Preventing her family from experiencing the hard things will make her happy. That’s why she will never tire of helping them.

loans.use: To finance her food preparation business

loans.name: Ronavel

texts.en:
Ronavel O. is from the village of Alangilan in Sagay Camiguin. She is 33 years old. Ronavel is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ronavel owns an operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Ronavel has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Ronavel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronavel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Ronavel is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Ronavel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Crescentia

texts.en:
Crescentia is married and lives in Ntabese Nkwen, a quarter in Bamenda, Cameroon. She has six children, three of whom are below fifteen years in age. Crescentia sells scourge eggs and cooked food in a private secondary school during lunch hour. With this loan, she plans to buy flour, eggs and other ingredients to make the food she sells. She has faced hardship and numerous challenges in life, such as the death of her first son and second daughter. There was a time when her entire family was sick. She has also lost two brothers who were very supportive of her and helped her take care of her family.

Crescentia has been a member of GHAPE since 2005, and this will be her fourth loan. She has been quite successful in the past with her business due to her location, the quality of her food, and her reasonable prices. She has a strong customer base and is confident that she will be able to increase her sales. Part of the profits from this loan will be used towards school fees for her children. The rest will be used for medication and for feeding her large family. She does not foresee a problem with her loan repayments, as they are quite small repayments every two weeks.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards empowerment of the poor, and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account. Most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff, and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying flour, eggs and other ingredients.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 57 year old, a widow with 8 children. She sells sarongs and has been in the business for the past 9 years. She hopes the loan amount of N80000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Daakyi Nti Group

texts.en:
Kwadwo is fifty-five years old. He is married and has eight children, all of whom are in school. He works hard to provide for his family. Kwadwo is the leader of a trust bank group called "Daakyi Nti," which means "for the future." In the photograph, the group leader, Kwadwo, is standing.

The members of the group are engaged in commercial activities such as food vending, clothes selling, etc. Some of them hawk (go door-to-door) to sell their products while others trek to nearby communities to sell on their market days. They buy the goods in Kumasi and nearby towns. The experience that some of these traders have amassed over the years has given them the urge to expand their businesses. Thus, they need a loan to buy goods in bulk to realize this dream.

loans.use: To buy products to sell

loans.name: Amégansi Baï

texts.fr: Cette femme s’est spécialisée dans un commerce d’un genre assez particulier : elle vend des perles et bijoux traditionnels mais originaux, très rares ces temps-ci. Elle a débuté ce commerce en 2002 dans le quartier d’Adakpamé à Lomé. Très vite, elle s’est connue surtout des touristes en visite à Lomé, mais aussi des togolais de la diaspora à la recherche des souvenirs du pays pour leurs amis européens. Elle a recruté des jeunes filles qui se promènent dans les villages et coins reculés du Togo à la recherche de ces perles authentiques. Elle a toujours réalisé de très bonnes affaires. Elle compte ouvrir d’autres points de vente dans deux autres quartiers de Lomé. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour commander plusieurs perles et bijoux traditionnels. Cette femme est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman became specialized in a fairly unusual business:  she sells pearls and traditional yet original jewelry, very rare these days.  She started this business in 2002 in the Adakpamé district of Lomé.  Very soon, she carried on particularly with visiting tourists in Lomé and also with Togolese of the diaspora looking for souvenirs of the nation for their European friends.  She has recruited girls to stroll through the villages and remotes corners of Togo looking for these authentic pearls.  She has always done good business.  She plans on opening other sales outlets in two other districts of Lomé.  For this reason, she's requesting a WAGES loan to place an order for several pearls and traditional pieces of jewelry.  This is a woman who is married and the mother of two children. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy traditional pearls

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel R. is from the village of Mambajao in Camiguin. She is 32 years old. Maricel is single. To make a living, Maricel sells ready-to-wear clothing and personal home products to tourists and local community members. Maricel has just started this business.

In 2009, Maricel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Maricel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying tires for resale

loans.name: Afi Essenam

texts.fr: Madame Afi est une revendeuse d’objets en plastiques et de bassines de toute catégorie. Elle a fait ce choix en 2007 parce que les revenus financiers de son mari conducteur de taxi, n’arrivent plus à couvrir les besoins de leur foyer, et assurer l’éducation scolaire de leur enfant. C’est une vendeuse ambulante du quartier très peuplé de Lomé dénommé Super Taxo. Actuellement elle a réellement besoin de constituer un nouveau stock ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 50 grands seaux en plastiques, 30 bassines en aluminium, 25 petits seaux en plastique.
texts.en:
Ms. Afi is a retailer of plastic ware and basins of all types.  She made this choice in 2007 because her husband's income as a taxi driver no longer managed to cover their household needs or to secure their child's education. Afi is a hawker in the densely populated district of Lomé called Super Taxo.  Currently, she has a real need to build up a new inventory;  for this reason, she's requesting a WAGES loan to buy 50 large plastic buckets, 30 aluminum basins, and 25 small plastic buckets.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic ware

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie V. D. C. is a 50-year-old widow and the mother of eight children who range in age from six to 27 years old. Her eldest daughter, who has been working abroad, supports her financially and enables her to support the rest of her children, who are dependent on her for their everyday lives. 

To augment her daughter’s income abroad, early in 2009, Elsie joined ASHI to have access to credit for business capital. Then she opened a variety store. With the profits from her store, she was able to repay her loan on time. 

Now Elsie is requesting another loan from ASHI, which she will use to expand her store and start a new hog-raising business. In the hog business, the profit is as much as double the amount of the initial capital investment when the hogs are sold after months of fattening. So, the more pigs that Elsie can raise and sell, the more profits she will earn. Someday, through the loans she can access from ASHI, Elsie hopes that her business will grow and become profitable enought for her to be able to support all of her children. 

For now, she has to support the education of her three younger children in high school and elementary school. She hopes that all three will be able to graduate from college.

loans.use: To finance her variety store and start a new hog-raising business

loans.name: Yie Die Group

texts.en:
Christiana is fifty – five years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, all in school. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Yie Die’, meaning success. The members of the group are engaged in commercial activities such as food vending, provision selling, clothes selling, etc. Some of them hawk to sell their products while others trek to nearby communities to sell on their market days. 
They procure their stocks from Kumasi and nearby towns. The experience some of these traders have amassed over the years has given them the urge to expand their businesses, hence the need for the loan to buy goods in bulk to realize this dream. The group leader, Christiana is seated in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Yaya Nyédji

texts.fr: Yaya est une dame qui a appris le métier de coiffure ; elle exerce cette activité depuis 2006 dans sa boutique personnelle située dans le quartier de Baguida à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet en outre d’aider financièrement son mari pour subvenir aux besoins de leurs 02 enfants. Elle profite de l’occasion qui s’offre à elle pour proposer et vendre à ses clientes des mèches de qualité. Elle dispose de beaucoup de clientes qui lui sont fidèles à cause du bon accueil qu’elle leur réserve. Actuellement elle voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 50 mèches Curly, 50 mèches Ondulées, 50 mèches Africa’s Beauty et 100 mèches Nina. Elle est convaincue qu’elle pourra régler à temps ses engagements de remboursement à cause de sa maîtrise du marché.

loans.use: Achat de mèches

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Bélia Goussivi Elénam

texts.fr: Cette femme s’est spécialisée dans la vente de couches jetables pour bébés  ainsi que des bonneteries. Elle a débuté cette activité en 2006 au Grand Marché de Lomé. Cette activité génératrice de revenus lui permet de subvenir à la plupart de ses besoins. Elle réalise de très bonnes affaires car sa boutique est la seule du coin vendant de telles couches. Elle veut combler son stock qui s’épuise en ce moment ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 100 paquets de couches jetables de différentes qualités, des bonneteries de toute sorte. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant.

loans.use: Achat de couches jetables et de bonneterie

loans.name: Grace Group

texts.en: Juliana is thirty years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all in school. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Juliana is the leader of a trust bank group called Grace. The members of the group are all hard working. They are engaged in commercial activities such as food vending, provision selling, clothes selling, etc. Some of them hawk to sell their products while others trek to nearby communities to sell on their market days. They procure their stocks from Kumasi and nearby towns. They have acquired a great deal of experience over the years and they desire to expand their businesses, hence the need for the loan to buy goods in bulk to realize this dream. The group leader, Juliana is seated in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Awurade Adom Group

texts.en:
Theresa is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, all of whom are in school. She works hard to support her husband and help him to provide for their family. 

Theresa is the leader of a trust bank group called "Awurade Adom," which means "God’s grace." The members of the group all work hard. They are engaged in commercial activities, such as selling food, groceries, and clothing. Some of them sell their products door-to-door ("hawking") while others trek to nearby communities to sell on their market days. They buy their goods in Kumasi and nearby towns. They have acquired a great deal of experience over the years and they want to expand their businesses, hence the need for the loan to buy goods in bulk to realize this dream. 

Theresa, the group leader, is seated in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy goods to sell

loans.name: Afi Mawuli

texts.fr: Cette dame a ouvert une boutique de vente des produits de mercerie dans le quartier d’Avénou à Lomé. Elle s’est lancée dans ce commerce en 2008 parce que la plupart des tailleurs et couturières du quartier étaient obligés de parcourir de longues distances, en se rendant au Grand Marché, avant de pouvoir s’approvisionner. Actuellement elle reçoit les demandes de tous ces tailleurs, ce qui lui permet donc de réaliser de bonnes affaires. Cette activité lui permet aussi d’apporter sa contribution financière  à son mari pour l’éducation scolaire de leurs 02 enfants. C’est pour renouveler son stock en état d’épuisement qu’elle sollicite une crédit de WAGES pour commander des fils de surfilages, des fils à plinthes, des tissus de bonne qualité et des bazins de différents motifs.
texts.en:
This is a lady who opened a store for selling sewing supplies in her district of Avénou in Lomé.  She got started in this commerce in 2008 because most tailors and seamstresses in the area were compelled to go far, all over the place at the Grand Market, in order to supply themselves.  Right now, she's receiving orders from all the tailors, which therefore allows her to do a good business.  Her work also enables her bring to her husband her financial share of educating their two children.  To renew her presently exhausted inventory, she's requesting a WAGES loan to order some overcasting thread, sewing machine thread, and some good-quality cloth and damask fabrics of different motifs.  

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Bai Georgette

texts.fr: Cette dame n’est pas mariée mais a un enfant à sa charge. Pour subvenir aux besoins de son enfant, elle vend depuis 2006 à Lomé dans le quartier Adidogomé des articles scolaires et des articles de bureau. Elle a une clientèle qui lui est fidèle. Elle reçoit des demandes de la part de certaines écoles privées, de certaines entreprises et sociétés. Elle a besoin de lancer de nouvelles commandes ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 50 paquets de cahiers de 300 pages, 30 paquets de cahier de 200 pages, 15 paquets de cahiers de 100 pages, 10 paquets de bics bleus, 10 paquets de bics rouges, 30 unité de règles à souligner, des surligneurs et autres articles ; ainsi que des bonbons.

loans.use: Achat des articles scolaires

loans.name: Essowedeou

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est marié et a un enfant à sa charge. C’est pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille que cet homme s’est lancé en 2007 dans le commerce de prêt-à-porter. Son commerce se situe tout juste à côté de la station d’essence Total d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Cette station est très fréquentée de beaucoup de personnes, car disposant d’une buvette. La plupart des jeunes filles visitant le coin en profite souvent pour jeter un coup d’œil sur ses étalages. A présent elle est très connue de beaucoup de clientes. Pour acheter 02 bals de prêt-à-porter, il sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour concrétiser ses intensions d’achat.
texts.en:
This gentleman is married and has a child in his care.  To provide for his family, he embarked on a ready-to-wear clothing business in 2007.  His business is located right next to the Total gas station of Adidogomé in Lomé.  This station is very busy with many people because it has a stand available for refreshments.  Most girls visiting in the neighborhood often take advantage of it to have a look at what he has on display.  It is now well-known to many customers.  To buy two bales of ready-to-wear clothing, he's requesting a WAGES loan to make his purchasing plans a reality. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two bales of clothing

loans.name: Kossivi

texts.fr: Cet homme fait un commerce assez particulier mais qui lui est très rentable ; il rachète des voitures abandonnées auprès des mécaniciens et en profite pour vendre des pièces détachées. Il a débuté cette activité depuis 2003 à Lomé dans le quartier d’Akodessewa. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il fait souvent des tours dans plusieurs garages de la capitale pour s’approvisionner en voitures d’occasions. C’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite un prêt de WAGES  pour acheter 03 voitures d’occasions. Il dispose d’une clientèle qui lui est fidèle.
texts.en:
This is a man who has a fairly unusual business, and it's very profitable for him:  he buys back old abandoned cars from mechanics and makes the best of them by selling the parts.  He started this business in 2003 in Lomé in the Akodessewa district.  It enables him to provide for his family.  He often makes a circuit of several garages in the capital to supply himself with used cars.  For this reason, he' requesting a WAGES loan to buy three use cars.  He has a loyal customer base. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three used cars

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr: Madame Fati est une dame qui a ouvert une grande boutique de vente de produits hétéroclites dans le quartier d’Agoè Zongo à Lomé. Elle a débuté cette activité depuis 2002 ; il est marié à un éleveur de bœufs. Le couple a 05 enfants à sa charge. C’est parce que les revenus du foyer n’arrivent plus à couvrir tous les besoins du couple que cette dame a décidé d’ouvrir cette boutique. Elle vend des cigarettes, des rasoirs, des produits désodorisants, des déodorants, des produits de beauté, des papiers de toilettes. C’est pour disposer d’un nouveau stock qu’elle voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 20 cartouches de cigarettes Fine, 15 cartouches de cigarette Yes, 05 cartons de produits désodorisants ainsi que d’autres produits manquants.

loans.use: Achat de cigarettes, de désodorisants et divers articles

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena owns a restaurant where she sells cooked food and drinks. She has been in the business since 1988. She is 51 years old and divorced with 4 children. She is hoping for a loan of N60000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She thanks all of her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase drinks to sell

loans.name: Precious Group

texts.en:
Olivia is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, all of whom are in school. She works hard to support her husband and help him to provide for the family. Olivia is the leader of a trust bank group called "Precious." 

The members of the group all work hard. They are engaged in commercial activities, such as selling food, groceries, and clothing. Some of them sell their products door-to-door ("hawking") while others trek to nearby communities to sell on their market days. They buy their goods in Kumasi and nearby towns. They have acquired a great deal of experience over the years and they want to expand their businesses, hence the need for the loan to buy goods in bulk to realize this dream. 

The group leader, Olivia, is seated in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy goods to sell

loans.name: Agwu

texts.en: J. is 40 years old and married with 5 children. She sells groceries, drinks, and body creams. She lives in Benin City. She is hoping for a loan of N60000 to purchase more drinks, groceries, and body creams.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Anna Asemota

texts.en: Anna sells yams and palm oil. She purchases the food from village markets. She has been in business since 1990. She is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She is hoping for a loan of N80000 to purchase more yams and palm oil. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more yams and palm oil to sell

loans.name: Mahmudjon

texts.ru: Махмуджон Шокиров проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 22 года. Холост, детей не имеет. В семье кроме него работает его отец. Махмуджон более 3 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Он в основном торгует женским ассортиментом. Кредит просит для закупа нового ассортимента.
texts.en:
Mahmudjon S. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. He is 22 years old, single and has no children. Besides Mahmudjon, his father is the only other working family member. Mahmudjon has been involved in retail sales at a market for over 3 years. He mainly sells women's goods. He is requesting a loan to purchase new goods selection.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new goods selection

loans.name: Alpha Group

texts.en: Grace is 48 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, who are all in school. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Grace is the leader of a trust bank group called Alpha. The members of the group are all hardworking. They are engaged in commercial activities such as food vending, provision selling, clothes selling, etc. Some of them hawk to sell their products while others trek to nearby communities to sell on their market days. They procure their stocks from Kumasi and nearby towns. They have acquired a great deal of experience over the years and they desire to expand their businesses, hence the need for the loan to buy goods in bulk to realize this dream. The group leader, Grace, is seated in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua is 29-years-old. She is married and has three children, and her son and two daughters attend school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the town of Konongo, in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family.

Akosua is a trader, and she trades second hand clothing for both men and women. She procures her goods from Kumasi, and she travels and treks to other towns to sell and trade. Akosua has been in business for two years. She would like a loan to procure bulk clothing to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bulk clothing

loans.name: Janibichi Group

texts.en:
Martha is a member of the  Janibichi borrower group in Mwanjewa, Mbeya, She is 48 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 28,25, and 22 years old.

Martha has owned a food business selling Tomatoes,potatoes for 8 years. She works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Martha`s  first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more potatoes, tomatoes etc.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Martha hopes to save more money and expand her business.


Hilda is another member of the same borrower group, she also requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, vegetable, potatoes

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is 52 years old and married with five children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. She hopes for the loan of N120,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola sells crates of drinks in wholesale and retail. She hopes for the loan of N140,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. Bola is 43 years old and married with four children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Maaga Group

texts.en:
Benita is a member of the Maaga borrower group in Mwanjelwa, Mbeya. She is 33  year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children.

Benita has owned a clothing business selling clothes for 4 years, she works 6 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 60,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Benita`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes fro sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Benita hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Rahee is another member of the same borrower group, she requested the loan amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is twenty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, both daughters and in school. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Vivian is a trader. She runs a provision store in her community and has been in business for five years. She procures her goods from Kumasi and wants a loan to procure provisions in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Adebimpe

texts.en: Adebimpe sells planks in retail to her customers. She hopes for loan amount of N120, 000 to purchase more planks to sell. Adebimpe is married and she is 44 years old and has four children. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Maaga Group

texts.en:
Neema is a member of the Maaga borrower group in  MWanjelwa, Mbeya. She is 35 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children.

Neema has owned a shop business for 4 years, she works 9 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 50,000 Tanzanian shillings.


This is Neema`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Neema hopes to save more money, pay school fess and expand her business.

Alatukemela is another member of the same borrower group, she also requested the loan amount of 100,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities like rice, cooking oil to her shop

loans.name: Dinpa Group

texts.en:
Eunice is forty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to three children who are in school. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Eunice lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is a trader. Vivian runs a provision store.

Eunice is the leader of a trust bank group called “Dinpa”, meaning good name. The members of the group are all hardworking. They are engaged in commercial activities such as food vending, provision selling, clothes selling, etc. Some of them hawk (go door-to-door) to sell their products while others trek to nearby communities to sell on their market days. They procure their stocks from Kumasi and nearby towns.

The members have acquired a great deal of experience over the years and they desire to expand their businesses, hence the need for the loan to buy goods in bulk to realize this dream. The group leader, Eunice, is seated in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Nike

texts.en: Nike is 32 years old and married with three children. She sells foodstuffs and frozen foods. She hopes for the loan of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and frozen foods to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and frozen foods to sell

loans.name: God Loves Us Group

texts.en:
God Loves Us is a group of five borrowers, led by Fayieh L., living and working in Westpoint, a very poor neighborhood near downtown Monrovia, Liberia.

Fayieh is 44 years old and married with four children aged 8 to 22. He also cares for his siblings and parents. He is a high school graduate.

Fayieh’s business is his pharmacy, buying medicines wholesale and selling to the residents of Westpoint in a small shop. He has been running his business for six years. His dream is to grow his business until he can build a larger permanent shop.

Fayieh is taking the loan to buy additional pharmaceutical drugs wholesale to serve his customers in Westpoint. With the profits from his business he dreams of sending his children to school and moving to a less dangerous neighborhood.

loans.use: To purchase medicines wholesale

loans.name: Janibichi Group

texts.en:
Jane is a member of the Janibichi borrower group in Mwanjelwa, Mbeya. She is  44 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 2  children. Her children are 22 and 17 years old.

Jane has owned a cafe business selling food for 5 years, she works  12  hours and she earns a monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Jane`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities to her cafe business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Jane hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Elizabeth is another member of the same borrower group, she also requested the amount  of 200,000 In order to expand her vegetable business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities like rice, wheat, cooking oil  for cafe

loans.name: Shafiq

texts.en:
Shafiq is 46 years old. He is married and has six children. He is a noble worker dedicated to raising animals, primarily cattle, which he buys and sells in the commercial city markets. This work is very agreeable to him, because raising animals is what he enjoys most.

Shafiq has asked for this loan to buy young cattle in order to obtain a better profit. He thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more cattle

loans.name: Bukky

texts.en:
Bukky is 39 years old and married with three children. She sells foodstuffs and drinks.

Bukky hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
Feliciana tiene 40 años, es una mujer muy alegre, vive en su casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos, que son el motivo de su esfuerzo. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora, sobre todo inclinada al comercio, ya que le gusta mucho conversar y hacer amistad con toda la gente. Su ocupación principal es la venta de frutas, lo hace todos los fines de semana en el mercado de su localidad, donde ha hecho mucha clientela y le va muy bien. Por otro lado, al ver la carencia de papelerías en su pueblo decidió implementar en su casa una pequeña librería llamada “Mananquiari” (nombre de su pueblo) y en el mismo ambiente vende algunas golosinas y productos que le solicitan sus clientes. A esta tienda se dedica de lunes a viernes y los fines de semana, mientras ella vende sus frutas, su esposo y su hija se quedan a cargo de la tienda, de ese modo, genera mayores ingresos económicos para la familia. 
Este su tercer préstamo con MFP y está predispuesta para pagar puntualmente sus cuotas como en sus créditos anteriores, además es la presidenta de su banco comunal y quiere ser ejemplo de responsabilidad. El dinero que viene solicitando lo piensa invertir en la compra de láminas ilustrativas didácticas, las cuales son muy demandadas por los niños para sus tareas escolares.
texts.en:
Feliciana, 40, is a very happy woman. She lives in her own house with her husband and their children. They are the reason for her efforts. She is a very enterprising woman. Above all, she is inclined towards commerce. She likes to chat a lot and make friends with people. Her primary occupation is selling fruit, which she does every week end in the town market. She has gained many customers, and it is going very well. Upon seeing the lack of stationery stores in her village, she decided to set up a small stationery store called “Manaquiari” (the name of her village) in her house. In the store she also sells sweets and other products her customers ask for. She works in the store Monday through Friday. On the week ends, while she is selling fruit, her husband and daughters are in charge of the store. This way they generate more income for the family. This is her third loan with MFP. She is prepared to make her payments punctually as she did with her previous loans. She is the president of her communal bank, and she wants to be an example of responsibility. The money she is asking for is to buy laminated educational sheets, which are in great demand by children to do their homework.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Nogaye

texts.fr: Nogaye  N. est une dame de 57 ans, mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle fait de l’embauche ovineet en même temps vend des mangues et des légumes. Son objectif est de renforcer son activité et de subvenir aux besoins sanitaires et scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Nogaye N. is a 57-year-old woman, married, and the mother of ten children.  Her work involves fattening sheep and, at the same time, selling mangoes and vegetables.  Her goal is to bolster her business and to provide for her children's health care and education. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For fattening sheep and for commerce in vegetables and mangoes

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo tiene 31 años, vive con la madre de sus 2 hijos y por el momento viven en la casa de su madre. Él es un operario de la hacienda “el naranjal”, donde trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, de lunes a viernes. Pero él ama mucho las labores agrícolas, por eso es que los fines de semana se dedica a sus propias chacras, ya que su sueldo no le es suficiente. Por tal motivo, en compañía de su esposa, trabajan podando con mucho cuidado sus cítricos y fumigando reiteradas veces para lograr cosechar productos sanos, los cuales envían a la ciudad de Lima en la temporada de verano. Los meses de enero a marzo son muy solicitados los frutos como la naranja y la mandarina, y por tener buen precio, Hugo reúne buena cantidad de dinero que le permite comprar algunos muebles para su hogar y vestimenta para sus hijos. Por ello, sus planes a futuro son de incrementar sus terrenos de cultivos.
Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, donde ha demostrado responsabilidad en sus pagos. La mayoría de las veces es su esposa quien se hace presente en las reuniones de su banco comunal, pues él se encuentra trabajando en la hacienda. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abonos y fungicidas para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Hugo is 31 years old, lives with the mother of his 2 children with whom he momentarily lives in his mother's house. He is a worker in the estate "El Naranjal" where he works Monday through Friday from 8 AM to 5 PM. However, Hugo likes agricultural activities very much so on the weekends he works on his own land since his salary is not enough. That is why he and his wife work pruning his citrus trees and fumigating several times in order to harvest healthy products, which is sent to Lima in the summer time. During the summer months of January through March, fruits such as oranges and mandarin oranges are in high demand. Because of the fruits' good prices, Hugo collects a good amount of money which allows him to purchase furniture for his home and clothing for his children. That is why his future plans are to increase his plot of land.

This is his third loan with MFP as he has shown to be responsible with his payments. Most of the time his wife is the one present in the meetings of his communal bank since he works at the estate. The money he's asking for will be used for the purchase of fertilizer and fungicide.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and fungicide

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana has been selling kitchen utensils for the past five years. She is 54 years old and married with four children. Christiana lives in Lagos State, Nigeria with her family. She hopes for loan of N150, 000 to purchase more kitchen utensils to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase  more kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Absa

texts.fr: Absa C. est une jeune femme de 32 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle fait un commerce de diverses denrées alimentaires. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer sa boutique en marchandises. Les revenus lui permettront d’assurer les soins de santé et la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Absa C. is a young woman, 32 years old, married, and the mother of six children.  She has a business involving diverse foods.  She's requesting this loan to replenish her store with merchandise.  The revenues will enable her to ensure she meets the health care and schooling needs of her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in a variety of foods

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.es:
Laxmi es una madre de 20 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, todos viven en su casa propia. Hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de combustible; tales como petróleo, gasolina y kerosén. Su negocio es reconocido por vender combustible sin ser adulterado, por ello reúne diariamente hasta 280 soles de ganancia. Para abastecerse Laxmi viaja cada tres días a la localidad donde se ubica el grifo que le provee dicho combustible a menor precio y de ese modo ella puede venderlo a un precio módico, por lo que todos sus clientes la prefieren. Laxmi se siente muy contenta con su negocio, aun más porque su esposo acondicionó los cilindros de combustible en un lugar apropiado para que ella no cargue mucho peso, así como para evitar la contaminación de sus hijos.
Anteriormente sus préstamos eran a nombre de su esposo, pero ella asistía a todas las reuniones del banco comunal, en vista de ello decidieron cambiar la titularidad de crédito, pues Laxmi se siente muy compenetrada con el grupo. Además es la tesorera y se encarga mensualmente de realizar las cobranzas. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de cilindros y más combustible.
texts.en:
Laxmi is 20 years old, married and mother of 2 children, and the whole family lives her own house. For the past 2 years she has dedicated her professional career to the sale of fuel like petroleum, gasoline, and kerosene. Her business is known for selling unadulterated fuel, and for this she earns about 280 Soles per day in profits. For supplies, Laxmi travels every three days to the location where the tap is located that provides said fuel at the lowest price, and in this way she is able to sell it at a modest price. Because of this all of her clients prefer doing business with her. Laxmi is very content with her business, and even more because her husband primes the cylinders for the fuel in an appropriate location so that she does not have to bear so much weight and so that she does not contaminate her children. In the past her loans were under her husband's name, but she attended all of the meetings of the community bank and because of this decided to change the ownership of the loan and Laxmi feels very much a part of the group. Futhermore, she is the treasurer and she is in charge of the monthly collections. The money that she is requesting she will invest in the purchase of cylinders and more fuel.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her commodities and purchasing cylinders

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
Olinda tiene 31 años, vive con su pareja y sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. Hace 6 años implementó una pequeña bodega en su vivienda y durante todo este tiempo viene atendiendo amablemente a sus clientes, debido a ello se ha hecho muy conocida y la preferida de su pueblo y esto le causa mucha alegría. Pero últimamente tiene dificultades económicas porque la mayoría de sus clientes le compran al crédito, pagándole a fin de mes y mientras tanto sus estantes se ven vacíos. Por ello, su esposo con anhelos de apoyarla trabaja como jornalero agrícola desde la madrugada, pese a eso no le alcanza el sueldo. Entonces Olinda, en aras de incrementar su tienda y tenerla atractiva, los fines de semana prepara comida para vender en la puerta de su casa y así captar más dinero.
Es así que acude a este tercer préstamo con MFP, sus anteriores créditos los pagó responsablemente, además se siente muy cómoda en su banco comunal y con sus funciones de secretaria en éste. Con el dinero solicitado comprará productos comestibles para su negocio y de ese modo seguir trabajando alegremente.
texts.en:
Olinda is 31 years old and lives with her partner and their 5 children in their own house. Six years ago, she started a small grocery store out of her home. During this time, her business became well-known and favorite establishment in her town because of the friendly attention she gives to her customers. Lately, her customers have been buying on credit and paying at the end of the month because of financial difficulties. Meanwhile her shelves remain empty. Her partner works in the early morning hours on a farm, but his salary is not enough to cover their expenses. In order to restock her store and keep it attractive, Olinda prepares food on the weekends and sells it from her house in order to generate more income.

This will be her third loan from MFP. Olinda repaid her previous loans responsibly and she is very comfortable with her Communal Bank and her role as the group secretary. The money she requested will be used to buy more food products for her business to keep it running smoothly.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Aïda

texts.fr: Aïda F. est une femme de 33 ans, mariée et mère de 9 enfants. Elle tient une boutique de divers articles et fait en même temps de l’élevage. Son activité lui permet d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aïda F. is a 33-year-old woman, married, and the mother of nine children. She has a store with a variety of goods and, at the same time, she raises livestock. Her business enables her to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retail business of various goods

loans.name: Primitivo

texts.es:
Primitivo es un hombre muy laborioso de 32 años, vive con la madre de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde pequeño se ha dedicado a la agricultura y le gusta mucho esta actividad. En esta temporada viene trabajando como operario para otros agricultores. Cuando le pagan por día gana 15 soles, pero en caso de ser un contrato para limpiar chacras enteras le pagan entre 250 y 280 soles, dependiendo de la copiosidad de los arbustos. Por ello, la mayoría de veces, opta por trabajar con su esposa para agilizar las faenas y de ese modo tomen otras contratas para obtener mayores ganancias que cubran la alimentación y educación de sus hijos. Sin embargo, durante los meses de enero a marzo trabaja en sus propias plantas cítricas, mientras que su esposa, en casa, va encajonando las naranjas, ya que todos los miércoles por la noche el camión llega a su pueblo para transportar los productos a uno de los principales mercados de la ciudad de Lima.
Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, nunca ha tenido problemas de pago, por lo contrario, se ha ganado el respeto y aprecio de los integrantes de su banco comunal, por ello lo nombraron presidente y él muy contento aceptó dicho cargo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de abono y pesticidas para sus chacras.

loans.use: Compra de abono y pesticidas

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto tiene 29 años, vive con su pareja y madre de su hijo y desde hace poco tiempo ya tienen una casa propia. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado al cultivo de plátanos y frutas cítricas como las naranjas y guanábanas, ya que estos frutos le permiten mantener a su familia. Por ello, desde muy temprano acude a sus chacras para abonarlas, limpiarlas y podarlas. Los plátanos los cosecha semanalmente y los vende por arrobas (12 kilos) entre 6 a 7 soles desde su misma chacra,  evitándose pagar el traslado al mercado. En el caso de los cítricos, la mayor inversión es el fumigado contra los mosquitos, en este caso, en los meses de enero a marzo los envía a un mercado de la ciudad de Lima donde le cotizan a un buen precio y eso le causa mucha alegría. Por ello está planeando comprar otras tierras donde pueda incrementar sus cultivos. 
Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, es por ello que renueva su compromiso de pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas y de ese modo no perjudicar a su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará abono para sus cultivos de plátano y los cítricos.

loans.use: Compra de abono

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy N. est une dame de 52 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce d’habits, de chaussures et d’articles de beauté. Elle projette de renforcer son activité pour mieux aider à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Amy N. is a 52-year-old lady, married, and the mother of six children. She is active in the commerce of clothing, shoes, and beauty products. She plans to bolster her business in order to help further in improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retail business in various goods

loans.name: Balikis

texts.en:
Balikis is 30 years old and married with two children. She started her fashion shop eight years ago. She also sells tailoring materials.

Balikis hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase a weaving machine and tailoring materials. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and a weaving machine

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 35 years old and married with two children. She sells provisions and has been in this business for two years.

Victoria hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Alfonsa

texts.es: La señora Alfonsa vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos en la calle Heroes del Chaco Nº 29 en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz, comercializa polleras y mantas las que confecciona con ayuda de sus hijos para luego venderlas en las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y sus provincias. El objetivo del crédito es la compra de mas material para aumentar su  producción de polleras y mantas y mejorar sus ingresos.

loans.use: Compra de telas, hilos, etc., para su negocio de confección y venta de polleras y mantas.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
El señor Freddy vive en anticrético con sus hermanas en la calle 9 Av. Diego de Peralta Nº 1019 Z/ Agua de la vida alto Miraflores de la ciudad de la Paz; trabaja en una consultora como auxiliar contable, con este trabajo el ayuda a sus hermanas que estudian y trabajan.
El motivo del crédito es que Freddy necesita el dinero para aumentar su anticrético y realizar un nuevo contrato con el dueño de casa por que el monto del anticrético subió y el sueldo no le alcanza  para completar la suma que necesita para renovar el contrato. 

Es la primera vez que Freddy solicita un crédito a través de IMPRO, pero el análisis socio económico permite ver su capacidad de pago.

loans.use: Aumento de anticrético en el lugar donde vive.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora Maria vive en casa de su madre junto a su hija, en la calle 1  Nº 633 en la zona de Las Lomas  de la ciudad de La Paz; la señora es maestra de escuela y trabaja por las mañanas y percibe un sueldo mensual. El objetivo del crédito es cubrir los costos de instalación del servicio de  gas a domicilio, lo cual reducirá sus gastos mensuales del uso de gas para cocinar, pues actualmente ella compra gas por garrafa y es más caro.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria lives with her mother and her daughter in their own home, which is located on #1 No. 633 Street in the Las Lomas district in the city of La Paz. She is a school teacher who works in the mornings and receives a monthly salary. This loan will cover the cost of installing gas service into her home. This will reduce her monthly costs of using gas for cooking because buying gas by the tank is more expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay the cost of installing gas service for her home

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: La señora Marlene vive en anticretico junto a sus padres y su hija,  en la calle Tomas Rodríguez Nº 46 de la ciudad de La Paz; la señora vende masitas en los colegios todos los días a pedido, trabaja junto a su madre la cual le ayuda en la venta de las mismas; el objetivo del crédito es para comprar más harina, azúcar y otros ingredientes  para aumentar su  producción y  la venta de las masitas para obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Sra. Marlene lives in a rental property with her parents and her daughter on #46 Tomas Rodríguez Street in the city of La Paz. She sells cookies on demand every day at the high schools. She works with her mother, who helps with making sales.

This loan will be used to buy more flour, sugar, and other ingredients to increase her cookie production and sales, which will improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar, and other ingredients for making cookies

loans.name: Jumoke

texts.en: Jumoke is 63 years old and married with six children. She sells crates of drinks and hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Chisley

texts.es:
La señora Chisley, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 30 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Hace 03 años, que Chisley decidió vender sus anticuchos en una esquina de su casa, ella nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados y muy buena acogida. 
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, a partir de las 5:00 de la tarde, esta preparada para atender a sus clientes, con una sonrisa alegre y con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como: arroz y azúcar en kilos; aceites en paquetes, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Chisley, se siente muy bien con el trabajo que realiza, nos cuenta que tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propio restaurant en un local muy bien acondicionado y al mismo tiempo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Chisley is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Valerosas II” (Courageous Women II), which is located in the District of Tarapoto, Province of San Martín, Department of San Martín. She is 30 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 2 dependent children.

Three years ago, she decided to sell “anticuchos” on the corner outside of her house. She tells us that sales have been good and that her food has been well-received because of its rich flavor and careful preparation. She continues with her business and is very pleased with the work she does every day. Chisley begins serving at 5pm and welcomes her customers with a cheerful smile and a charismatic personality.

With her loan of 2000 soles, she will buy supplies for her daily food preparation such as rice and sugar in kilos, oil, cases of chickens, as well as utensils that will keep her business running and help her provide better service to her customers.

Chisley feels very good about her business. She tells us that she has many dreams and goals in life, such as opening a restaurant in good condition. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for preparing food

loans.name: Pepe

texts.es:
Pepe es chofer de trufi 88 del sindicato Eduardo Abaroa, grupo Correcaminos, su esposa es comerciante tiene un puesto en la ceja ciudad de el Alto, siendo así su fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos que depende de ellos; los hijos todavía se encuentran estudiando y no pueden ayudar o colaborar con los quehaceres de la casa; vive en casa propia ubicada en la Zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de motor para su movilidad y así poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos, o al menos mantenerlos.
 
Es sexto crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Pepe.
texts.en:
Pepe is the driver of minibus #88 for the Eduardo Abaroa trade union and a member of the group “Correcaminos” (Roadrunners). His wife is a businesswoman who has a vending post on the outskirts of the city of El Alto. Their incomes support their three dependent children, who are still studying and not able to help with the household chores. Pepe and his family live in their own home in the district of Llojeta in the city of La Paz.

His loan will be used to buy a motor for his vehicle. This will help him improve his earnings, or at least keep them at the same level.

This is Pepe’s sixth loan with IMPRO. His evaluation indicates he is qualified for a loan approval.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a motor for his taxi

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 42 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Rosita, se dedica a la venta de anticuchos, ella nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, los vende en una carretilla, ambulado por las los diferentes lugres de la Ciudad y por su sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, tiene muy buena acogida. 
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, a partir de las 6:00 pm de la tarde. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma alegre que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios, para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, nos cuenta que tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propio restaurant en un local bien acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the Mujeres Valerosas II Comunal Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 42, married, and has three dependent children. Rosita sells kebobs. She has very good daily sales. She sells from a cart on the streets in different locations in the city. She is very well received because of the good seasoning she gives her food. She is currently in the same business, and she is very happy with the work she does day to day starting at 6:00 p.m. She personally waits on her customers with her characteristic happy charisma. With this loan for 500 PEN she will buy supplies like kilos of rice and sugar, gallons of oil, and crates of eggs for daily food preparation. She will also buy some utensils to set up her business and give her customers better attention. She feels full of life with the desire to get ahead. She has many dreams and goals in her life like to set up her own restaurant in a well equipped location. At the same time she also is grateful the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the start up of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food preparation

loans.name: Ayda

texts.es:
Ayda es comerciante de víveres que da al crédito, azucar, harina, aroz y aceite, tiene dos hijos, uno de 4 años y otro de seis meses, su esposo es policía y actualmente está trabajando en el interior del país (ciudad de Santa Cruz); estas dos actividades son sus fuentes de ingreso con que cubren la manutención de sus dos hijos que depende de ellos; vive en casa propia ubicada en la Zona de Río Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de mercadería (azúcar, arroz y otros) y así poder vender más y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
 
Es el tercer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Ayda.

loans.use: compra de azucar, arroz y otros al por mayor para su posterior venta al crédito.

loans.name: Teolith

texts.es:
La señora Teolith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 57 años, es madre de 02 hijos, todos ya independientes.

Teolith, lleva años 15 dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo así implementar su taller de confección de vestidos mas establecido y teniendo la habilidad  para la costura, no dudo en hacerlo y con el apoyo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, decidió implementar su propio negocio ubicado en su misma casa.

Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus costuras, trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan. A quienes les  atiende  con la amabilidad y el carisma  que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 400.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grande y de variados colores, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Teolith, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Teolith is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Valerosas II” (Courageous Women II), which is located in the District of Tarapoto, Province of San Martín, Department of San Martín. She is 57 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children who are financially independent.

Teolith has been making clothes for 15 years. Over time, she started generating her own income and saving money. She wanted to start a dressmaking shop and utilize her sewing ability, so she did not hesitate in seeking assistance from Manuela Ramos with starting a home-based business.

She tells us that she receives several orders in advance from customers requesting clothing. She attends to her clients with a friendly and charismatic personality.

With her loan of 400 soles, Teolith will buy meters of fabric in different styles and colors, scissors, large spools of thread in various colors, regular and sewing machine needles, pins, and buttons.

Teolith feels that now she is a very accomplished woman with more desire to achieve and fulfill her other dreams. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and supporting other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.es:
Fernanda tiene su casa propia en la zona de Ciudad Satelite de la  Ciudad de El Alto; es comerciante y tiene su tienda de abarrotes, el esposo es artesano en masitas elabora salteñas, empanadas y rollos de queso que los comercializa en la tienda que tiene su esposa; es de estas actividades de donde provienen sus ingresos económicos que le permite cubrir la manutención de su familia (cuatro hijos).

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de materia prima para elaborar sus productos y también para la compra de mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes.
 
Es el segundo crédito vía Kiva, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Fernanda has her own home in the Ciudad Satelite district of the city of El Alto. She is a businesswoman who manages her own grocery store. Her husband is a pastry chef who makes salteñas, empanadas, and cheese rolls that are sold in Fernanda’s store. Her business provides the income that enables her to support her family of four children.

This loan will be used to purchase ingredients for her husband to make his products. She will also buy merchandise for her grocery store.

This is Fernanda’s second loan through Kiva. Her good payment history allows her to be approved for another loan.

Click HERE to view Fernanda’s previous loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for the grocery store & ingredients for making pastries

loans.name: Eliovina

texts.es:
La señora Eliovina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 50 años y es madre de 03 hijos, todos ya independientes.

Lleva 01 año dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, brindando servicios de movilidad urbana en su motokar. Para trabajarlo, su esposo se encarga de trasladarse por diferentes lugares de la Ciudad. Poco a poco fue ahorrando y con ese dinero fue comprando repuestos, para mejorar el servicio a los moradores de la comunidad.

 Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800.00,  comprará repuestos y aceites como: lubricantes, bocamasas, bujías; para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente.
Hoy en día es una mujer independiente, y es ella y su esposo quienes toman las decisiones y administran su negocio.

Eliovina nos cuenta: Que esta muy agredecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, y el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas.

loans.use: Comprará repuestos y lubricantes.

loans.name: Sarina

texts.es:
Sarina vive en la casa de sus suegros en la zona de 16 de Julio de la Ciudad de El Alto; es madre soltera de un hijo, tiene un puesto de comida al horno (lecho de cerdo y pollo) que elabora ella misma, siendo esta  es su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de su pequeño hijo.

El crédito lo destinará para incrementar mercadería y compra de algunos utensilios de cocina, lo cual  le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Es el tercer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por la cliente.
texts.en:
Sarina lives in the home of her in-laws in the July 16 District of the city of El Alto. She is a single mother of 1 child. She manages a food stand where sells roasted pork and chicken that she prepares herself. This business is the main source of income that enables her to support her young son.

Her loan will be used to purchase ingredients and a few cooking utensils, which will help her improve her earnings.

This is Sarina’s third loan with IMPRO. Her evaluation indicates that she is approved for this loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pork, chicken, and cooking utensils

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene una tienda de abarrotes, el esposo es transportista publico asalariado, es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus cuatro hijos que depende de la pareja; vive en casa propia ubicada en la Zona Cotahuma de la Ciudad de La Paz.


El crédito lo destinará para incrementar su capital de trabajo (compra de mercadería para la tienda de abarrotes), para poder surtir su mercadería.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Carmen operates a grocery store. Her husband is a salaried public transportation driver. Her business is the main source of income that enables her to support her four dependent children. Her family lives in their own home in the Cotahuma district of the city of La Paz.

This loan will be used as operating capital to purchase merchandise to restock her grocery store.

This is Carmen’s first loan with IMPRO. Her evaluation indicates she is approved for this loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to restock her store

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Ana Gloria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 41 años y es madre de 02 hijos, 2 que todavía depende de ella.
Ana Gloria, nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00, motivada por su pareja; emprendiendo su negocio de servicio de Renovadora de Calzados, ubicada en una parte céntrica de la ciudad; donde se dedica al arreglo y mejoramiento de zapatos.
En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, cuenta con un puesto alquilado, donde atiende a diario a su clientes fijos, que ya conocen el tipo de actividad que realiza.
 
Se siente mejor ahora, que en sus inicios, mas segura al ofrecer sus servicios y al mismo tiempo mas constante y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00 comprará plantillas y suelas para zapatos; una máquina de coser de segunda mano; hilos, agujas y tiras de diferentes tamaños y modelos.

Ana Gloria, esta muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos, por haberme apoyado en la meta que quería realizar, espero que sigan así ayudando a más mujeres.

loans.use: Comprará materiales, para realizar sus trabajos.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona de Villa Dolores de la Ciudad de El Alto, tiene una tienda de venta de comida (almuerzo y platos extras) que ella misma elabora; su negocio genera empleo pues tiene una ayudante de cocina, siendo esta actividad su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre su manutención.

El crédito lo destinará para incrementar la compra de mercadería y compra de algunos utensilios de cocina, lo cual  le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Lourdes lives in her parents’ home in the Villa Dolores district in the city of El Alto. She has a shop where she sells prepared foods (lunches and à la carte dishes). Her business has generated employment because she hired a kitchen assistant. Her business is the main source of income that enables her to cover her living expenses.

Her loan will be used to purchase supplies and a few kitchen utensils. These items will help improve her revenues.

This is Lourdes’ first loan with IMPRO. Her evaluation indicated she qualified for approval of this loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies & kitchen utensils

loans.name: Dany

texts.es:
La señora Dany, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 37 años, tiene 03 hijos que aun depende de ella.

Dany, es una mujer joven que le gusta trabajar, nos cuenta que por iniciativa propia, decidió dedicarse a la venta de salchipapas, lleva 05 años dedicándose al negocio y con el fin de contribuir con los ingresos económicos de su hogar, con su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos y con el apoyo de su pareja compraron su carrito salchipapero y luego; poco a poco fue comprando sus utensilios y materiales para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.  

Actualmente, sigue con la venta de salchipapa y comidas, en una esquina donde hay bastante movimiento y cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, empieza a vender  a partir de las 5:30 de la tarde, ya que a esa hora ya hay clientes que desean probar un aperitivo, es ella misma quien los atiende con esa amabilidad y carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará, pollos en javas, sacos de papas, paquetes de aceites y algunos utensilios de cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. 

Dany, esta muy segura que su negocio prosperara mas de lo que ahora esta y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Doña Dany is a member of "Banco Comunal "Las Orquídeas", District of Tarapoto, Province San Martín, Department of San Martín. She lives with her significant other, is 37 years old, and has 3 children who still depend on her.

Dany is a lady who enjoys work, she tells us that on her own iniciative she decided to sell "salchipapas" (hotdogs and chips) for a living and has done so for 5 years. In order to contribute to the family's economic income, with her first loan of jS/.300.00 from Movimiento Manuela Ramos and with the support of her partner, they bought her "salchipapas" cart and then little by little she bought her utensils and material to offer better service to her customers.

Presently she continues selling "salchipapa" and meals on a very popular corner and she tells us that sales are fine. She starts selling at 5:30 p.m., time when customers need a snack, she herself attends to her clients with politeness and charisma.

With this loan of S/.1,500.00 she will buy "javas" of chicken, sacks of potatoes, packs of cooking oil, and some kitchen utensils to replace the ones she has now and thus offer better service to her customers.

Dany is certain that her business will succeed better than at the present and is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to making her dreams come true and reaching her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for food preparation.

loans.name: Diomar Soledad

texts.en:
Previous loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=97743&_tpos=f&_tpg=h
Diomar is a member of the United Friends village bank.
Diomar is separated, and has a 28-year-old daughter who studies at university and works. Diomar has been making her living by selling beauty products via catalogue for several years. 
Recently, her clients have increased and she has a showcase in her house where she displays her products. Now she is able to buy more products. 
Diomar needs a new loan of 2000 soles to buy discounted beauty products which she then sells at a normal price to make a higher profit. Her dream is to continue selling and eventually have her own shop.

loans.use: buy discounted beauty products which she then sells at a normal price to make a higher profit

loans.name: Bummi

texts.en: Bummi is 40 years old and married with four children. She sells ladies' handbags and sarongs to make a living. She has been in this business for a long time. Bummi is requesting the loan amount of 140,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana trabaja junto con su esposo como comerciante, tiene un puesto de venta de periódicos en la zona 12 de octubre de la ciudad de El Alto, es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos que depende de la pareja; vive en anticretico ubicado en la Zona Villa Mercedario de la ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinará para incrementar su anticrético, de esa forma podrá generar un ahorro en vez de pagar alquiler de su vivienda.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el prestamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Ana works together with her husband in sales. She has a newspaper stand in the zone "12 de octubre" of the town of El Alto. It is her main income source with which she pays maintenance of their three children who depend on them. She lives in a rented house (*anticrético) located in the Zona Villa Mercedario of the town of El Alto.

The loan will be spend on increasing the "anticrético" in order to increase savings instead of paying rent.

This is her first loan with Impro, and the loan has been approved according to the evaluation of the borrower. (* "anticrético" = A deposit is given, a contract for a certain period of time is signed, and when leaving the property the deposit is returned to the tenant)

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase payment of "anticretico" on rented house.

loans.name: Lita

texts.es:
La señora Lita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 39 años y 02 hijos que dependen de ella y son la razón por a cual se esfuerza día a día. 

Teniendo la profesión de Técnica en Industrias Textiles, no dudo en implementar su propio taller de costura, en un local muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa, lleva 03 años dedicándose a la Confección de Vestidos, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. Con el trabajo que realiza esta muy contenta, por que le gusta y así genera sus propios ingresos para aportar en su hogar.
Nos cuenta que le va muy bien en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente.

Uno de sus sueños y metas por lograr, es implementar su propio taller de confección de vestidos y comprar su remalladora.

En la actualidad continua con sus confecciones de vestidos y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su casa para realizar sus trabajos y pedidos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes géneros, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones.
